40e11136-deb4-4f10-b28f-ef4e49b8f82d
Lower the heat to medium and cook (uncovered to reduce and concentrate the sauce) for eight to 10 minutes.
40e11136-deb4-4f10-b28f-ef4e49b8f82d
Spread the snow peas, bell pepper and onion slices over the chicken. Cook for three to four minutes.
40e11136-deb4-4f10-b28f-ef4e49b8f82d
Pour the stirred eggs over the chicken. Do this in a circular motion so that the eggs are spread evenly. Stir lightly.
40e11136-deb4-4f10-b28f-ef4e49b8f82d
Scoop the chicken, vegetables and egg over cooked rice.
79cbb59a-80e6-4d2b-89d4-40d930cbeb31
c3b197b7-1784-47a0-9010-0c0b768d6d56
830c4ce8-4fe6-4749-b8d2-b26f42834763
Halve the shelled salted eggs, dump into a mixing bowl and press with a fork until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
830c4ce8-4fe6-4749-b8d2-b26f42834763
Halve the tomatoes, scoop out and discard the seeds. Cut the tomatoes into cubes smaller than ¼ inch.
830c4ce8-4fe6-4749-b8d2-b26f42834763
Finely chop the chili, if using.
830c4ce8-4fe6-4749-b8d2-b26f42834763
Thinly slice the scallions.
830c4ce8-4fe6-4749-b8d2-b26f42834763
Wrap one heaping teaspoon of the filling with the spring roll wrapper (see illustrated guide on how to wrap spring rolls). Repeat until all the filling has been used.
830c4ce8-4fe6-4749-b8d2-b26f42834763
In a fryer, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least three inches.
830c4ce8-4fe6-4749-b8d2-b26f42834763
Fry the spring rolls (in batches if necessary) until browned and crisp. Drain on paper towels.
830c4ce8-4fe6-4749-b8d2-b26f42834763
Half fill bowls with rice, top with spring rolls and serve, optionally, with lettuce and cucumber on the side.
830c4ce8-4fe6-4749-b8d2-b26f42834763
Recommended dipping sauce: Vietnamese mixed fish sauce.
24cb0c8e-55fa-4b21-bcd9-4251def02ff9
e46a4fc4-ec5a-4973-949d-f2e633c8a374
Wipe the fish fillets with paper towels and rub generously with salt and pepper. Keep in a covered container in the fridge for at least an hour to allow the seasonings to be absorbed.
e46a4fc4-ec5a-4973-949d-f2e633c8a374
Place the cornstarch, beaten egg and panko in three separate shallow bowls.
e46a4fc4-ec5a-4973-949d-f2e633c8a374
Heat your fryer (heating before pouring in the oil prevents food from sticking to the metal) then pour in enough oil to reach a depth of about three inches.
e46a4fc4-ec5a-4973-949d-f2e633c8a374
Take the fish fillets out of the fridge. Dredge each one in flour, dip in egg then roll in panko to cover every inch of the surface. If you need a visual guide, see my tonkatsu recipe. It's the same procedure except you're using fillets here instead of pork.
e46a4fc4-ec5a-4973-949d-f2e633c8a374
Over medium heat, fry the fish fillets until the crust is golden and the fish flesh just cooked through. Depending on the size of the fillets, this can take anywhere from six to eight minutes.
e46a4fc4-ec5a-4973-949d-f2e633c8a374
Scoop out the fried fish and rest on a rack.
e46a4fc4-ec5a-4973-949d-f2e633c8a374
Mix together all the ingredients for the sauce.
e46a4fc4-ec5a-4973-949d-f2e633c8a374
Ladle hot rice into bowls. Arrange a fillet on top. Add shredded cabbage on the side. Drizzle sauce over the fish and serve.
84e5ecd9-0c7c-4995-8a5d-c7aea5885538
Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan.
84e5ecd9-0c7c-4995-8a5d-c7aea5885538
Spread the sausage meat in the hot oil. Over high heat, leave for a minute for the underside to brown.
84e5ecd9-0c7c-4995-8a5d-c7aea5885538
Stir the sausage meat and cook, stirring often, until you see rendered fat in the pan.
84e5ecd9-0c7c-4995-8a5d-c7aea5885538
Add the chopped carrot and shallots, and sweet peas. Sprinkle with a little salt and pepper. Continue cooking with occasional stirring for about a minute.
84e5ecd9-0c7c-4995-8a5d-c7aea5885538
Stir in the chopped tomatoes and oregano. Lower the heat, cover the pan and cook until the carrots are almost and the tomatoes have softened.
84e5ecd9-0c7c-4995-8a5d-c7aea5885538
Stir in the quail eggs. Cover the pan once more and cook for another minute or two to allow the quail eggs to soak up the flavors of the sausage meat.
84e5ecd9-0c7c-4995-8a5d-c7aea5885538
Taste your ground pork menudo; add more salt and pepper, if necessary.
84e5ecd9-0c7c-4995-8a5d-c7aea5885538
Scoop rice into bowl, top with ground pork menudo, making sure everyone gets enough quail eggs, sprinkle with sliced scallions and serve at once.
fd10a5f2-4af9-4263-9cb1-a2aad643487c
Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan.
fd10a5f2-4af9-4263-9cb1-a2aad643487c
Cook the chicken until browned and cooked through, about six to seven minutes. If the chicken skin renders too much fat, you can pour off the fat and leave only a teaspoonful of so in the pan.
fd10a5f2-4af9-4263-9cb1-a2aad643487c
Stir together the hoisin sauce, peanut butter, lime or lemon juice, chili flakes (or powder or paste), fish sauce and sesame seed oil. Pour into the pan and stir everything together.
b872ca0d-2037-4a0c-90ae-253761f89e98
Place the shrimps in a bowl. Add the grated ginger, a tablespoonful of soy sauce, a drizzle of rice wine, a tablespoonful of starch and a drizzle of sesame seed oil. Mix well. Set aside.
b872ca0d-2037-4a0c-90ae-253761f89e98
In a small bowl, make the sauce by mixing together the oyster sauce, sugar, shrimp broth, a tablespoonful of starch and a tablespoonful of light soy sauce.
b872ca0d-2037-4a0c-90ae-253761f89e98
Pour the remaining cooking oil into the pan. When starting to smoke, spread the marinated shrimps in a single layer. Do not move them for half a minute or so. Flip over and brown the opposite side for another half a minute.
b872ca0d-2037-4a0c-90ae-253761f89e98
Add the garlic, sliced black fungus, cucumber and eggs to the shrimps. Stir fry for half a minute.
b872ca0d-2037-4a0c-90ae-253761f89e98
Serve the moo shu shrimp over hot rice.
8db7af0e-c732-4e17-89fb-b2dc55056364
a40b2c40-b43c-4daf-bcb9-a7b83c94efb6
Wipe the chicken thigh fillets and cut into chunks. Toss with 1 ½ teaspoons salt and all of the pepper. Marinate in the fridge for eight hours or overnight.
a40b2c40-b43c-4daf-bcb9-a7b83c94efb6
Place lemon juice, orange juice, zests, ½ teaspoon salt and all of the sugar in a sauce pan. Boil, uncovered, for ten minutes or until reduced by half and syrupy. Set aside to cool.
a40b2c40-b43c-4daf-bcb9-a7b83c94efb6
In a pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least three inches.
a40b2c40-b43c-4daf-bcb9-a7b83c94efb6
Place the chicken in a resealable bag, add the starch, seal and shake to coat each piece lightly.
a40b2c40-b43c-4daf-bcb9-a7b83c94efb6
Over medium heat, fry the chicken in batches until lightly browned, about four minutes per batch.
a40b2c40-b43c-4daf-bcb9-a7b83c94efb6
Turn up the heat to high, refry the chicken for one to two minutes until golden and crisp.
a40b2c40-b43c-4daf-bcb9-a7b83c94efb6
Place the chicken a mixing bowl. Drizzle in the cooled sauce and toss to coat each piece well.
a40b2c40-b43c-4daf-bcb9-a7b83c94efb6
Serve the lemon orange chicken immediately.
00759939-15ea-41ba-a0b4-96c7c13c01f4
7034d29e-f130-45b6-82ad-f59998a202b4
Pat the pork steaks dry with paper towels. Sprinkle both sides generously with salt and pepper.
7034d29e-f130-45b6-82ad-f59998a202b4
Melt the ¼ cup butter in a heavy skillet (cast iron is ideal) large enough to contain all three pork steaks in a single layer.
7034d29e-f130-45b6-82ad-f59998a202b4
Sear both sides of the pork steaks in the hot butter.
7034d29e-f130-45b6-82ad-f59998a202b4
Pour in half a cup of water, lower the heat, cover the skillet and let the pork steaks cook until the liquid has gone dry (see notes after the recipe). There is no need to flip the pork steaks over.
7034d29e-f130-45b6-82ad-f59998a202b4
Lift the pork steaks and transfer to a plate. Keep hot.
7034d29e-f130-45b6-82ad-f59998a202b4
Over low heat, melt the remaining butter in the pan.
7034d29e-f130-45b6-82ad-f59998a202b4
Whisk together the spicy mustard and honey.
7034d29e-f130-45b6-82ad-f59998a202b4
When the butter is bubbly, pour in the mustard-honey mixture and make sure to scrape the bottom of the pan.
7034d29e-f130-45b6-82ad-f59998a202b4
Scoop rice into three bowls and top each with a pork steak.
7034d29e-f130-45b6-82ad-f59998a202b4
Spoon enough spicy mustard and honey sauce over the pork steaks so that the sauce drips into the rice.
7034d29e-f130-45b6-82ad-f59998a202b4
Optionally, garnish with mint leaves before serving.
d954a652-1e5f-4f91-ab91-7f45ea9119e1
Cut the pork loin into half-inch cubes.
d954a652-1e5f-4f91-ab91-7f45ea9119e1
In a bowl, combine the fish sauce and oyster sauce. Add the pork and mix well. Cover, refrigerate and marinate for at least an hour.
d954a652-1e5f-4f91-ab91-7f45ea9119e1
Cut off and discard the top part (with the stem) of the chilies. Split in the chilies in half, scrape off and discard the seeds (unless you want your dish to be super spicy) before mincing.
d954a652-1e5f-4f91-ab91-7f45ea9119e1
Add the pork. Stir then spread them out in a single layer. When the pork changes color, flip them over.
d954a652-1e5f-4f91-ab91-7f45ea9119e1
Add a cup of water. Stir. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Turn up the heat and allow to boil uncovered to reduce the liquid.
d954a652-1e5f-4f91-ab91-7f45ea9119e1
Add the mushrooms to the pork, stir, and place a sprig of basil on top. Cover the pan tightly.
d954a652-1e5f-4f91-ab91-7f45ea9119e1
Count ten seconds then turn off the heat. Wait ten minutes before lifting the cover. The pork should be done at this point.
d954a652-1e5f-4f91-ab91-7f45ea9119e1
Scoop out the contents of the pan and transfer to a shallow bowl. Optionally, garnish with fried shallots and cilantro before serving.
128396a0-83ff-4a80-9047-962d29297845
08cc6e8a-ec4b-4ede-b062-a1f942978b0d
6f418c5c-29e3-41d6-ad3a-db4241a6eff8
6f418c5c-29e3-41d6-ad3a-db4241a6eff8
7439677c-7907-4cf3-be0b-645eafdb4308
7439677c-7907-4cf3-be0b-645eafdb4308
de19eb5f-45c1-4007-b692-5ef024fcd0f7
Rinse the pork and pat dry with a kitchen towel. Drying the meat is essential for the browning stage.
de19eb5f-45c1-4007-b692-5ef024fcd0f7
Cut the pork into two-inch pieces.
de19eb5f-45c1-4007-b692-5ef024fcd0f7
Smash the garlic and discard the skins. Finely chop or mince the garlic.
de19eb5f-45c1-4007-b692-5ef024fcd0f7
Peel and finely chop the shallots.
de19eb5f-45c1-4007-b692-5ef024fcd0f7
Pour the oil into a heavy pan (a fryer, wide and not too tall, is recommended). Tilt the pan around to allow the oil to coat the entire bottom.
de19eb5f-45c1-4007-b692-5ef024fcd0f7
Spread the pork in the pan. Leave undisturbed for a few minutes to allow to brown.
de19eb5f-45c1-4007-b692-5ef024fcd0f7
Flip the pork over and sear the other side.
de19eb5f-45c1-4007-b692-5ef024fcd0f7
When the pork starts to render fat, add the garlic, shallots, pepper and bay leaves to the pork. Continue browning, stirring often, until the the pork is lightly caramelized.
de19eb5f-45c1-4007-b692-5ef024fcd0f7
Pour in the Balsamic vinegar and patis. Add half a cup of water and stir. Bring to the boil, lower the heat, cover the pan tightly and slow cook the pork until tender.
de19eb5f-45c1-4007-b692-5ef024fcd0f7
Check once in a while. Taste and adjust the seasonings, if needed. If the liquid evaporates too fast, add another quarter cup of water and continue cooking. Repeat if the pork takes longer to cook.
de19eb5f-45c1-4007-b692-5ef024fcd0f7
When the pork is done, drizzle in the soy sauce and stir.
de19eb5f-45c1-4007-b692-5ef024fcd0f7
Throw in the pineapple tidbits.
de19eb5f-45c1-4007-b692-5ef024fcd0f7
Cover the pan and simmer for another ten minutes.
de19eb5f-45c1-4007-b692-5ef024fcd0f7
Sprinkle sliced scallions over the Balsamic pork adobo with pineapple and serve.
20e16aac-d0a9-42fc-baff-4a7212d7e514
Cut the pork belly into one-inch cubes. Separate any large chunks of pork fat.
20e16aac-d0a9-42fc-baff-4a7212d7e514
Peel and finely slice the shallots.
20e16aac-d0a9-42fc-baff-4a7212d7e514
Peel and mince the garlic.
20e16aac-d0a9-42fc-baff-4a7212d7e514
Peel and finely chop the ginger.
20e16aac-d0a9-42fc-baff-4a7212d7e514
Thinly slice the lemongrass (white and light green portions only; see visual guide for preparing lemongrass for cooking).
20e16aac-d0a9-42fc-baff-4a7212d7e514
Thinly slice the finger chilies. If you prefer less heat, slit the chilies and scrape off the seeds and white pith inside before slicing (see if you want your chilies mildly hot instead of very hot). Reserve a tablespoon for garnish.
20e16aac-d0a9-42fc-baff-4a7212d7e514
Heat a thick pan (Speedy used our carbon steel wok). Toss in the pork fat and cook over medium heat until you have about two tablespoons of rendered fat. Scoop out any remaining solids (it's chicharon!).
20e16aac-d0a9-42fc-baff-4a7212d7e514
Add the pork cubes to the rendered fat and cook over high heat until well browned. Ideally, the rind should be puffed.
20e16aac-d0a9-42fc-baff-4a7212d7e514
Add the shallots, garlic, ginger, lemongrass and chilies. Pour in a tablespoon of patis. Saute for a minute or so until aromatic.
20e16aac-d0a9-42fc-baff-4a7212d7e514
Pour in the coconut cream. Add another tablespoon of patis. Bring to a gentle boil, lower the heat, cover the pan and simmer until the pork is tender and the liquid is reduced.
20e16aac-d0a9-42fc-baff-4a7212d7e514
Taste, add more patis, if needed. before turning off the heat.
20e16aac-d0a9-42fc-baff-4a7212d7e514
Serve your Bicol Express garnished with the reserved chilies.
9b07dc1f-02da-418a-9806-040c84121a4c
Place the chicken livers in a glass bowl. Sprinkle in the pepper and pour in the soy sauce. Mix well. Cover and marinate in the fridge for at least an hour.
9b07dc1f-02da-418a-9806-040c84121a4c
In a wok or frying pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least two inches.
9b07dc1f-02da-418a-9806-040c84121a4c
When the oil starts to smoke, drain the livers (reserve the marinade) and dump into the hot oil. Fry, stirring occasionally, until a light crust covers their surface, about two to three minutes. Be careful not to overcook them.
9b07dc1f-02da-418a-9806-040c84121a4c
Scoop out the chicken livers and move to a plate. Set aside.
9b07dc1f-02da-418a-9806-040c84121a4c
Pour off the oil leaving only about tablespoonful. Reheat.
9b07dc1f-02da-418a-9806-040c84121a4c
Over medium-low heat, cook the garlic until aromatic, about a minute.
9b07dc1f-02da-418a-9806-040c84121a4c
Throw in the string beans, turn up the heat and stir fry for about half a minute.
9b07dc1f-02da-418a-9806-040c84121a4c
Pour in the reserved marinade and continue stir frying for another minute or two.
9b07dc1f-02da-418a-9806-040c84121a4c
Add the sliced mushrooms to the string beans; stir fry for 30 seconds.
9b07dc1f-02da-418a-9806-040c84121a4c
Toss in the quail eggs, pour in about two tablespoons of water, cover the wok or frying pan without turning down the heat and let everything cook in the steam for about a minute.
9b07dc1f-02da-418a-9806-040c84121a4c
Return the chicken livers to the wok or frying pan. Stir fry until heated through.
9b07dc1f-02da-418a-9806-040c84121a4c
Serve the chicken livers and string beans stir fry immediately. Omit the rice if on keto diet.
a31e08bd-7807-4f18-99b1-2696d291bd7d
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Marinate the chicken Place the chicken strips in a bowl. Add the garlic, soy sauce and pepper. Mix well.
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Marinate the chicken Cover the bowl and let the chicken marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Make the sweet and sour sauce While the chicken marinates, make the sauce. Place the sugar in a small, thick-bottomed pan (sugar will burn if the bottom of the pan is too thin).
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Make the sweet and sour sauce Pour in the rice vinegar. Stir in the ginger, chili (if using) and salt.
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Make the sweet and sour sauce Set the pan over high heat and bring the mixture to a boil. Adjust the heat to medium-low and cook the sauce, uncovered, until reduced and syrupy. Depending on your stove and pan, this takes anywhere from 10 to 12 minutes. Tip: Don’t wait until the sauce is too thick. It thickens as it cools. Once the sauce has thickened and lightly coats a spoon, turn off the heat and remove the pan from the stove.
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Fry the chicken In a wok or frying pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least three inches.
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Fry the chicken Dump the starch in a large mixing bowl and pour in a three tablespoons of icy water to make a pourable paste. If the mixture is to thick and lumpy, add more water, a tablespoon at a time. The paste should be thick enough to coat the chicken strips but not so thick that the chicken coating is thicker than the chicken.
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Fry the chicken Add the chicken to the starch solution and mix.
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Fry the chicken When you see fine wisps of smoke hovering on the surface of the oil, it’s time to start frying. Drop in the starch coated chicken strips, one at a time. Fry the chicken in batches to make sure that the pan is not overcrowded. It takes only about four to five minutes for each batch to cook.
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Fry the chicken Drain the chicken on a rack.
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Complete the dish Pour off the oil from the wok leaving only a tablespoonful.
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Complete the dish Reheat the oil and saute the sliced shallots just until translucent.
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Complete the dish Add the peas and pecans to the shallots and toss to heat through.
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Complete the dish Dump the chicken back into the pan and toss.
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Complete the dish Turn off the heat. Pour in the sweet and sour sauce. Toss to coat every solid ingredient.
2c611967-bec8-4de8-a34a-e6b6f85d1744 Complete the dish Serve the sticky sweet sour chicken with pecans and peas immediately.
1128ddf5-4bf5-4ad1-b463-d63509ea73e8
In a wok or frying pan, heat the cooking oil to smoking point.
1128ddf5-4bf5-4ad1-b463-d63509ea73e8
Spread the ground beef in the hot oil. Cook without disturbing for a minute or two then stir to break up large lumps.
1128ddf5-4bf5-4ad1-b463-d63509ea73e8
Pour in the soy sauce. Sprinkle in two pinches of pepper. Stir fry until the mixture is quite dry.
1128ddf5-4bf5-4ad1-b463-d63509ea73e8
Throw in the sliced onion and minced garlic. Stir fry for half a minute.
1128ddf5-4bf5-4ad1-b463-d63509ea73e8
Add the sliced shiitake and julienned carrot. Sprinkle in a quarter teaspoon of salt and another pinch of pepper. Stir fry for half a minute.
1128ddf5-4bf5-4ad1-b463-d63509ea73e8
Next, add the bok choy tips and stir.
1128ddf5-4bf5-4ad1-b463-d63509ea73e8
Stir together all the ingredients for the sauce and pour into the pan. Cook, stirring, until the sauce is thick and clear. That should be just enough time to cook the bok choy tips through and still be lightly crisp.
1128ddf5-4bf5-4ad1-b463-d63509ea73e8
Serve your ground beef, shiitake and bok choy tips stir fry over rice with split boiled eggs on the side.
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Pat the chicken dry with paper towels.
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Rub the herb salt all over the chicken including the cavity.
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Place the chicken on a rack or strainer and leave to marinate, uncovered (to get rid of surface moisture), in the fridge for at least six hours (overnight is better).
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Preheat the oven to 300F.
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Spread the salt on a baking tray. Bake at 300F 15 minutes. Cool.
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Turn up the oven temperature to 375F.
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Take two large squares of non-stick baking paper and place on the counter, one on top of the other (or replace one sheet of paper with wilted banana leaves).
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Place the chicken on the paper (or banana leaves and paper) and wrap as you would a sandwich. Secure with kitchen twine.
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Take about two cups of the baked salt and spread on the bottom of a Dutch oven.
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Place the wrapped chicken on top of the salt.
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Take the remaining salt and pour over the wrapped chicken to cover and seal completely.
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Cover your Dutch oven and bake the chicken at 375F for an hour. Turn off the oven but leave the chicken inside the oven (no peeking) for another 30 minutes.
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Carefully dig out the wrapped chicken from the salt (sturdy kitchen tongs are useful) and move to a chopping board.
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Cut the wrappings and discard.
8d58f923-0823-4176-969f-a6f4f0374d98
Chop the chicken into serving size pieces. Alternatively, serve whole and let everyone pull off the meat as they eat.
87fe1f11-d17e-4f2d-8389-60b3b9f3c4bd
Spread the pork belly cubes in a wide pan. Add the garlic, pepper, chilies, cayenne and bay leaves.
87fe1f11-d17e-4f2d-8389-60b3b9f3c4bd
Pour the vinegar over the pork and spices. Bring to the boil. Cook over high heat, stirring occasionally, until the vinegar has been soaked up by the meat.
87fe1f11-d17e-4f2d-8389-60b3b9f3c4bd
Lower the heat to medium and lightly fry the pork in the fat that it has rendered. Cook until the meat is lightly browned.
87fe1f11-d17e-4f2d-8389-60b3b9f3c4bd
Pour in the soy sauce. Stir.
87fe1f11-d17e-4f2d-8389-60b3b9f3c4bd
Set the heat to low. Cover the pan and braise the pork for an hour to an hour and a half or until fork tender (the actual cooking time depends on the quality of the meat). If the liquid dries up before the pork is done, add water, a quarter cup at a time.
87fe1f11-d17e-4f2d-8389-60b3b9f3c4bd
When the pork is tender and the sauce has dried up, pour in the lechon sauce. Stir. Taste and adjust the seasonings, as needed. Simmer for a few minutes.
87fe1f11-d17e-4f2d-8389-60b3b9f3c4bd
You may garnish the fiery adobo with chili slices before serving. Best with rice.
591c777c-b574-4d27-b5fe-9114b9df1508 Make the sauce In a small sauce pan, mix together all the ingredients for the sauce.
591c777c-b574-4d27-b5fe-9114b9df1508 Make the sauce Over medium heat, bring the sauce to a boil, stirring constantly. Set the heat to medium-low and let the sauce boil gently for another minute. Turn off the heat and set the sauce aside.
591c777c-b574-4d27-b5fe-9114b9df1508 Make the salad Place the shredded cabbage in a mixing bowl. Sprinkle with a little salt. Add the Japanese mayo and sesame seed oil. Toss to moisten every sliver of cabbage.
591c777c-b574-4d27-b5fe-9114b9df1508 Complete the dish Cook the chicken katsu (get the recipe and instructions).
591c777c-b574-4d27-b5fe-9114b9df1508 Complete the dish Transfer the cooked chicken katsu on the chopping board and cut into strips.
591c777c-b574-4d27-b5fe-9114b9df1508 Complete the dish Ladle rice into two bowls. Arrange some cabbage salad on one side. Top the rice and cabbage salad with chicken katsu. Drizzle the spicy miso paste over the chicken. Sprinkle in some toasted sesame seeds.
591c777c-b574-4d27-b5fe-9114b9df1508 Complete the dish Serve the spicy miso chicken katsu at once.
0cba281f-0c80-4b81-965e-8422d58ac911
cbc705f0-1cbd-40a4-a5c8-152ab6ca61f3
055ae2a7-11c2-40b7-a337-82de9fa4b429
8466b339-2cb6-447f-868e-557951f7614f
9d1fd235-269b-4429-bc7f-3b4813305785
be3d1ffb-97dd-42db-bbcc-3897ffdf07d6
5c72520e-e44c-4f78-849b-c8473e6a2a0d
79891bd5-12e0-4026-a9f4-25178ccfbe96
859977b1-98e7-4e38-b987-154b2feb81f8
Place the meat in a bowl. Season with all the marinating ingredients. Leave to marinate for at least an hour.
50c30b43-56eb-4ac1-b524-3dcf86abdac6
4406b8ce-cfa7-4252-92f1-63f8afa7b94a
ec06494c-6472-4057-aebc-780316a82739
To serve, fill a bowl with rice. Arrange several pieces of beef on top. Drizzle with a few tablespoonfuls of sauce. Garnish with toasted garlic, fried shallots and scallions.
99382579-adf2-4303-8976-c50a6b39eeae
aab6fc4c-88f6-484e-a800-6deef0dfc286
79606b97-83ae-43d2-a587-a16065980fad
a5665c6c-6c7a-47d4-bf51-56840443b5ba
8191ac4b-9719-44ba-ad87-728ed440f009
Soak the sotanghon and wood ear mushrooms in hot water in separate bowls.
8191ac4b-9719-44ba-ad87-728ed440f009
Stir the annatto powder and oil, and pour into a sauce pan, and turn on the heat.
8191ac4b-9719-44ba-ad87-728ed440f009
Lay the chicken fillets, skin side down, in the oil and cook medium-high heat for a minute or two to render fat from the skin. Flip and cook for another minute.
8191ac4b-9719-44ba-ad87-728ed440f009
Pour in the broth. Season with patis and pepper.
8191ac4b-9719-44ba-ad87-728ed440f009
Bring to the boil.
8191ac4b-9719-44ba-ad87-728ed440f009
Dump the cabbage and carrot into the pan.
8191ac4b-9719-44ba-ad87-728ed440f009
Drain the sotanghon and add to the vegetables in the pan.
8191ac4b-9719-44ba-ad87-728ed440f009
Drain the wood ear mushrooms, trim, slice and add to the sotanghon and vegetables.
8191ac4b-9719-44ba-ad87-728ed440f009
Simmer everything together for five minutes.
8191ac4b-9719-44ba-ad87-728ed440f009
Taste the broth and add more patis, if needed.
8191ac4b-9719-44ba-ad87-728ed440f009
Scoop out the chicken and move to a cutting board.
8191ac4b-9719-44ba-ad87-728ed440f009
Cut the chicken into strips and put back in the pan.
8191ac4b-9719-44ba-ad87-728ed440f009
Simmer the chicken sotanghon soup for another five to seven minutes.
8191ac4b-9719-44ba-ad87-728ed440f009
To serve, ladle the chicken sotanghon soup into bowls and sprinkle with sliced scallions and fried garlic.
70d85b3e-5c69-4ccc-9b92-0b32370d2e6e
Lower the heat to medium and cook (uncovered to reduce and concentrate the sauce) for eight to 10 minutes.
70d85b3e-5c69-4ccc-9b92-0b32370d2e6e
Spread the snow peas, bell pepper and onion slices over the chicken. Cook for three to four minutes.
70d85b3e-5c69-4ccc-9b92-0b32370d2e6e
Pour the stirred eggs over the chicken. Do this in a circular motion so that the eggs are spread evenly. Stir lightly.
70d85b3e-5c69-4ccc-9b92-0b32370d2e6e
Scoop the chicken, vegetables and egg over cooked rice.
6a593b2b-ba11-4683-9302-b938d12c34fc
Wipe the chicken fillets dry with paper towels, cut into thin strips and toss with a teaspoon of salt and a quarter teaspoon of pepper.
6a593b2b-ba11-4683-9302-b938d12c34fc
Cut the mushrooms into halves, quarters or slices, depending on how large they are.
6a593b2b-ba11-4683-9302-b938d12c34fc
Peel and thinly slice the onion.
6a593b2b-ba11-4683-9302-b938d12c34fc
Rinse and drain the spinach and roughly chop.
6a593b2b-ba11-4683-9302-b938d12c34fc
Peel the garlic, grate and stir into the sour cream.
6a593b2b-ba11-4683-9302-b938d12c34fc
Set the stove to medium-high and melt the butter in a thick-bottomed frying pan (see notes after the recipe).
6a593b2b-ba11-4683-9302-b938d12c34fc
Spread the chicken strips in the hot butter, allow the undersides to brown a bit before stirring. Cook for a few minutes.
6a593b2b-ba11-4683-9302-b938d12c34fc
Add the mushrooms to the chicken. Sprinkle in a bit of salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until the mushrooms start to brown.
6a593b2b-ba11-4683-9302-b938d12c34fc
Add the onion slices. Continue cooking, stirring, for another minute.
6a593b2b-ba11-4683-9302-b938d12c34fc
Throw in the spinach, sprinkle in a bit more salt and pepper, and cook until wilted and the mixture is almost dry.
6a593b2b-ba11-4683-9302-b938d12c34fc
Pour in the sour cream and stir. When the sauce is bubbly, turn off the heat.
6a593b2b-ba11-4683-9302-b938d12c34fc
Taste the sauce, add more salt and pepper, as needed, before serving.
c9863e64-120c-4e72-8e2d-68e57bf9d4bb
Place the chicken pieces in a large thick-bottomed pot. Pour in enough water to cover. Set over high heat and bring to the boil and leave to boil briskly for five minutes
c9863e64-120c-4e72-8e2d-68e57bf9d4bb
Strain the chicken and discard the water. Rinse the chicken pieces and make sure to get rid of any impurities.
c9863e64-120c-4e72-8e2d-68e57bf9d4bb
Place the rinsed chicken in a clean pot and pour in the chicken bone broth. Set over high heat.
c9863e64-120c-4e72-8e2d-68e57bf9d4bb
With a sharp pointed knife, pierce the garlic in several places, and add to the chicken.
c9863e64-120c-4e72-8e2d-68e57bf9d4bb
Add the onion, peppercorns about two tablespoons of patis to the chicken.
c9863e64-120c-4e72-8e2d-68e57bf9d4bb
When the liquid comes to a boil, lower the heat, cover the pot and simmer for 40 minutes. Taste occasionally and add more patis, as needed.
c9863e64-120c-4e72-8e2d-68e57bf9d4bb
Add the white cabbage and potatoes to the chicken. Simmer for another 10 minutes.
c9863e64-120c-4e72-8e2d-68e57bf9d4bb
Taste the broth and add more patis, if needed (see notes after the recipe).
c9863e64-120c-4e72-8e2d-68e57bf9d4bb
Drop in the sweet potato wedges. Simmer for 10 minutes.
c9863e64-120c-4e72-8e2d-68e57bf9d4bb
Taste the broth again and add more patis, as needed. Add the Chinese cabbage leaves, pressing them into the broth. Simmer for another 10 minutes.
c9863e64-120c-4e72-8e2d-68e57bf9d4bb
Taste the broth one last time, adding more patis, as needed, before serving.
b9e3a7e9-6026-4810-b19a-6b6826e675a8
Reserve 1/4 cup of broth and heat the rest in a pot until boiling.
b9e3a7e9-6026-4810-b19a-6b6826e675a8
Add the cauliflower florets to the broth, lower the heat, cover the pot and simmer for five minutes.
b9e3a7e9-6026-4810-b19a-6b6826e675a8
Dissolve the tapioca starch in the reserved broth and pour into the pot. Cook, stirring, until the broth has thickened and is no longer cloudy.
b9e3a7e9-6026-4810-b19a-6b6826e675a8
Stir in the spinach leaves and chicken meat.
b9e3a7e9-6026-4810-b19a-6b6826e675a8
Taste the broth; add salt and pepper, as needed.
b9e3a7e9-6026-4810-b19a-6b6826e675a8
Bring the soup to a gentle boil and cotinue cooking, uncovered and with occasional stirring, for a few minutes.
b9e3a7e9-6026-4810-b19a-6b6826e675a8
Whisk the eggs in bowl.
b9e3a7e9-6026-4810-b19a-6b6826e675a8
Turn off the heat. Pour the eggs in a thin stream over the entire surface of the soup. Leave to set for a few seconds before stirring.
b9e3a7e9-6026-4810-b19a-6b6826e675a8
Taste the soup one last time and adjust the seasonings, if needed, before serving.
31133e7f-407e-4dc2-83c7-3e502b464856
881e6042-1f4b-46bd-a1ba-e11ce3c2201e
Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan.
881e6042-1f4b-46bd-a1ba-e11ce3c2201e
Cook the chicken until browned and cooked through, about six to seven minutes. If the chicken skin renders too much fat, you can pour off the fat and leave only a teaspoonful of so in the pan.
881e6042-1f4b-46bd-a1ba-e11ce3c2201e
Stir together the hoisin sauce, peanut butter, lime or lemon juice, chili flakes (or powder or paste), fish sauce and sesame seed oil. Pour into the pan and stir everything together.
9f73d097-aafd-4774-aea4-a11a0a06c1dc
Wipe the chicken thigh fillets and cut into chunks. Toss with 1 ½ teaspoons salt and all of the pepper. Marinate in the fridge for eight hours or overnight.
9f73d097-aafd-4774-aea4-a11a0a06c1dc
Place lemon juice, orange juice, zests, ½ teaspoon salt and all of the sugar in a sauce pan. Boil, uncovered, for ten minutes or until reduced by half and syrupy. Set aside to cool.
9f73d097-aafd-4774-aea4-a11a0a06c1dc
In a pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least three inches.
9f73d097-aafd-4774-aea4-a11a0a06c1dc
Place the chicken in a resealable bag, add the starch, seal and shake to coat each piece lightly.
9f73d097-aafd-4774-aea4-a11a0a06c1dc
Over medium heat, fry the chicken in batches until lightly browned, about four minutes per batch.
9f73d097-aafd-4774-aea4-a11a0a06c1dc
Turn up the heat to high, refry the chicken for one to two minutes until golden and crisp.
9f73d097-aafd-4774-aea4-a11a0a06c1dc
Place the chicken a mixing bowl. Drizzle in the cooled sauce and toss to coat each piece well.
9f73d097-aafd-4774-aea4-a11a0a06c1dc
Serve the lemon orange chicken immediately.
27cc5594-c996-420e-9cfa-3be3d3821669
e387d576-c090-422b-9881-167d3f767710
5db8181b-c3f3-4425-b800-d544a4d5eb04
Pat the chicken wings dry. Cut each to separate the drumette (see guide for cutting chicken wings).
5db8181b-c3f3-4425-b800-d544a4d5eb04
Place the chicken in a mixing bowl. Add the salt and pepper. Mix well. Set aside.
5db8181b-c3f3-4425-b800-d544a4d5eb04
Start heating cooking oil in a fryer. For best results, the depth of the oil should be at least three inches.
5db8181b-c3f3-4425-b800-d544a4d5eb04
Sprinkle the flour over the chicken. Cover the bowl. Shake well to coat each piece of chicken with flour. Lift the chicken pieces one by one, shaking off any excess flour.
5db8181b-c3f3-4425-b800-d544a4d5eb04
Over high heat, fry the chicken wings just until a crust forms on the surface. The chicken wings need not be cooked through at this point; you are just searing them. If your fryer is rather small, do this in batches.
5db8181b-c3f3-4425-b800-d544a4d5eb04
Into a wide shallow pan, pour the soy sauce and lemon juice and heat to simmering.
5db8181b-c3f3-4425-b800-d544a4d5eb04
Spread the chicken wings in the sauce keeping them in a single layer.
5db8181b-c3f3-4425-b800-d544a4d5eb04
Over low heat with the pan covered, cook the chicken wings for about five minutes. Flip them over and cook for another five minutes.
5db8181b-c3f3-4425-b800-d544a4d5eb04
Arrange the chicken wings in a platter. Insert lemon wedges between them. Sprinkle the fried garlic slices all over them followed by some chopped parsley.
5db8181b-c3f3-4425-b800-d544a4d5eb04
Serve the soy lemon chicken wings with drinks or as main course with rice.
ca3f77c3-1583-4a2a-b86c-394224296f04
ca3f77c3-1583-4a2a-b86c-394224296f04
ca3f77c3-1583-4a2a-b86c-394224296f04
b59818ed-2e13-433b-b891-bc09bd75e566
Heat a thick-bottomed pot and lay the duck, skin side down. It will immediately sizzle as the fat in the skin starts to melt immediately. Leave it like that until the skin is nicely browned and a couple of tablespoons of duck fat has been rendered. Flip the duck over.
b59818ed-2e13-433b-b891-bc09bd75e566
Add the ginger and shallots to the duck. Stir them in the fat.
b59818ed-2e13-433b-b891-bc09bd75e566
Drizzle in about a tablespoon of fish sauce and sprinkle in black pepper generously.
b59818ed-2e13-433b-b891-bc09bd75e566
Lower the heat and cover the pot to allow the ginger and shallots to brown lightly.
b59818ed-2e13-433b-b891-bc09bd75e566
Meanwhile, cut the coconut meat into thin strips.
b59818ed-2e13-433b-b891-bc09bd75e566
When the ginger and shallots are lightly browned, add the coconut strips and water. Stir.
b59818ed-2e13-433b-b891-bc09bd75e566
Simmer the duck, coconut meat and spices in the coconut water for an hour. DO NOT dilute with tap water. Taste the broth after 30 minutes and add more fish sauce, as needed.
b59818ed-2e13-433b-b891-bc09bd75e566
Scoop out the duck and cool on a rack. Let the coconut meat and spices continue to simmer in the broth.
b59818ed-2e13-433b-b891-bc09bd75e566
Pick the meat from the duck and tear into bite-size pieces. Discard the bone.
b59818ed-2e13-433b-b891-bc09bd75e566
Add the duck meat back into the pot. Simmer for another 20 minutes.
b59818ed-2e13-433b-b891-bc09bd75e566
Turn off the heat. Press the sili leaves into the broth. Cover the pot and leave to allow the sili leaves to wilt in the residual heat.
b59818ed-2e13-433b-b891-bc09bd75e566
Serve the duck binakol immediately.
7607c6e7-a55a-4d6a-9341-ddc6a33ee0d7
Add the chicken pieces skin side down. Cook until the skin is lightly browned. Flip and brown the opposite sides.
7607c6e7-a55a-4d6a-9341-ddc6a33ee0d7
Drizzle in two tablespoons of fish sauce. Cook until the mixture is quite dry.
7607c6e7-a55a-4d6a-9341-ddc6a33ee0d7
Pour in the coconut water. Drizzle in more fish sauce.
7607c6e7-a55a-4d6a-9341-ddc6a33ee0d7
Dump in the coconut meat.
7607c6e7-a55a-4d6a-9341-ddc6a33ee0d7
Bring to a gentle boil, lower the heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until the chicken is done.
7607c6e7-a55a-4d6a-9341-ddc6a33ee0d7
Turn off the heat. Fish out the chicken, move to a plate and cool.
7607c6e7-a55a-4d6a-9341-ddc6a33ee0d7
Flake the chicken meat; discard the bones.
7607c6e7-a55a-4d6a-9341-ddc6a33ee0d7
Turn on the heat. Add the chicken meat and spinach to the soup. Taste the broth and season with more fish sauce, if needed. Simmer for another ten minutes.
7607c6e7-a55a-4d6a-9341-ddc6a33ee0d7
Serve the chicken binakol while piping hot.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
Using a mallet, pound the chicken fillets to a uniform thickness of about a quarter inch.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
Sprinkle the chicken fillets generously with salt and pepper.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
Place the flour in a shallow bowl. Beat the egg in another shallow bowl. Dump the panko in a third shallow bowl.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
Dredge each chicken fillet in flour, dip in egg then coat with panko.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
Preheat the oven to 450F.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
In a frying pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of one inch.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
Fry the chicken fillets, in batches if necessary, until the coating is golden and crisp, about three to four minutes per side.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
Scoop out the fried chicken fillets and arrange on a baking tray lined with foil, non-stick paper or silicone mat.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
Spread a tablespoonful or two of tomato sauce on each chicken fillet.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
Sprinkle Parmesan generously on top of the tomato sauce.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
Lay a slice of mozzarella on top of the Parmesan.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
Bake the chicken fillets for a minute or two, or just until the cheeses are melted.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
Reheat the tomato sauce and toss in the angel hair pasta.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
Heap pasta into bowls and top with the baked chicken.
088ac129-40be-418d-a230-47c820e8ee8f
Serve the chicken Parmigiana with angel hair pasta immediately.
54d7fbf1-4e73-4d1b-9126-7143ee0db990
Place the chicken livers in a glass bowl. Sprinkle in the pepper and pour in the soy sauce. Mix well. Cover and marinate in the fridge for at least an hour.
54d7fbf1-4e73-4d1b-9126-7143ee0db990
In a wok or frying pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least two inches.
54d7fbf1-4e73-4d1b-9126-7143ee0db990
When the oil starts to smoke, drain the livers (reserve the marinade) and dump into the hot oil. Fry, stirring occasionally, until a light crust covers their surface, about two to three minutes. Be careful not to overcook them.
54d7fbf1-4e73-4d1b-9126-7143ee0db990
Scoop out the chicken livers and move to a plate. Set aside.
54d7fbf1-4e73-4d1b-9126-7143ee0db990
Pour off the oil leaving only about tablespoonful. Reheat.
54d7fbf1-4e73-4d1b-9126-7143ee0db990
Over medium-low heat, cook the garlic until aromatic, about a minute.
54d7fbf1-4e73-4d1b-9126-7143ee0db990
Throw in the string beans, turn up the heat and stir fry for about half a minute.
54d7fbf1-4e73-4d1b-9126-7143ee0db990
Pour in the reserved marinade and continue stir frying for another minute or two.
54d7fbf1-4e73-4d1b-9126-7143ee0db990
Add the sliced mushrooms to the string beans; stir fry for 30 seconds.
54d7fbf1-4e73-4d1b-9126-7143ee0db990
Toss in the quail eggs, pour in about two tablespoons of water, cover the wok or frying pan without turning down the heat and let everything cook in the steam for about a minute.
54d7fbf1-4e73-4d1b-9126-7143ee0db990
Return the chicken livers to the wok or frying pan. Stir fry until heated through.
54d7fbf1-4e73-4d1b-9126-7143ee0db990
Serve the chicken livers and string beans stir fry immediately. Omit the rice if on keto diet.
b78e0b6f-830b-4a57-97d3-4150d5e0230c Season and marinate the chicken Pat the chicken fillets with paper towels then cut into one-inch cubes.
b78e0b6f-830b-4a57-97d3-4150d5e0230c Season and marinate the chicken Plate the cubed chicken in a bowl. Add the salt, sugar, black pepper and cayenne. Mix well.
b78e0b6f-830b-4a57-97d3-4150d5e0230c Season and marinate the chicken Cover the bowl and let the chicken marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.
b78e0b6f-830b-4a57-97d3-4150d5e0230c Batter and fry the chicken Start heating enough oil in the wok or frying pan to reach a depth of at least two inches.
b78e0b6f-830b-4a57-97d3-4150d5e0230c Batter and fry the chicken Take the chicken fillets out of fridge and crack the egg directly over them. Mix well.
b78e0b6f-830b-4a57-97d3-4150d5e0230c Batter and fry the chicken Dump in the starch and mix to make a pasty batter.
b78e0b6f-830b-4a57-97d3-4150d5e0230c Batter and fry the chicken Fry the battered chicken at 350F, in batches if necessary, until lightly browned, crisp and cooked through. It shouldn't take more than five minutes per batch.
b78e0b6f-830b-4a57-97d3-4150d5e0230c Mix the sauce In a large mixing bowl, stir together all the ingredients for the sauce. Taste. If you want a spicier sauce, add more Sriracha.
b78e0b6f-830b-4a57-97d3-4150d5e0230c Mix the sauce Add the fried battered chicken to the sauce and toss to coat each piece.
b78e0b6f-830b-4a57-97d3-4150d5e0230c Assemble your explosive dynamite chicken Transfer the sauce coated chicken to a serving plate. Sprinkle the cashew nuts all over them. Top with sliced scallions.
56068bb6-2ccd-4411-8afa-3c8b853ea024
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Marinate the chicken Place the chicken strips in a bowl. Add the garlic, soy sauce and pepper. Mix well.
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Marinate the chicken Cover the bowl and let the chicken marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Make the sweet and sour sauce While the chicken marinates, make the sauce. Place the sugar in a small, thick-bottomed pan (sugar will burn if the bottom of the pan is too thin).
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Make the sweet and sour sauce Pour in the rice vinegar. Stir in the ginger, chili (if using) and salt.
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Make the sweet and sour sauce Set the pan over high heat and bring the mixture to a boil. Adjust the heat to medium-low and cook the sauce, uncovered, until reduced and syrupy. Depending on your stove and pan, this takes anywhere from 10 to 12 minutes. Tip: Don’t wait until the sauce is too thick. It thickens as it cools. Once the sauce has thickened and lightly coats a spoon, turn off the heat and remove the pan from the stove.
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Fry the chicken In a wok or frying pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least three inches.
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Fry the chicken Dump the starch in a large mixing bowl and pour in a three tablespoons of icy water to make a pourable paste. If the mixture is to thick and lumpy, add more water, a tablespoon at a time. The paste should be thick enough to coat the chicken strips but not so thick that the chicken coating is thicker than the chicken.
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Fry the chicken Add the chicken to the starch solution and mix.
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Fry the chicken When you see fine wisps of smoke hovering on the surface of the oil, it’s time to start frying. Drop in the starch coated chicken strips, one at a time. Fry the chicken in batches to make sure that the pan is not overcrowded. It takes only about four to five minutes for each batch to cook.
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Fry the chicken Drain the chicken on a rack.
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Complete the dish Pour off the oil from the wok leaving only a tablespoonful.
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Complete the dish Reheat the oil and saute the sliced shallots just until translucent.
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Complete the dish Add the peas and pecans to the shallots and toss to heat through.
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Complete the dish Dump the chicken back into the pan and toss.
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Complete the dish Turn off the heat. Pour in the sweet and sour sauce. Toss to coat every solid ingredient.
de5db78d-7012-4653-b89a-0b46d2cf4311 Complete the dish Serve the sticky sweet sour chicken with pecans and peas immediately.
524043de-d6ff-4951-850d-17f0049c848b
If your chicken gizzards are large, cut each one into bite-size pieces.
524043de-d6ff-4951-850d-17f0049c848b
In a frying pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of two inches.
524043de-d6ff-4951-850d-17f0049c848b
Fry the cubed saba bananas until nicely browned on the edges. Scoop out and set aside.
524043de-d6ff-4951-850d-17f0049c848b
Pour off the oil leaving only about a tablespoonful. Reheat.
524043de-d6ff-4951-850d-17f0049c848b
Over medium heat, saute the gizzards and chopped onion until the gizzards are lightly browned and the onion pieces are translucent.
524043de-d6ff-4951-850d-17f0049c848b
Add the thyme, turmeric and cayenne. Saute for another half a minute.
524043de-d6ff-4951-850d-17f0049c848b
Turn up the heat. Add the bell peppers and stir fry just until done, about one minute. Taste and add salt, if needed.
524043de-d6ff-4951-850d-17f0049c848b
Add the fried saba bananas to the gizzards and stir fry just until heated through.
524043de-d6ff-4951-850d-17f0049c848b
Serve the chicken gizzards and saba banana stir fry immediately.
8b094cb6-0c46-4692-9314-f06d00fd00ba
If your gizzards are rather large, cut each into three to four portions.
8b094cb6-0c46-4692-9314-f06d00fd00ba
Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan.
8b094cb6-0c46-4692-9314-f06d00fd00ba
Throw in the gizzards and stir fry until lightly browned in spots.
8b094cb6-0c46-4692-9314-f06d00fd00ba
Add the garlic and rosemary. Sprinkle in herb salt (optional) and pepper. Stir fry for half a minute.
8b094cb6-0c46-4692-9314-f06d00fd00ba
Add the diced bell pepper and shallot. Continue stir frying for another half a minute.
8b094cb6-0c46-4692-9314-f06d00fd00ba
Pour in the Sriracha, honey and lime juice.
8b094cb6-0c46-4692-9314-f06d00fd00ba
Alternately stir and toss the gizzards to coat every piece with the sauce. When the gizzards are nicely colored and the sauce has been soaked up, taste a piece. Add salt if needed.
8b094cb6-0c46-4692-9314-f06d00fd00ba
Serve the Sriracha chicken gizzards stir fry immediately. As an appetizer or as a main dish with rice.
065129a0-e947-4c2c-b64b-78b4ec3c42e6
Chop the chicken into serving size portions. Reserve the breast for another dish.
065129a0-e947-4c2c-b64b-78b4ec3c42e6
Rub the chicken with salt, pepper and paprika. Toss in starch.
065129a0-e947-4c2c-b64b-78b4ec3c42e6
In a wide shallow pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of two inches.
065129a0-e947-4c2c-b64b-78b4ec3c42e6
Lightly fry the starched chicken, in batches if necessary, just until lightly browned and the starch has formed a light crisp crust on the surface.
065129a0-e947-4c2c-b64b-78b4ec3c42e6
Pour off the oil leaving only about a tablespoonful. Reheat.
065129a0-e947-4c2c-b64b-78b4ec3c42e6
Saute the garlic, ginger, shallots and chilies. Stir in the pineapple chunks and bell pepper.
065129a0-e947-4c2c-b64b-78b4ec3c42e6
Pour in the coconut milk and about a tablespoonful of fish sauce. Stir.
065129a0-e947-4c2c-b64b-78b4ec3c42e6
Arrange the chicken in the pan in a single layer.
065129a0-e947-4c2c-b64b-78b4ec3c42e6
Set the heat to low. Cover the pan. Let the chicken cook for 50 to 60 minutes. Avoid uncovering the pan too often to minimize loss of moisture. You may check every 15 to 20 minutes to see how the chicken is doing. Taste the sauce as well and add more fish sauce if needed. If your chicken is exceptionally tough and it needs to cook a little longer, you may need to add half a cup or so of chicken broth to prevent the sauce from drying up. Note that the coconut milk will curdle during cooking and the sauce won't be white or off-white. That's how it should be.
065129a0-e947-4c2c-b64b-78b4ec3c42e6
When the chicken is done, give the sauce one last taste. Adjust the seasonings, if needed.
065129a0-e947-4c2c-b64b-78b4ec3c42e6
Scoop out the contents of the pan and transfer to a serving bowl. Pour the sauce over the chicken, pineapple and vegetables. Sprinkle with sliced scallions before serving.
bde215b9-9b8a-42c6-9fc9-5f5d3ece511a
Rinse the gizzards well. Inspect each and every one. Pull out and discard any fatty tissues attached to them--especially all yellowish grainy bits attached to them. Remember that the gizzard is the muscular stomach of the chicken and all impurities attached to it are undigested food that the bird had eaten before it was slaughtered. You definitely want to remove all that.
bde215b9-9b8a-42c6-9fc9-5f5d3ece511a
When you've removed all the nasty bits from the gizzards, rinse them again then drain. Place them in a non-reactive bowl and pour the vinegar over them. Leave them there for 10 minutes then rinse again. Discard the vinegar.
bde215b9-9b8a-42c6-9fc9-5f5d3ece511a
Place the now clean gizzards in a pot and add enough water to cover. Add the salt, peppercorns, ginger, garlic, shallot and bay leaf. Bring to the boil, lower the heat, cover and simmer for an hour to an hour and a half depending on how large the gizzards are. If the liquid dries out before the gizzards are done, just add a cup of water each time.
bde215b9-9b8a-42c6-9fc9-5f5d3ece511a
While the gizzards simmer, soak the bamboo skewers in water. This will prevent them from catching fire on the grill.
bde215b9-9b8a-42c6-9fc9-5f5d3ece511a
When the gizzards are done, drain and cool. When cool enough to handle, if they are rather large, you may cut them into bite-size pieces. It's optional, really, because they are very tender at this point and tearing them with your teeth should be a breeze.
bde215b9-9b8a-42c6-9fc9-5f5d3ece511a
Preheat your grill. High heat will be necessary. The gizzards will be on the grill only for a short time and you really want the heat to lick as much of their surface with gusto.
bde215b9-9b8a-42c6-9fc9-5f5d3ece511a
Thread a few pieces of gizzard in each bamboo skewer. Repeat until all the gizzards have been skewered.
bde215b9-9b8a-42c6-9fc9-5f5d3ece511a
In a bowl, mix together all the ingredients for the basting sauce.
bde215b9-9b8a-42c6-9fc9-5f5d3ece511a
Brush the gizzards all over with the sauce.
bde215b9-9b8a-42c6-9fc9-5f5d3ece511a
Grill the gizzards over intensely high heat. Just two minutes or so per side. You may baste them a few times during grilling. How brown and scorched you want them is entirely up to you. Remember though that the basting sauce contains honey and that burns fast.
bde215b9-9b8a-42c6-9fc9-5f5d3ece511a
Serve your grilled gizzards as an appetizer or, with rice, as a main course. A side salad is always nice.
7d096c87-a86a-44f2-a4c9-708576baa912
Cut the chicken meat into bite-size pieces, or smaller. Place in a bowl, add the soy sauce, garlic and sesame seed oil. Mix well. Cover and allow to marinate in the fridge for at least two hours (overnight is even better).
7d096c87-a86a-44f2-a4c9-708576baa912
Place the quail eggs in a small pan and cover with water. Bring to the boil and cook for five minutes. Scoop out and dump in bowl of cold water to cool.
7d096c87-a86a-44f2-a4c9-708576baa912
While the quail eggs cook, string the chicharo, peel and thinly slice the onion, deseed and dice the bell pepper and cut the mushrooms into quarters.
7d096c87-a86a-44f2-a4c9-708576baa912
Peel the quail eggs.
7d096c87-a86a-44f2-a4c9-708576baa912
Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan until fine wisps of smoke float on the surface. Stir the chicken in the bowl in which it had been marinating. Spread the chicken evenly on the hot oil. Cook over high heat without disturbing for a minute or two. Flip the chicken pieces over and cook for another minute.
7d096c87-a86a-44f2-a4c9-708576baa912
Meanwhile, while the chicken pieces cook, whisk together the rice wine, chicken broth, oyster sauce, sugar and corn starch in a bowl.
7d096c87-a86a-44f2-a4c9-708576baa912
Scoop out the chicken and set aside.
7d096c87-a86a-44f2-a4c9-708576baa912
In the remaining oil, stir fry the onion, chicharo, bell pepper and mushrooms with the salt and pepper for about 30 seconds.
7d096c87-a86a-44f2-a4c9-708576baa912
Add the chicken to the vegetables and stir.
7d096c87-a86a-44f2-a4c9-708576baa912
Stir the broth-starch solution once more before pouring it into the pan with the chicken and vegetables. Cook, stirring, until the sauce is thick and clear.
7d096c87-a86a-44f2-a4c9-708576baa912
Give the stir fry a taste and adjust the seasonings, if needed. Optionally, drizzle in more sesame seed oil before serving.
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Pat the chicken dry with paper towels.
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Rub the herb salt all over the chicken including the cavity.
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Place the chicken on a rack or strainer and leave to marinate, uncovered (to get rid of surface moisture), in the fridge for at least six hours (overnight is better).
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Preheat the oven to 300F.
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Spread the salt on a baking tray. Bake at 300F 15 minutes. Cool.
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Turn up the oven temperature to 375F.
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Take two large squares of non-stick baking paper and place on the counter, one on top of the other (or replace one sheet of paper with wilted banana leaves).
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Place the chicken on the paper (or banana leaves and paper) and wrap as you would a sandwich. Secure with kitchen twine.
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Take about two cups of the baked salt and spread on the bottom of a Dutch oven.
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Place the wrapped chicken on top of the salt.
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Take the remaining salt and pour over the wrapped chicken to cover and seal completely.
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Cover your Dutch oven and bake the chicken at 375F for an hour. Turn off the oven but leave the chicken inside the oven (no peeking) for another 30 minutes.
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Carefully dig out the wrapped chicken from the salt (sturdy kitchen tongs are useful) and move to a chopping board.
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Cut the wrappings and discard.
47103ff9-7501-403e-a11c-fb0f2a4d1911
Chop the chicken into serving size pieces. Alternatively, serve whole and let everyone pull off the meat as they eat.
d82decd1-9eac-4ae2-bd6f-0e0a5799b603
Wipe the chicken pieces dry with paper towels.
d82decd1-9eac-4ae2-bd6f-0e0a5799b603
Place the chicken in a bowl. Add salt and pepper. Mix well. Cover the bowl and marinate the chicken in the fridge for at least two hours.
d82decd1-9eac-4ae2-bd6f-0e0a5799b603
Place the chicken in a resealable bag. Add the flour. Shake to coat each piece. Take the chicken out of the bag, shaking off excess flour.
d82decd1-9eac-4ae2-bd6f-0e0a5799b603
Heat the butter and olive oil in a pan.
d82decd1-9eac-4ae2-bd6f-0e0a5799b603
Brown the chicken pieces just until a light crust forms. If your pan is not so wide, you may need to do this in batches. Scoop out the chicken as they brown and move to a plate.
d82decd1-9eac-4ae2-bd6f-0e0a5799b603
In the remaining oil, saute the onion, garlic, parsley, sage, rosemary and thyme with a sprinkle of salt and pepper until softened and aromatic.
d82decd1-9eac-4ae2-bd6f-0e0a5799b603
Pour in the apple cider and scrape the bottom of the pan to loosen bits stuck on it. Bring to a gentle boil.
d82decd1-9eac-4ae2-bd6f-0e0a5799b603
Return the chicken pieces to the pan. Scatter the carrot and bell pepper wedges over them.
d82decd1-9eac-4ae2-bd6f-0e0a5799b603
Cover the pan, lower the heat and cook the chicken for 30 to 40 minutes (depending on the size of the chicken pieces). Taste the sauce halfway through the cooking time and add more salt and pepper, if needed.
d82decd1-9eac-4ae2-bd6f-0e0a5799b603
To serve, place three or four chicken pieces in a bowl. Ladle sauce around them. Add carrot and bell pepper wedges. Optionally, garnish with a sprig or two of rosemary and a bit of chopped parsley.
93d61582-471f-4dc6-8beb-9f727d8eb70f
Boil water to cook the macaroni in. Add a tablespoon of salt. Cook the macaroni until al dente.
93d61582-471f-4dc6-8beb-9f727d8eb70f
While the pasta cooks, peel the carrot and cut lengthwise into four pieces. Add to the macaroni and cook for five minutes. Fish out the carrot pieces, drain and cool.
93d61582-471f-4dc6-8beb-9f727d8eb70f
While the carrot cools and the pasta continues to cook, toast the pecans in an oil-free pan. Cool.
93d61582-471f-4dc6-8beb-9f727d8eb70f
Thinly slice the celery.
93d61582-471f-4dc6-8beb-9f727d8eb70f
Chop the cooled carrot.
93d61582-471f-4dc6-8beb-9f727d8eb70f
Chop the cooled pecans.
93d61582-471f-4dc6-8beb-9f727d8eb70f
Drain the pasta and cool.
93d61582-471f-4dc6-8beb-9f727d8eb70f
Add two tablespoons mayonnaise to the turkey. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Mix to moisten the meat.
93d61582-471f-4dc6-8beb-9f727d8eb70f
In a mixing bowl, toss the carrot, celery, pecans and crushed pineapple with 1/4 cup mayonnaise and a sprinkle of salt and pepper, all the sugar and grated Parmesan.
93d61582-471f-4dc6-8beb-9f727d8eb70f
Add the drained and cooled pasta to the mixing bowl. Add the turkey and the rest of the mayonnaise, and toss. Taste and adjust the seasonings, as needed. If the pasta appears too dry, add more mayo, toss then adjust the seasonings again.
93d61582-471f-4dc6-8beb-9f727d8eb70f
Chill the turkey macaroni and pecan salad for a few hours before serving.
93d61582-471f-4dc6-8beb-9f727d8eb70f
To serve, top with chopped parsley and more grated Parmesan.
cba2d46c-1c81-43be-9b36-7f28dc9c5818
Pat the chicken thighs dry with paper towels. Place in a bowl.
cba2d46c-1c81-43be-9b36-7f28dc9c5818
Whisk together all the ingredients for the dry rub. Add to the chicken and mix well.
cba2d46c-1c81-43be-9b36-7f28dc9c5818
Cover the bowl. Marinate the chicken in the fridge for at least six hours (overnight is best).
cba2d46c-1c81-43be-9b36-7f28dc9c5818
Using a food processor or a mortar and pestle, grind the ingredients for the coating excluding the flour and starch. Do NOT grind too finely. Visible specks of the individual spices, especially the Sichuan peppercorns and fennel seeds, add better texture to the coating.
cba2d46c-1c81-43be-9b36-7f28dc9c5818
Whisk the flour and starch in a bowl. Add the ground spices. Stir to blend evenly.
cba2d46c-1c81-43be-9b36-7f28dc9c5818
Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan to 350F.
cba2d46c-1c81-43be-9b36-7f28dc9c5818
Dredge each chicken thigh in the seasoned flour, dip in the beaten eggs, then dredge in the flour a second time. Shake off the excess.
cba2d46c-1c81-43be-9b36-7f28dc9c5818
Fry the chicken in the hot oil for eight to 10 minutes until cooked through and the coating is crisp. If your frying pan is rather small, fry the chicken in batches to avoid the temperature of the oil from dropping.
cba2d46c-1c81-43be-9b36-7f28dc9c5818
Drain the 3-pepper fried chicken on a stack of kitchen paper to get rid of excess oil. Serve at once.
7cf478da-5419-4898-86bb-4ded30346190
Preheat the oven to 375F.
7cf478da-5419-4898-86bb-4ded30346190
On the stovetop, melt the butter in a pan.
7cf478da-5419-4898-86bb-4ded30346190
Saute the carrot and onion for about a minute.
7cf478da-5419-4898-86bb-4ded30346190
Add the turkey meat and peas to the carrot and onion. Toss thoroughly to coat the turkey meat with butter.
7cf478da-5419-4898-86bb-4ded30346190
Pour in the gravy. Stir to distribute evenly. Bring to a simmer.
7cf478da-5419-4898-86bb-4ded30346190
Taste the turkey. You will need to add salt and pepper at this point. How much depends on how well seasoned the turkey and gravy are.
7cf478da-5419-4898-86bb-4ded30346190
When you're happy with the taste, turn off the heat and transfer the contents of the pan to an ovenproof dish.
7cf478da-5419-4898-86bb-4ded30346190
Spread the mashed potatoes on top of the duck and vegetables. Lightly rake with a fork (optional).
7cf478da-5419-4898-86bb-4ded30346190
Bake the leftover roast turkey farmer's pie at 375F for 20 to 30 minutes or until bubbly and the mashed potato topping is lightly browned.
fc87a333-efba-4bb9-b428-1ef3d90afeea
8db3f972-ff96-4846-8038-79b9d38c7e13
Wipe the chicken fillets dry with paper towels and cut each into four pieces.
8db3f972-ff96-4846-8038-79b9d38c7e13
Place the cut chicken fillets in a bowl, add the lemon and pepper seasoning and mix well. Note that if your lemon and pepper seasoning has low salt content, you will want to add about a teaspoon of salt to the chicken at this point.
8db3f972-ff96-4846-8038-79b9d38c7e13
Cover the bowl and allow the chicken to marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.
8db3f972-ff96-4846-8038-79b9d38c7e13
Make the batter by mixing together the flour, starch, beer, pepper, baking powder and about a teaspoonful of salt.
8db3f972-ff96-4846-8038-79b9d38c7e13
Place the crushed cashew nuts in a shallow bowl.
8db3f972-ff96-4846-8038-79b9d38c7e13
Thread 3 to 4 chicken pieces with a skewer. Repeat for the rest of the chicken.
8db3f972-ff96-4846-8038-79b9d38c7e13
In a wok or frying pan, heat the oil to 350F.
8db3f972-ff96-4846-8038-79b9d38c7e13
Working with one skewer at a time, dip the chicken in batter, allow the excess to drip off then roll in the crushed nuts.
8db3f972-ff96-4846-8038-79b9d38c7e13
Drop the nut-crusted chicken in hot oil. Cook the chicken in batches, 4 to five skewers at a time to maintain the temperature of the oil, for five to six minutes or until the batter is golden and the nuts are lightly browned.
8db3f972-ff96-4846-8038-79b9d38c7e13
Scoop out the skewered chicken as they cook and lay them on a stack of paper towels to remove excess oil.
8db3f972-ff96-4846-8038-79b9d38c7e13
Serve the nut-crusted fried chicken on a stick while hot.
a29ddf20-17a2-4e92-ac3d-ac7c5740029f
Cut the chicken into serving size pieces. Wipe each piece dry with paper towels.
a29ddf20-17a2-4e92-ac3d-ac7c5740029f
Separate the garlic cloves. Smash each one. Optionally, you make shake off and discard the skins.
a29ddf20-17a2-4e92-ac3d-ac7c5740029f
Cut off the dark green portion of the lemongrass stalks and discard. Take the light colored portion, peel off and discard the outer skin. Lightly pound the peeled stalks.
a29ddf20-17a2-4e92-ac3d-ac7c5740029f
Lightly crush the peppercorns.
a29ddf20-17a2-4e92-ac3d-ac7c5740029f
Place the chicken, skin side down, garlic, lemongrass, peppercorns and bay leaves in a wide thick-bottomed pan.
a29ddf20-17a2-4e92-ac3d-ac7c5740029f
Pour in the vinegar. Bring to the boil and cook until the liquid has reduced to half.
a29ddf20-17a2-4e92-ac3d-ac7c5740029f
Turn the chicken pieces over and continue cooking until the mixture is almost dry.
a29ddf20-17a2-4e92-ac3d-ac7c5740029f
In the rendered fat, fry the chicken until lightly browned.
a29ddf20-17a2-4e92-ac3d-ac7c5740029f
Pour in about four tablespoons of fish sauce and half a cup of water. Bring to a simmer. Lower the heat, cover the pan and let the chicken cook until the sauce has almost dried up, about 40 minutes. If the sauce dries up before the chicken is cooked through, add more water, no more than a quarter cup at a time.
a29ddf20-17a2-4e92-ac3d-ac7c5740029f
To serve, arrange the chicken adobo on a platter. Drizzle the contents of the pan over them. Garnish the chicken adobo with lemongrass with toasted garlic bits before serving. Best with rice.
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
If the thighs are still attached to the back, cut the chicken into serving size pieces. Set aside.
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
Peel and finely slice the shallots
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
Peel and mince the garlic.
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
Peel and grate the ginger.
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
Slit the chilies vertically.
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
Heat two tablespoons cooking oil in a thick-bottomed pot.
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
Saute the shallots until lightly browned. Add the garlic, ginger and chilies. Drizzle in a little fish sauce. Continue sauteeing until the shallot slices are soft and browned. Scoop out the sauteed aromatics.
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
Pour in the remaining tablespoon of cooking oil into the pot.
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
Lay the chicken pieces in the hot oil, skin side down, and cook over high heat until the skins are blistered and browned. Flip the pieces to brown the opposite sides.
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
Return the sauteed aromatics into the pan.
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
Pour enough water to cover the chicken pieces in the pan.
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
Drizzle in more fish sauce. Sprinkle in some ground black pepper.
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
When the contents of the pot are boiling, set the heat to low, cover the pot and cook until the chicken is done. Taste the broth once in a while and add more fish sauce, as needed.
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
When the chicken is done, scatter the chili leaves on the surface of the soup. Turn off the heat. Cover the pot and leave the chili leaves to cook in the residual heat for about five minutes.
9471600b-9c76-4f51-a825-8159b9b5519c
Serve your pinatisang manok hot.
fb874c25-9932-4cf1-b5c0-7dbda0a085ff
Wipe the chicken fillets dry with paper towels. Cut into strips about half an inch wide.
fb874c25-9932-4cf1-b5c0-7dbda0a085ff
In a resealable bag, shake together all the ingredients for the seasoning. Add the chicken, seal the bag and shake well. Make sure that every piece of chicken is coated with the seasonings. Marinate the chicken in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.
fb874c25-9932-4cf1-b5c0-7dbda0a085ff
In a large bowl, whisk together all the ingredients for the batter.
fb874c25-9932-4cf1-b5c0-7dbda0a085ff
Heat the oil in a wok or frying pan. Ideally, the depth of the oil should be at least three inches. How much oil you will actually need depends on the size and shape of your wok or frying pan.
fb874c25-9932-4cf1-b5c0-7dbda0a085ff
Take the chicken out of the fridge. Dump into the batter. Mix lightly but thoroughly.
fb874c25-9932-4cf1-b5c0-7dbda0a085ff
When the oil is hot (350F if you're using a thermometer), drop the chicken fingers one by one into the wok or frying pan. COOK IN BATCHES of eight to ten pieces to make sure that the temperature of the oil does not drop tremendously.
fb874c25-9932-4cf1-b5c0-7dbda0a085ff
Cook the chicken fingers in the hot oil for four to eight minutes, flipping them over halfway through the cooking time.
fb874c25-9932-4cf1-b5c0-7dbda0a085ff
Scoop out the chicken, move to a rack or on a stack of paper towels. Cook the next batch, and so on, and so forth, until all the chicken fingers have been fried.
fb874c25-9932-4cf1-b5c0-7dbda0a085ff
Serve the ginger ale-battered fried chicken fingers as an appetizer, snack or as a main dish.
de0130fb-256f-4275-911b-a0449185c6c7 Make the sauce In a small sauce pan, mix together all the ingredients for the sauce.
de0130fb-256f-4275-911b-a0449185c6c7 Make the sauce Over medium heat, bring the sauce to a boil, stirring constantly. Set the heat to medium-low and let the sauce boil gently for another minute. Turn off the heat and set the sauce aside.
de0130fb-256f-4275-911b-a0449185c6c7 Make the salad Place the shredded cabbage in a mixing bowl. Sprinkle with a little salt. Add the Japanese mayo and sesame seed oil. Toss to moisten every sliver of cabbage.
de0130fb-256f-4275-911b-a0449185c6c7 Complete the dish Cook the chicken katsu (get the recipe and instructions).
de0130fb-256f-4275-911b-a0449185c6c7 Complete the dish Transfer the cooked chicken katsu on the chopping board and cut into strips.
de0130fb-256f-4275-911b-a0449185c6c7 Complete the dish Ladle rice into two bowls. Arrange some cabbage salad on one side. Top the rice and cabbage salad with chicken katsu. Drizzle the spicy miso paste over the chicken. Sprinkle in some toasted sesame seeds.
de0130fb-256f-4275-911b-a0449185c6c7 Complete the dish Serve the spicy miso chicken katsu at once.
721d3290-361b-4540-933b-8a33059140b2 Marinate the chicken Arrange the chicken thigh fillets between two sheets of cling film. Using a kitchen mallet, pound to a uniform thickness of no more than a quarter of an inch thick.
721d3290-361b-4540-933b-8a33059140b2 Marinate the chicken Make the adobo sauce. In a bowl, stir the minced garlic, bay leaves, pepper, rice vinegar and soy sauce.
721d3290-361b-4540-933b-8a33059140b2 Marinate the chicken Place the pounded chicken thigh fillets in a shallow bowl and pour the adobo sauce over them. Cover the bowl and leave to marinate in the fridge for 30 minutes.
721d3290-361b-4540-933b-8a33059140b2 Fry the chicken adobo Pour the cooking oil into a frying pan. Set the heat to medium (if using a thermometer, about 320F).
721d3290-361b-4540-933b-8a33059140b2 Fry the chicken adobo Strain the chicken thigh fillets and fry (in two batches, if the frying pan cannot hold all of them in a single layer) for about two minutes per side. Scoop out and move to a rack. Cool for five minutes.
721d3290-361b-4540-933b-8a33059140b2 Fry the chicken adobo Reheat the cooking oil; this time turn up the heat to high (about 375F). Fry the chicken fillets a second time. A minute per side should create a nice caramelized crust if the oil is hot enough. Scoop the chicken out of the oil and move to a rack.
721d3290-361b-4540-933b-8a33059140b2 Assemble the canapés Spread a teaspoonful of liver pâté on each of the toasted pan de sal halves.
721d3290-361b-4540-933b-8a33059140b2 Assemble the canapés Place a chicken fillet on each of the liver pâté-smeared bread.
721d3290-361b-4540-933b-8a33059140b2 Assemble the canapés Lay a fried quail egg over the chicken.
721d3290-361b-4540-933b-8a33059140b2 Assemble the canapés Sprinkle fried garlic and sliced scallions over the eggs and chicken.
721d3290-361b-4540-933b-8a33059140b2 Assemble the canapés Serve the chicken adobo and quail eggs canapés at once.
c83be719-0827-4546-bc44-46320821fac9
Wipe the chicken thigh fillets dry with paper towels.
c83be719-0827-4546-bc44-46320821fac9
Cut each chicken thigh fillet into six to eight cubes.
c83be719-0827-4546-bc44-46320821fac9
Toss the chicken with the celery salt and cayenne.
c83be719-0827-4546-bc44-46320821fac9
Start heating the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan. Ideally, the oil should be at least two inches deep.
c83be719-0827-4546-bc44-46320821fac9
Make the batter by whisking together the corn starch, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt and black pepper. Pour cold water in a thin stream, mixing as you pour, until the mixture turns into a paste. The paste should be thick that it is rather difficult to mix.
c83be719-0827-4546-bc44-46320821fac9
Add a tablespoon of crushed ice to the paste. Mix to make a fairly thick but pourable batter. If the mixture is still too thick, add more ice little by little.
c83be719-0827-4546-bc44-46320821fac9
Dump the seasoned chicken into the batter and mix well to evenly coat each piece.
c83be719-0827-4546-bc44-46320821fac9
Test the temperature of the oil. If you have a thermometer, the temperature should be 350F. If not, do the test manually. Drop in a little batter. If it stays on the bottom of the pan after four to five seconds, the oil is not hot enough. If the batter browns within a few seconds, the oil is too hot. Make the necessary adjustment and keep testing until you get the temperature right. The oil temperature is crucial to make sure that the batter turns crisp without becoming too dark while the meat inside is cooked through without drying out.
c83be719-0827-4546-bc44-46320821fac9
Drop the battered chicken one by one into the hot oil. Fry for three to four minutes, flip over and continue frying for two to three minutes.
c83be719-0827-4546-bc44-46320821fac9
Scoop out the battered chicken and drain on a rack or on a stack of paper towels.
c83be719-0827-4546-bc44-46320821fac9
Both the chicken and batter are well seasoned so the battered chicken does not really require any dipping sauce. Serve them right away. By themselves, as finger food. Or with rice, for a complete meal.
44bc291b-f14c-4184-8a1f-203dd2f6d955 Marinate the chicken
44bc291b-f14c-4184-8a1f-203dd2f6d955 For grilled pandan chicken
44bc291b-f14c-4184-8a1f-203dd2f6d955 For fried pandan chicken Wrap each piece of chicken in pandan leaf (see video).
44bc291b-f14c-4184-8a1f-203dd2f6d955 For fried pandan chicken Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan. Ideally, the oil should be at least three inches deep.
44bc291b-f14c-4184-8a1f-203dd2f6d955 For fried pandan chicken Fry the pandan-wrapped chicken in batches over high heat. Three to four minutes should cook the chicken through. But, to be on the safe side, take one piece out of the oil and cut the chicken. If the juices run clear, the chicken is done. In not, fry a little longer.
44bc291b-f14c-4184-8a1f-203dd2f6d955 For fried pandan chicken Drain the fried chicken pandan on a rack or strainer to allow excess oil to drip off.
44bc291b-f14c-4184-8a1f-203dd2f6d955 Serving suggestions
ee06b4c9-998f-4ff9-b0a0-00e69debcb3c
Pat the chicken thigh fillets dry with paper towels.
ee06b4c9-998f-4ff9-b0a0-00e69debcb3c
Pour the sesame seed oil in a wide non-stick frying pan and heat.
ee06b4c9-998f-4ff9-b0a0-00e69debcb3c
Arrange the chicken thigh fillets in a single layer, skin side down. Cook over medium-high heat until the skins render fat and turn golden brown.
ee06b4c9-998f-4ff9-b0a0-00e69debcb3c
In a cup, mix together the honey, lemon juice, ginger and fish sauce.
ee06b4c9-998f-4ff9-b0a0-00e69debcb3c
Pour the sauce over the chicken in the pan. Without lowering the heat, cook the chicken fillets in the sauce for about 10 minutes, depending on how thick the meat is.
ee06b4c9-998f-4ff9-b0a0-00e69debcb3c
Scoop out the chicken thigh fillets and move to a chopping board. Cut each fillet into half-inch slices then arrange on a serving platter.
ee06b4c9-998f-4ff9-b0a0-00e69debcb3c
Continue boiling the sauce while slicing the chicken. When the chicken slices have been neatly arranged on a serving platter, the sauce should have reduced to a few tablespoonfuls. It should be dark and thick by this time.
ee06b4c9-998f-4ff9-b0a0-00e69debcb3c
Pour the sauce over the chicken.
ee06b4c9-998f-4ff9-b0a0-00e69debcb3c
Sprinkle sliced scallions over the honey lemon ginger chicken before serving.
1da129d8-c1b2-4254-8396-26cd4a2d89e2
Pat the chicken thigh fillets dry with paper towels. Cut each into strips about 1/3 inch wide. Place in a bowl, pour in the soy sauce and sweet rice wine, add the garlic and pepper, and mix well. Set aside.
1da129d8-c1b2-4254-8396-26cd4a2d89e2
In a bowl, mix together all the ingredients for the sauce.
1da129d8-c1b2-4254-8396-26cd4a2d89e2
Trim the ends of the celery and cut the stalks diagonally into slices about 1/4 inch thick.
1da129d8-c1b2-4254-8396-26cd4a2d89e2
Peel, halve then thinly slice the onion.
1da129d8-c1b2-4254-8396-26cd4a2d89e2
Heat two tablespoons of cooking oil in a wok or frying pan. Stir fry the celery and onion with some salt for about a minute. Scoop out and transfer to a plate.
1da129d8-c1b2-4254-8396-26cd4a2d89e2
Pour in the remaining cooking oil into the pan and heat. Dump the chicken in the hot oil and stir fry for about three minutes.
1da129d8-c1b2-4254-8396-26cd4a2d89e2
Stir the sauce mixture to make sure that the starch has not settled at the bottom of the bowl. Pour into the pan with the chicken. Stir until thick and clear. Lower the heat to medium and let the chicken cook in the sauce for another six to seven minutes.
1da129d8-c1b2-4254-8396-26cd4a2d89e2
Add the celery and onion to the chicken and sauce. Stir and cook just until heated through.
1da129d8-c1b2-4254-8396-26cd4a2d89e2
Turn off the heat. Taste the sauce. Stir in more salt, pepper or sugar, as needed.
1da129d8-c1b2-4254-8396-26cd4a2d89e2
Toss in the toasted cashew nuts.
1da129d8-c1b2-4254-8396-26cd4a2d89e2
Serve the chicken celery stir fry with cashew nuts over rice. Or serve the rice on the side.
b46d1fec-bdfb-43d6-993b-664b90f75d7a
Pat the chicken thigh fillets dry. Cut into 1 and 1/2-inch cubes.
b46d1fec-bdfb-43d6-993b-664b90f75d7a
In a bowl, whisk together all the ingredients for the chicken seasoning. Add the chicken cubes. Mix well. Cover the bowl and leave the chicken to marinate while you prepare the salad.
b46d1fec-bdfb-43d6-993b-664b90f75d7a
Rinse the Romaine lettuce. Tear into smaller pieces. Dump in the salad spinner and spin to dry.
b46d1fec-bdfb-43d6-993b-664b90f75d7a
Peel the kiwi fruits and mangoes, and cut into one-inch cubes.
b46d1fec-bdfb-43d6-993b-664b90f75d7a
Halve the cherry tomatoes.
b46d1fec-bdfb-43d6-993b-664b90f75d7a
Stir the cayenne powder into the Ranch dressing.
b46d1fec-bdfb-43d6-993b-664b90f75d7a
Toss the lettuce, kiwi, mangoes and cherry tomatoes with about a tablespoonful of the Ranch dressing.
b46d1fec-bdfb-43d6-993b-664b90f75d7a
Heat enough cooking oil in a wok or frying pan to reach a depth of two inches. The ideal temperature is 350F. If you don’t have a thermometer, dip a bamboo skewer in the oil; if tiny bubbles form around it, the oil should be hot enough.
b46d1fec-bdfb-43d6-993b-664b90f75d7a
Place the flour, egg whites and panko in three shallow bowls.
b46d1fec-bdfb-43d6-993b-664b90f75d7a
Dredge each piece of chicken in flour, roll in egg whites then coat with panko.
b46d1fec-bdfb-43d6-993b-664b90f75d7a
Fry the breaded chicken in batches of 10 to 15 (depending on how wide your frying pan is) until golden and crisp. Scoop out and drain on a rack.
b46d1fec-bdfb-43d6-993b-664b90f75d7a
Pile half of the mixed salad in a bowl. Scatter popcorn chicken over it. Cover with the rest of the salad and top with more popcorn chicken. Drizzle Ranch dressing over everything.
b46d1fec-bdfb-43d6-993b-664b90f75d7a
Serve your popcorn chicken salad with spicy ranch dressing immediately.
93c6a76c-a398-4b89-ab72-b335d3efc41b
Wipe the chicken thighs with paper towels. Rub with one teaspoon salt, a quarter teaspoon pepper and all of the cayenne powder. Place in a covered container and leave to marinate for at least two hours.
93c6a76c-a398-4b89-ab72-b335d3efc41b
Grill, broil, poach, fry or steam the chicken just until done. How you cook the chicken will affect the flavor and texture of the salad. Grilling will give the salad a lovely smoky taste and aroma while frying will give the chicken, and the salad, better texture. You choose which cooking method you prefer. I poached mine.
93c6a76c-a398-4b89-ab72-b335d3efc41b
Cool the chicken then chill in a covered container for a couple of hours or overnight.
93c6a76c-a398-4b89-ab72-b335d3efc41b
Take the chicken out of the fridge. Discard the bones. Cut the meat into one-inch cubes.
93c6a76c-a398-4b89-ab72-b335d3efc41b
Place the grapes, pineapple and pecans in a bowl. Add the chicken. Toss lightly.
93c6a76c-a398-4b89-ab72-b335d3efc41b
In a small bowl, stir together the mayonnaise, sour cream and lime juice. Add the to chicken, fruits and nuts. Toss lightly but thoroughly. Taste. Add salt and pepper, as needed.
93c6a76c-a398-4b89-ab72-b335d3efc41b
Serve the chicken salad with pecans, grapes and pineapple at once while all the ingredients are still cold. Or chill in the fridge for at least an hour before serving.
70827a3b-f604-4dfb-acd2-60e1735d055c
Wipe the chicken thighs dry with paper towels. Place in a bowl, pour in the Worcestershire Sauce and add half of the minced garlic. Mix well. Cover the bowl, place in the fridge and allow the chicken to marinate for a couple of hours or overnight. Remove from the fridge half an hour before cooking time to allow the chicken to warm to room temperature.
70827a3b-f604-4dfb-acd2-60e1735d055c
