Melt the butter in a pan wide enough to hold the chicken thighs in a single layer. Brown the chicken on both sides. Pour in the marinade. Continue cooking until the liquid dries up. Scoop out the chicken thighs and move to a plate.
70827a3b-f604-4dfb-acd2-60e1735d055c
Reheat the butter and rendered chicken fat. Saute the remaining half of the garlic, sliced onion and tomatoes with a little salt and pepper in the hot butter. Cook until softened, about five minutes.
70827a3b-f604-4dfb-acd2-60e1735d055c
Pour the lime juice into the pan. Add the pineapple chunks. Stir in the sliced kaffir lime leaves.
70827a3b-f604-4dfb-acd2-60e1735d055c
Add the browned chicken back to the pan. For best results, cook them in a single layer so you won't have to flip and stir.
70827a3b-f604-4dfb-acd2-60e1735d055c
Cover the pan tightly, lower the heat and let the chicken stew in the pan juices for 30 minutes or until cooked through. The actual cooking time depends in the size of the chicken thighs. There is no need to add water or broth. The fresh pineapple chunks will expel their juice in the heat. The combined juices of the pineapple and tomatoes are enough to cook the chicken through.
70827a3b-f604-4dfb-acd2-60e1735d055c
If there appears to be too much liquid by the time the chicken is done, cook the chicken, tomatoes and pineapple stew over medium-high heat with the pan uncovered until the sauce is reduced and thick.
70827a3b-f604-4dfb-acd2-60e1735d055c
Serve the chicken, tomatoes and pineapple stew sprinkled with basil chiffonade. It's good with rice, crusty bread or cooked pasta.
d04ff0f6-f99a-4dbb-8f52-b55d74c1cf64
Wipe the chicken thighs and legs dry with a kitchen towel.
d04ff0f6-f99a-4dbb-8f52-b55d74c1cf64
In a bowl, mix together all the ingredients for the marinade. Add the chicken. Mix to coat each piece well.
d04ff0f6-f99a-4dbb-8f52-b55d74c1cf64
Cover the bowl and allow the chicken to marinate in the fridge for at least an hour.
d04ff0f6-f99a-4dbb-8f52-b55d74c1cf64
Take chicken out of the fridge and allow to warm to room temperature.
d04ff0f6-f99a-4dbb-8f52-b55d74c1cf64
Preheat the oven to 400F.
d04ff0f6-f99a-4dbb-8f52-b55d74c1cf64
Line a baking tray with a silicone mat or non-stick paper. Position a rack in the tray.
d04ff0f6-f99a-4dbb-8f52-b55d74c1cf64
In a bowl, stir together all the ingredients for the crust.
d04ff0f6-f99a-4dbb-8f52-b55d74c1cf64
Roll the chicken pieces in the crust mixture.
d04ff0f6-f99a-4dbb-8f52-b55d74c1cf64
Arrange the chicken on the rack. Make sure that they are at least an inch apart to allow the hot air to circulate between them. Optionally, spray the chicken with cooking oil. Keep the oil can at least a foot from the chicken. If you spray too near, you might blow away the crust.
d04ff0f6-f99a-4dbb-8f52-b55d74c1cf64
Bake the chicken at 400F for 40 minutes.
d04ff0f6-f99a-4dbb-8f52-b55d74c1cf64
Serve your herb and Parmesan crusted chicken immediately. No dipping sauce is necessary. The chicken goes well with mashed potatoes, rice or bread. A side salad would be nice too.
7ce5b1b0-452a-4de6-9f18-9e7095e0c136
Pat the chicken fillets dry with paper towels. Cut each thigh into six to eight strips. Place in a bowl.
7ce5b1b0-452a-4de6-9f18-9e7095e0c136
Add the minced garlic, sliced chilies, salt, pepper and sugar to the chicken. Mix well. Set aside.
7ce5b1b0-452a-4de6-9f18-9e7095e0c136
Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan. Add the chicken and stir fry for five to seven minutes, depending on the size of the strips into which you have cut the fillets (see stir frying basics).
7ce5b1b0-452a-4de6-9f18-9e7095e0c136
Pour in the balsamic vinegar. Stir fry for half a minute.
7ce5b1b0-452a-4de6-9f18-9e7095e0c136
Add the sliced onion and diced bell pepper. Stir fry for one minute.
7ce5b1b0-452a-4de6-9f18-9e7095e0c136
Add the sliced mangoes to the chicken and vegetables. Stir fry just until the mango slices are heated through.
7ce5b1b0-452a-4de6-9f18-9e7095e0c136
Serve the spicy stir fried chicken and fresh mangoes immediately.
b696a057-ea69-4c31-a629-3efbbaa73b3e
Start heating a skillet on the stove.
b696a057-ea69-4c31-a629-3efbbaa73b3e
Place the chicken thigh fillets between sheets of cling film and pound to a uniform thickness. One-fourth inch thickness is ideal for quick cooking. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, cayenne, garlic powder and onion powder.
b696a057-ea69-4c31-a629-3efbbaa73b3e
Place the seasoned chicken on the pre-heated skillet and cook over high heat for two minutes per side.
b696a057-ea69-4c31-a629-3efbbaa73b3e
While the chicken cooks, prepare the garnishes. In this case, the "garnishes" were prepared in the form of a simple salad. Shred the lettuce. Halve the cherry tomatoes. Peel, de-seed and cut the cucumber into small cubes. Toss them all together with the scallions in a bowl. Drizzle in enough vinaigrette to moisten them and toss once more.
b696a057-ea69-4c31-a629-3efbbaa73b3e
Take the chicken off the skillet and transfer to a chopping board.
b696a057-ea69-4c31-a629-3efbbaa73b3e
Warm the tortilla on both sides in the still hot skillet.
b696a057-ea69-4c31-a629-3efbbaa73b3e
Slice or chop the chicken.
b696a057-ea69-4c31-a629-3efbbaa73b3e
Place the warmed tortilla on a plate. Spoon the salad on the tortilla, top with the grilled chicken and sprinkle in some torn cilantro.
b696a057-ea69-4c31-a629-3efbbaa73b3e
Enjoy your chicken fajita!
c8fe7a1b-ca8b-4b0a-8e42-ac99bae9738d

ef0efcb8-ca44-44fb-b126-a99cd62e98e1
Make the caramel sauce: Melt the sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat. Off the fire, pour in the fish sauce while stirring. Bring back to the fire, continue stirring until smooth. Add the sliced onion or shallots and lots of black pepper. Simmer for about 3 minutes.
d805a6c3-a088-4687-9b61-48d0263770ab

Tip the contents of the pan onto a serving platter. Sprinkle the scallions on top and serve at once.

Make the sauce by stirring together the broth, oyster sauce, soy sauce, sugar and starch. Pour into the wok. Stir until the sauce is thick and clear. Turn off the heat. Transfer the chicken chop suey in a platter and serve at once.

In a frying pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least two inches. When fine wisps of smoke float on the surface of the oil, fry the tofu cubes, in batches if necessary, until golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
c4c5dbb1-69f1-484f-82e6-c9c1462d2cc8
Pat the chicken thighs dry with paper towels.
c4c5dbb1-69f1-484f-82e6-c9c1462d2cc8
In a bowl, mix together all the seasonings for the chicken, add the chicken and rub the seasonings well into the meat.
89d3ea2f-53ba-49f2-8cec-2bf2e97726ab
fed84b02-c075-4e18-a9ed-6d36d271cf99
Preheat the oven to 375F.
fed84b02-c075-4e18-a9ed-6d36d271cf99
Melt the butter in a pan.
fed84b02-c075-4e18-a9ed-6d36d271cf99
Saute the onions until softened.
fed84b02-c075-4e18-a9ed-6d36d271cf99
Add the shredded duck / turkey meat. Cook until heated through.
fed84b02-c075-4e18-a9ed-6d36d271cf99
Season with salt and pepper.
fed84b02-c075-4e18-a9ed-6d36d271cf99
Butter the bottom and sides of a 3-qt baking dish.
fed84b02-c075-4e18-a9ed-6d36d271cf99
Arrange half of the potatoes on the bottom of the baking dish. Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper.
fed84b02-c075-4e18-a9ed-6d36d271cf99
Spread the duck / turkey mixture on top of the potatoes.
fed84b02-c075-4e18-a9ed-6d36d271cf99
Arrange the remaining half of potatoes over the meat. Sprinkle with salt, pepper and parsley flakes.
fed84b02-c075-4e18-a9ed-6d36d271cf99
Pour the cream evenly over the contents of the dish.
fed84b02-c075-4e18-a9ed-6d36d271cf99
Top everything with cheese. Sliced or shredded. It doesn't matter.
fed84b02-c075-4e18-a9ed-6d36d271cf99
Bake in a preheated 375F oven for 30 minutes.
fed84b02-c075-4e18-a9ed-6d36d271cf99
Cut the turkey, duck and potato bake, and serve.
1c21a391-c3d3-4eda-8a94-91a833cd26e3
Heat the cooking oil in a pot. Saute the garlic, ginger, onion, chilis and lemongrass until fragrant.
1c21a391-c3d3-4eda-8a94-91a833cd26e3
Add the chicken strips and cook until no longer pink.
1c21a391-c3d3-4eda-8a94-91a833cd26e3
Add the kaffir lime leaves. Stir and cook for a couple of minutes.
0be522f0-966d-4667-95f6-c8a2fa100d0c
Peel and thinly slice the shallots.
0be522f0-966d-4667-95f6-c8a2fa100d0c
Dice the tomatoes.
0be522f0-966d-4667-95f6-c8a2fa100d0c
Peel and mince the garlic.
0be522f0-966d-4667-95f6-c8a2fa100d0c
Heat the cooking oil in a thick-bottomed pot.
0be522f0-966d-4667-95f6-c8a2fa100d0c
Pour in four to five cups of chicken broth. Yes, it is quite alright to simply use water IF you're using bone-in chicken. If you're substituting fillets because they are more convenient to serve and easier to eat, water just won't coax enough flavor from them to make a tasty broth.
bc6d24d3-6642-4a43-a750-e5d11e72cc37
Heat the broth.
bc6d24d3-6642-4a43-a750-e5d11e72cc37
Add the onion and bring to the boil.
bc6d24d3-6642-4a43-a750-e5d11e72cc37
Add the chicken, broccoli stem and carrot, season with patis and pepper and bring to the boil once more.
bc6d24d3-6642-4a43-a750-e5d11e72cc37
Add the broccoli florets and the rolls of misua. When the soup reaches the boiling point once more, turn off the heat, cover and leave for three minutes.
bc6d24d3-6642-4a43-a750-e5d11e72cc37
Serve at once.
6616f12f-99fb-4d15-9b37-54c2cf20c5d6
Heat the cooking oil in a thick-bottomed pan.
6616f12f-99fb-4d15-9b37-54c2cf20c5d6
Spread the pork belly cubes in the hot oil and leave to brown the undersides for a few minutes.
6616f12f-99fb-4d15-9b37-54c2cf20c5d6
Flip the pork cubes over to brown the opposite sides.
6616f12f-99fb-4d15-9b37-54c2cf20c5d6
Add the garlic, pepper and bay leaves. Cook, tossing, for half a minute.
6616f12f-99fb-4d15-9b37-54c2cf20c5d6
Add the onion. Cook, stirring often, until the onion pieces soften a bit.
6616f12f-99fb-4d15-9b37-54c2cf20c5d6
Pour in the vinegar. Cook, uncovered with occasional stirring, until the vinegar has been soaked up by the meat.
6616f12f-99fb-4d15-9b37-54c2cf20c5d6
Add the shrimp paste, sugar and two cups of broth.
6616f12f-99fb-4d15-9b37-54c2cf20c5d6
Lower the heat, cover the pan and simmer until the pork is tender. Stir occasionally and scrape the bottom of the pan to make sure no scorching occurs. If the mixture dried up before the meat is done, pour in more broth, no more than half a cup each time.
6616f12f-99fb-4d15-9b37-54c2cf20c5d6
Your binagoongang baboy is ready when the liquid has been absorbed and the pork is swimming in a pool of highly flavorful fat.
6616f12f-99fb-4d15-9b37-54c2cf20c5d6
To serve the binagoongang baboy, arrange pork cubes on top of hot rice, drizzle in some of the fat from the pan over the meat and rice. Optionally, garnish with scallions.
ecf97a11-cc69-4221-b39e-e90d3ca9b0f8
Heat two tablespoons coconut oil in a wide frying pan.
ecf97a11-cc69-4221-b39e-e90d3ca9b0f8
Spread the sweet potato cubes and leave to brown a bit. Cook, stirring, to evenly brown on all sides. You're not cooking them through at this point but just browning them. As soon as they are browned, scoop out and set aside.
ecf97a11-cc69-4221-b39e-e90d3ca9b0f8
Pour in the remaining coconut oil into the pan and heat.
ecf97a11-cc69-4221-b39e-e90d3ca9b0f8
Spread the pork strips, leave to brown a little, stir and cook, stirring often, until the edges are lightly browned.
ecf97a11-cc69-4221-b39e-e90d3ca9b0f8
Add the onion, garlic, ginger and tomato to the pork. Drizzle in a tablespoon of fish sauce and sprinkle in quarter teaspoon of pepper. Cook, stirring, until the vegetables soften.
ecf97a11-cc69-4221-b39e-e90d3ca9b0f8
Stir in the kimchi juice and half of the coconut milk. Taste and add more fish sauce, as needed.
ecf97a11-cc69-4221-b39e-e90d3ca9b0f8
Cover then pan and simmer the pork and kimchi in coconut milk until the pork is tender.
ecf97a11-cc69-4221-b39e-e90d3ca9b0f8
Add the kimchi, green beans and the remaining coconut milk. Stir in the fried sweet potatoes. Cook, uncovered, until the green beans are done and the sweet potato cubes are cooked through (see notes after the recipe).
ecf97a11-cc69-4221-b39e-e90d3ca9b0f8
Taste and add more fish sauce (and sugar, optionally) to balance the flavors.
284da4cd-e322-495d-bbc8-dd8622a62203
c439543c-e378-4304-9b74-7b69f327f6f0
8672b93c-281a-446e-8a66-285e19ce8a41
Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan.
8672b93c-281a-446e-8a66-285e19ce8a41
Spread the sausage meat in the hot oil. Over high heat, leave for a minute for the underside to brown.
8672b93c-281a-446e-8a66-285e19ce8a41
Stir the sausage meat and cook, stirring often, until you see rendered fat in the pan.
8672b93c-281a-446e-8a66-285e19ce8a41
Add the chopped carrot and shallots, and sweet peas. Sprinkle with a little salt and pepper. Continue cooking with occasional stirring for about a minute.
8672b93c-281a-446e-8a66-285e19ce8a41
Stir in the chopped tomatoes and oregano. Lower the heat, cover the pan and cook until the carrots are almost and the tomatoes have softened.
8672b93c-281a-446e-8a66-285e19ce8a41
Stir in the quail eggs. Cover the pan once more and cook for another minute or two to allow the quail eggs to soak up the flavors of the sausage meat.
8672b93c-281a-446e-8a66-285e19ce8a41
Taste your ground pork menudo; add more salt and pepper, if necessary.
8672b93c-281a-446e-8a66-285e19ce8a41
Scoop rice into bowl, top with ground pork menudo, making sure everyone gets enough quail eggs, sprinkle with sliced scallions and serve at once.
a0fde969-a877-4187-8911-969c3b61100e
Rub salt and pepper on both sides of the pork steaks.
a0fde969-a877-4187-8911-969c3b61100e
Over medium-high heat, melt four tablespoons butter in a thick-bottomed frying pan large enough to contain all four steaks in a single layer.
a0fde969-a877-4187-8911-969c3b61100e
Lay the pork steaks side by side in the hot butter and allow the undersides to sear for a minute or so. Flip to brown the opposite side.
a0fde969-a877-4187-8911-969c3b61100e
Pour in the bone broth and bring to the boil.
a0fde969-a877-4187-8911-969c3b61100e
Cover the pan and set the heat to medium-low.
a0fde969-a877-4187-8911-969c3b61100e
In a saucepan, heat the mushroom soup with the remaining butter. Stir to remove lumps.
a0fde969-a877-4187-8911-969c3b61100e
The pork steaks should be done by the time the bone broth has evaporated. Cook on both sides over medium-high heat in the residual butter to give the meat better texture and color.
a0fde969-a877-4187-8911-969c3b61100e
To serve, lay the pork steaks over rice smothered with the mushroom sauce. Optionally, sprinkle with snipped scallions or parsley.
fa12e201-9aa1-4a68-85be-d214da1f4a4d
3dcec676-c33f-4b97-93b3-4e12907044e0
Pat the pork steaks dry with paper towels. Sprinkle both sides generously with salt and pepper.
3dcec676-c33f-4b97-93b3-4e12907044e0
Melt the ¼ cup butter in a heavy skillet (cast iron is ideal) large enough to contain all three pork steaks in a single layer.
3dcec676-c33f-4b97-93b3-4e12907044e0
Sear both sides of the pork steaks in the hot butter.
3dcec676-c33f-4b97-93b3-4e12907044e0
Pour in half a cup of water, lower the heat, cover the skillet and let the pork steaks cook until the liquid has gone dry (see notes after the recipe). There is no need to flip the pork steaks over.
3dcec676-c33f-4b97-93b3-4e12907044e0
Lift the pork steaks and transfer to a plate. Keep hot.
3dcec676-c33f-4b97-93b3-4e12907044e0
Over low heat, melt the remaining butter in the pan.
3dcec676-c33f-4b97-93b3-4e12907044e0
Whisk together the spicy mustard and honey.
3dcec676-c33f-4b97-93b3-4e12907044e0
When the butter is bubbly, pour in the mustard-honey mixture and make sure to scrape the bottom of the pan.
3dcec676-c33f-4b97-93b3-4e12907044e0
Scoop rice into three bowls and top each with a pork steak.
3dcec676-c33f-4b97-93b3-4e12907044e0
Spoon enough spicy mustard and honey sauce over the pork steaks so that the sauce drips into the rice.
3dcec676-c33f-4b97-93b3-4e12907044e0
Optionally, garnish with mint leaves before serving.
6916f496-b971-40b6-bec6-636f4bebd8ca
6916f496-b971-40b6-bec6-636f4bebd8ca
19b65214-e5f9-4ec3-bd85-d74f474a8a73
Cut the pork across the grain to about 1/4 inch thin (thinner, if you can manage it) then cut into small pieces, about 2 inches square.
19b65214-e5f9-4ec3-bd85-d74f474a8a73
With a mortar and pestle, pound the scallions, lemongrass, garlic, ginger and pepper.
19b65214-e5f9-4ec3-bd85-d74f474a8a73
Place the pork in a bowl. Add the lemongrass mixture, sugar, fish sauce, honey (if using), vegetable oil and kalamansi juice. Cover and marinate in the fridge overnight.
2a05405b-374a-4ec8-a483-a82761a88603
In a cooking pan, heat enough oil to reach a depth of at least two inches.
2a05405b-374a-4ec8-a483-a82761a88603
Dump the sitaw in the hot oil and cook, stirring occasionally, for about three minutes. Scoop out and move to a strainer.
2a05405b-374a-4ec8-a483-a82761a88603
Add the eggplants to the hot oil and cook for two minutes. Scoop out before they are completely done because the eggplants will continue cooking off the heat. Again, move to a strainer.
2a05405b-374a-4ec8-a483-a82761a88603
Next, fry the okra for about two minutes.
2a05405b-374a-4ec8-a483-a82761a88603
Lastly, fry the squash cubes in the oil just long enough for the edges to brown. Scoop out and move to a strainer.
2a05405b-374a-4ec8-a483-a82761a88603
Heat a frying pan. Drizzle in about two tablespoons of the hot oil from the other pan.
2a05405b-374a-4ec8-a483-a82761a88603
Over medium heat, saute the garlic, chili, shallots, tomatoes and bagoong until the mixture is almost dry.
2a05405b-374a-4ec8-a483-a82761a88603
Add the fried vegetables to the pan. Toss gently but thoroughly. Taste. If too bland, drizzle in patis, a little at a time.
2a05405b-374a-4ec8-a483-a82761a88603
When the vegetables are heated through and done, add the cubed lechon kawali. Toss a few times to distribute evenly and to coat the meat with the shrimp paste spice base.
2a05405b-374a-4ec8-a483-a82761a88603
Serve your pinakbet with lechon kawali with hot rice.
2a3aaffd-cf64-46fd-b813-abde9dd3e7a0
Cut the pork loin into half-inch cubes.
2a3aaffd-cf64-46fd-b813-abde9dd3e7a0
In a bowl, combine the fish sauce and oyster sauce. Add the pork and mix well. Cover, refrigerate and marinate for at least an hour.
2a3aaffd-cf64-46fd-b813-abde9dd3e7a0
Cut off and discard the top part (with the stem) of the chilies. Split in the chilies in half, scrape off and discard the seeds (unless you want your dish to be super spicy) before mincing.
2a3aaffd-cf64-46fd-b813-abde9dd3e7a0
Add the pork. Stir then spread them out in a single layer. When the pork changes color, flip them over.
2a3aaffd-cf64-46fd-b813-abde9dd3e7a0
Add a cup of water. Stir. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Turn up the heat and allow to boil uncovered to reduce the liquid.
2a3aaffd-cf64-46fd-b813-abde9dd3e7a0
Add the mushrooms to the pork, stir, and place a sprig of basil on top. Cover the pan tightly.
2a3aaffd-cf64-46fd-b813-abde9dd3e7a0
Count ten seconds then turn off the heat. Wait ten minutes before lifting the cover. The pork should be done at this point.
2a3aaffd-cf64-46fd-b813-abde9dd3e7a0
Scoop out the contents of the pan and transfer to a shallow bowl. Optionally, garnish with fried shallots and cilantro before serving.
39d57c45-e14e-446f-8602-04d4d586eaf6
Place the pork tenderloin slices in a bowl, drizzle in the fish sauce, sprinkle in the pepper and mix well. Leave to marinate for 10 minutes.
39d57c45-e14e-446f-8602-04d4d586eaf6
Take a slice of pork tenderloin and lay it flat. Place pineapple, bell pepper, onion, cilantro and basil at the center and roll up to seal. How much filling you can put into a slice of pork tenderloin depends on how large the slice is. As a rule of thumb, use less than more to prevent the roll up pork tenderloin from bursting during frying.
39d57c45-e14e-446f-8602-04d4d586eaf6
Fill up the rest of the pork tenderloin slices.
39d57c45-e14e-446f-8602-04d4d586eaf6
Place the flour in a shallow bowl, beat the egg in another and dump the bread crumbs into a third shallow bowl.
39d57c45-e14e-446f-8602-04d4d586eaf6
Take a rolled pork tenderloin, dredge in flour and shake off the excess. Dip the floured rolled pork tenderloin in egg making sure that every inch of the surface is wet. Roll the tenderloin in bread crumbs. Do the same for the rest of the rolled meat.
39d57c45-e14e-446f-8602-04d4d586eaf6
Heat enough cooking oil in a pan to reach a depth of at least three inches. The ideal temperature of the oil is 350F.
39d57c45-e14e-446f-8602-04d4d586eaf6
Fry the breaded pork tenderloin until the crust is golden and crisp. Do this in batches if your frying pan is not that large. It will take only two to three minutes to cook the pork through.
39d57c45-e14e-446f-8602-04d4d586eaf6
Drain the fried pork tenderloin on a stack of paper towels before transferring to a serving plate.
56296fd6-ac42-4133-97e5-34a38e6754c0
3233d8a2-e482-4f0f-b94e-1609e7492aca
Grill (can also be steamed, broiled or boiled) the eggplants until soft. Cool.
3233d8a2-e482-4f0f-b94e-1609e7492aca
Heat and frying pan and spread the bacon in it. Cook until crisp and fat has been rendered. Scoop out the bacon and set aside.
3233d8a2-e482-4f0f-b94e-1609e7492aca
In the rendered bacon fat, saute the ground pork until no longer pink. Add the shallot and garlic, sprinkle in salt and pepper, and cook until the shallot pieces are translucent. Scoop everything out and transfer to a plate. Cool.
3233d8a2-e482-4f0f-b94e-1609e7492aca
While the ground pork mixture cools, peel the eggplants. Discard the skins; lightly flatten the flesh (the back of a fork is useful for this purpose).
3233d8a2-e482-4f0f-b94e-1609e7492aca
Beat the eggs in a bowl. Stir in the bacon and ground pork mixture.
3233d8a2-e482-4f0f-b94e-1609e7492aca
Set the stove to medium and reheat the remaining fat in the frying pan.
3233d8a2-e482-4f0f-b94e-1609e7492aca
Lay the eggplants in the pan. If your frying pan is not large enough to hold all three side by side, you will have to cook the eggplant torta one by one.
3233d8a2-e482-4f0f-b94e-1609e7492aca
Spoon the bacon and ground pork mixture over the eggplants. Top with mozzarella slices. Cover the pan and cook the torta until the eggs are set and the cheese is melted.
3233d8a2-e482-4f0f-b94e-1609e7492aca
Serve the eggplant torta at once.
1a400ca3-9c65-4dc8-8476-ed9a2cabbccb
In a frying pan, heat enough cooking to reach a depth of ¼ inch.
1a400ca3-9c65-4dc8-8476-ed9a2cabbccb
Mince the tocino and cook over medium-low heat until the sugar in the marinade has caramelized (the meat will be fully done at that point).
1a400ca3-9c65-4dc8-8476-ed9a2cabbccb
While the tocino cooks, drain the achara. Save the liquid.
1a400ca3-9c65-4dc8-8476-ed9a2cabbccb
Drizzle the achara liquid over the noodles and toss well.
1a400ca3-9c65-4dc8-8476-ed9a2cabbccb
Divide the cooked noodles among four shallow bowls.
1a400ca3-9c65-4dc8-8476-ed9a2cabbccb
Divide the cooked tocino into three portions and spread over the noodles.
1a400ca3-9c65-4dc8-8476-ed9a2cabbccb
Top the tocino with achara and scallions.
1a400ca3-9c65-4dc8-8476-ed9a2cabbccb
Arrange egg halves on the side of each bowl before serving your tocitlog.
94754f47-8f83-4090-ad6e-a8673c3e0ed5
If your pork chops are thicker than half an inch, lay them on a flat surface and pound with a mallet until they are about half an inch thick.
94754f47-8f83-4090-ad6e-a8673c3e0ed5
Pat the pork chops dry with paper towels.
94754f47-8f83-4090-ad6e-a8673c3e0ed5
Rub Cajun spice mix evenly on both sides of the pork chops.
94754f47-8f83-4090-ad6e-a8673c3e0ed5
Place the seasoned pork chops in a covered container and leave to marinate overnight in the fridge.
94754f47-8f83-4090-ad6e-a8673c3e0ed5
Place the flour in a shallow bowl.
94754f47-8f83-4090-ad6e-a8673c3e0ed5
Beat the egg in another shallow bowl.
94754f47-8f83-4090-ad6e-a8673c3e0ed5
Spread the panko in a third shallow bowl.
94754f47-8f83-4090-ad6e-a8673c3e0ed5
Dredge each pork chop in flour (shake off the excess), dip in egg (make sure every inch of the surface is covered) then roll in panko.
94754f47-8f83-4090-ad6e-a8673c3e0ed5
In a frying pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least two inches. Keep the heat on medium low.
94754f47-8f83-4090-ad6e-a8673c3e0ed5
Fry the pork chops on both sides (three to four minutes per side), flipping them midway through the cooking.
94754f47-8f83-4090-ad6e-a8673c3e0ed5
Remove the cooked pork chops from the oil and rest on a rack.
94754f47-8f83-4090-ad6e-a8673c3e0ed5
Lay the bottom halves of the buns on plates and line with shredded lettuce.
94754f47-8f83-4090-ad6e-a8673c3e0ed5
Place a pork chop on each of the lettuce-line bottom halves of the buns.
94754f47-8f83-4090-ad6e-a8673c3e0ed5
Drizzle gravy over the chops and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds before placing the top halves of the buns in place.
90c74ed0-3067-4f25-b5ba-3ff94c522a9d
90c74ed0-3067-4f25-b5ba-3ff94c522a9d
90c74ed0-3067-4f25-b5ba-3ff94c522a9d
3fd745de-602f-4708-937d-9479e035156c
315465b4-6926-4566-a21d-962bbb6334a7 Marinate the beef Cut the thinly-sliced beef into strips about half an inch wide.
315465b4-6926-4566-a21d-962bbb6334a7 Marinate the beef Place the meat in a bowl, add the garlic, pepper and seasoning. Mix well.
315465b4-6926-4566-a21d-962bbb6334a7 Marinate the beef Cover the bowl and let the meat marinate in the fridge overnight.
315465b4-6926-4566-a21d-962bbb6334a7 Cook the beef Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan.
315465b4-6926-4566-a21d-962bbb6334a7 Cook the beef Spread the beef on the pan. Leave to sear for about two minutes then stir to break up lumps. Cook over high heat, stirring often, just until done. DO NOT OVERCOOK. Beef sliced so thinly should cook in about five minutes.
315465b4-6926-4566-a21d-962bbb6334a7 Season the noodles In a large bowl, mix all the ingredients for the noodle seasoning. Add the noodles and toss thoroughly.
315465b4-6926-4566-a21d-962bbb6334a7 Assemble the tapcitlog Divide the noodles among three bowls.
315465b4-6926-4566-a21d-962bbb6334a7 Assemble the tapcitlog Divide the cooked beef into three portions. Arrange over the noodles leaving the center hollow.
315465b4-6926-4566-a21d-962bbb6334a7 Assemble the tapcitlog Crack the soft boiled egg at the center of the bowl.
315465b4-6926-4566-a21d-962bbb6334a7 Assemble the tapcitlog Garnish the tapcitlog with sliced scallion before serving.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Cut the beef tongue into one-inch cubes.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Cut the mushrooms into quarters (or into eighths if they are large).
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Deseed and dice the bell peppers.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Peel and roughly chop the onion.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Heat the butter in a pan.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Sprinkle the flour over the beef cubes and toss to coat each piece well.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Brown the floured beef tongue cubes in the hot butter.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Add the mushrooms, bell peppers and onion. Sprinkle in salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about three minutes.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Pour in the bone broth slowly, stirring as you pour. Add the rice wine, if using. When the mixture is thickened and smooth, taste and add salt, pepper and a pinch of nutmeg.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Cool the beef tongue a la king to room temperature.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Preheat the oven to 375F.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Roll out the pie crust dough into 1/4-inch thickness.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Pour the cooled beef tongue a king into a pie dish and smooth the top with the back of a spoon.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Cover the beef tongue a la king with the pie crust (see tip). Cut the excess dough; then press the dough against the rim of the baking dish (you may fold and tuck it in, if you wish).
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Brush the top of the pie crust with the beaten egg.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Slit the crust in several places to create steam vents.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Bake the beef tongue a la king pot pie at 375F for 20 to 30 minutes or until the crust is golden and the filling is bubbly.
e0366f6c-6d52-4708-afec-37c8473bd3b9
Cool the pot pie for about 10 minutes before cutting and serving.
2f63f205-3cfa-4f32-96c0-f74327ef75bb
Cut the beef into thin slices.
2f63f205-3cfa-4f32-96c0-f74327ef75bb
Rinse the lettuce and break up unto bite-size pieces. Pass through the salad spinner to remove as much water as possible.
2f63f205-3cfa-4f32-96c0-f74327ef75bb
Dump the bean sprouts in a large bowl and fill with water. Pick out bean skins that float and discard. Pour off the water. Rinse the sprouts a few times and drain. Pass through the salad spinner (don’t overdo this!) to remove surface water.
2f63f205-3cfa-4f32-96c0-f74327ef75bb
Toast the cashew nuts in an oil-free pan until lightly browned. Cool.
2f63f205-3cfa-4f32-96c0-f74327ef75bb
To make the dressing, start by thinning the peanut butter. Place in a bowl, add a quarter cup of hot water and mix until smooth.
2f63f205-3cfa-4f32-96c0-f74327ef75bb
Add the rest of the salad dressing ingredients to the peanut butter and mix well. Add more hot water, a tablespoon at a time, until the dressing is pourable. Note that I used a total of one-half cup hot water.
2f63f205-3cfa-4f32-96c0-f74327ef75bb
In a large mixing bowl, toss the beef, lettuce and bean sprouts.
2f63f205-3cfa-4f32-96c0-f74327ef75bb
Drizzle the dressing over the salad.
2f63f205-3cfa-4f32-96c0-f74327ef75bb
Sprinkle in the cashew nuts.
2f63f205-3cfa-4f32-96c0-f74327ef75bb
Serve the remaining dressing on the side.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Peel the beef tongue. Cut into half inch slices. Set aside.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Peel the carrot and potato; cut into half-inch cubes.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Deseed the bell peppers and dice.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Cut the olives into halves.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Peel and roughly chop the onion.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Smash, peel and chop the garlic.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Heat the cooking oil in a heavy shallow pan.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Spread the carrot and potato cubes, and the diced bell pepper, on the hot oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Fry until the edges of the vegetables start to brown.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Add the onion and garlic. Continue cooking, stirring often, until the onion softens.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Push the vegetables to the sides of the pan.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Arrange the beef tongue slices, slightly overlapping, in the middle of the pan.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Mix together all the ingredients for the sauce and pour over the beef tongue.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Lower the heat, cover the pan and simmer for about 10 minutes or until the beef tongue slices are heated through and has soaked up some of the sauce.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Using a wide spatula, transfer the beef tongue to a platter.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Spoon the cooked vegetables on both sides of the meat.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Drizzle all the pan juices over the beef tongue and vegetables.
826da46d-cd82-442a-bd12-59ac717a68d1
Optionally, sprinkle the lengua (beef tongue) estofado with parsley before serving.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Rinse the beef and wipe dry with a kitchen towel. Cut into two-inch cubes.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Peel the onion and roughly chop.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Peel the garlic cloves and smash.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Peel the ginger and finely chop.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Heat the olive oil in a wide pan.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Spread the beef cubes on the bottom of the pan and sprinkle generously with salt and pepper.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Brown the beef cubes in the oil, in batches if necessary, turning the pieces over for even coloring. Scoop out the browned beef cubes and set aside.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
In the remaining oil in the pan, saute the onion, garlic and ginger until softened. Remember to scrape the bottom of the pan to loosen browned bits stuck to the bottom.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Add the cayenne, turmeric, paprika and two generous pinches of salt, and continue sauteeing until fragrant.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Return the beef cubes to the pan, add the golden raisins and stir.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Pour in the yogurt and bring to a gentle boil. Cover the pan, set the heat to the lowest setting and cook the beef for about two hours or until fork tender. The actual cooking time depends on the cut and quality of the beef.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Stir occasionally and scrape the bottom of the pan to make sure there is no scorching. If the liquid dries up during cooking, add half a cup of water (bone broth is a better choice if you have some), stir and continue simmering. Repeat if the beef takes longer to cook.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Taste the sauce occasionally as well and add more salt, if needed.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
While the beef simmers, Deseed the bell peppers and dice. Stir into the stew after the beef has been simmering for about an hour and a half.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Toast the pistachio in an oil-free pan. Set aside to cool.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Cut the mangoes, discard the stones and dice the flesh.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
When the beef is tender, stir in the diced mangoes and simmer for another five minutes.
566865a0-c7ce-4db6-a5ae-20d108e9b840
Sprinkle the pistachio over the stew before serving.
3cbc6335-ddfb-4e7b-a381-f5469c46aff0 Make the dressing Start by making the dressing to give the flavors time to develop. Peel the garlic, lightly pound then place in a small bowl and drizzle in just enough olive oil to moisten.
3cbc6335-ddfb-4e7b-a381-f5469c46aff0 Make the dressing Heat an oil-free pan and roast the garlic over low heat until soft, lightly browned and aromatic. Cool.
3cbc6335-ddfb-4e7b-a381-f5469c46aff0 Make the dressing Mash the cooled garlic on a plate with the back of a fork. Alternatively, use a mortar and pestle.
3cbc6335-ddfb-4e7b-a381-f5469c46aff0 Make the dressing Place the mashed garlic in a bowl. Add the mayo and mix. Add a teaspoonful of lemon juice, a pinch of salt and a pinch of pepper. Taste. Add more lemon juice, salt and pepper to suit your taste. Cover the bowl and chill in the fridge.
3cbc6335-ddfb-4e7b-a381-f5469c46aff0 Make the dressing (Note that the thickness of the dressing depends a lot on the quality of your mayo. If the dressing is still too thick after sufficient lemon juice has been added, do not be tempted to thin it out with more lemon juice. If you do, the dressing may turn out too tart. Thin out the dressing by adding milk or its vegan equivalent.)
3cbc6335-ddfb-4e7b-a381-f5469c46aff0 Make the salad Rest the burgers for 10 minutes after cooking. Cut into bite size pieces. Set aside.
3cbc6335-ddfb-4e7b-a381-f5469c46aff0 Make the salad Rinse the lettuce well. Tear into bite size pieces then dry in a salad spinner.
3cbc6335-ddfb-4e7b-a381-f5469c46aff0 Make the salad Cut the tomatoes into one-inch cubes.
3cbc6335-ddfb-4e7b-a381-f5469c46aff0 Make the salad Split the cucumbers into halves lengthwise, scoop out and discard the seeds (skip the scooping part if you'd rather keep the seeds). Cut the cucumbers into one-inch cubes.
3cbc6335-ddfb-4e7b-a381-f5469c46aff0 Make the salad On a platter, arrange all the salad ingredients in rows.
3cbc6335-ddfb-4e7b-a381-f5469c46aff0 Make the salad Drizzle the dressing over the burger salad and serve. Excess dressing may be served on the side.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Rinse the pork belly and pat dry with a kitchen towel.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Line the bottom of the slow cooker with non-stick paper.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Lay the pork belly in the lined slow cooker.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Pour the sauce over the meat.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Set the cooker to LOW and cook the pork belly for four to four and a half hours.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Remove the inner container of the cooker (the ceramic pot) from the outer casing and let the pork cool to room temperature.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Carefully transfer the pork to a resealable bag (or any container with a tight lid) and pour in the sauce. Seal and keep in the fridge until needed. It should remain good for a week.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Take the pork out of the fridge and allow to warm to room temperature.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Take the pork belly out of the bag; reserve the sauce.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Slice the pork belly thinly.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Take two large shallow bowls and cover the bottom with non-stick paper.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Arrange the pork belly slices in the bowls and pour the sauce over the meat.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Cover the pork slices and sauce with cooked rice.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Cover the bowls with foil.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Steam the pork, sauce and rice for 20 to 30 minutes.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Remove the bowls from the steamer, peel off the foil covers and invert into serving plates.
7c3b13ed-0b6a-46e4-aaf9-c1917ad5cb54
Sprinkle with scallions and serve immediately.
9631d515-496c-46f3-ac93-f9d9e6847946
Rinse the pork and pat dry with a kitchen towel. Drying the meat is essential for the browning stage.
9631d515-496c-46f3-ac93-f9d9e6847946
Cut the pork into two-inch pieces.
9631d515-496c-46f3-ac93-f9d9e6847946
Smash the garlic and discard the skins. Finely chop or mince the garlic.
9631d515-496c-46f3-ac93-f9d9e6847946
Peel and finely chop the shallots.
9631d515-496c-46f3-ac93-f9d9e6847946
Pour the oil into a heavy pan (a fryer, wide and not too tall, is recommended). Tilt the pan around to allow the oil to coat the entire bottom.
9631d515-496c-46f3-ac93-f9d9e6847946
Spread the pork in the pan. Leave undisturbed for a few minutes to allow to brown.
9631d515-496c-46f3-ac93-f9d9e6847946
Flip the pork over and sear the other side.
9631d515-496c-46f3-ac93-f9d9e6847946
When the pork starts to render fat, add the garlic, shallots, pepper and bay leaves to the pork. Continue browning, stirring often, until the the pork is lightly caramelized.
9631d515-496c-46f3-ac93-f9d9e6847946
Pour in the Balsamic vinegar and patis. Add half a cup of water and stir. Bring to the boil, lower the heat, cover the pan tightly and slow cook the pork until tender.
9631d515-496c-46f3-ac93-f9d9e6847946
Check once in a while. Taste and adjust the seasonings, if needed. If the liquid evaporates too fast, add another quarter cup of water and continue cooking. Repeat if the pork takes longer to cook.
9631d515-496c-46f3-ac93-f9d9e6847946
When the pork is done, drizzle in the soy sauce and stir.
9631d515-496c-46f3-ac93-f9d9e6847946
Throw in the pineapple tidbits.
9631d515-496c-46f3-ac93-f9d9e6847946
Cover the pan and simmer for another ten minutes.
9631d515-496c-46f3-ac93-f9d9e6847946
Sprinkle sliced scallions over the Balsamic pork adobo with pineapple and serve.
7971ddd0-e160-4213-9398-58d53865ccbe
Turn the stove to HIGH and heat the cooking oil in a wide pan.
7971ddd0-e160-4213-9398-58d53865ccbe
When the oil starts to smoke, spread the pork cubes on the bottom. Do not disturb for a few minutes to allow to brown. Then, stir to break up lumps. Continue cooking with occasional stirring until all sides are uniformly browned.
7971ddd0-e160-4213-9398-58d53865ccbe
Sprinkle the Cajun spice mix and sugar over the pork cubes. Cook, stirring, until the color is uniform.
7971ddd0-e160-4213-9398-58d53865ccbe
Pour in the bone broth. When the mixture starts to simmer, cover the pot, turn the heat down to LOW and cook the pork until tender, about 50 minutes. Taste occasionally and add more seasoning if needed. If the liquid dries up before the pork reaches the desired level of tenderness, pour in more bone broth, a quarter cup at a time.
7971ddd0-e160-4213-9398-58d53865ccbe
Add the corn kernels and diced bell peppers to the pork and stir. Continue cooking over low heat, covered, until the corn kernels are done.
7971ddd0-e160-4213-9398-58d53865ccbe
Serve the Cajun-style pork stew with crusty bread or rice.
255cf789-68cb-47ce-af80-872742c3b3fa
Pat the pork chops dry with paper towels.
255cf789-68cb-47ce-af80-872742c3b3fa
Brush the oil on the entire bottom of a frying pan and turn the heat to high.
255cf789-68cb-47ce-af80-872742c3b3fa
Lay the pork chops side by side on the pan and sear. Flip to brown the opposite side.
255cf789-68cb-47ce-af80-872742c3b3fa
While the pork chops brown, mix all the ingredients for the sauce.
255cf789-68cb-47ce-af80-872742c3b3fa
Pour the sauce over the meat.
255cf789-68cb-47ce-af80-872742c3b3fa
Turn down the heat to low, cover the pan tightly and braise the pork chops for 20 to 25 minutes or until done, flipping them over halfway through the cooking time.
255cf789-68cb-47ce-af80-872742c3b3fa
By the time the meat is done, there should be very little sauce that has thickened considerably.
255cf789-68cb-47ce-af80-872742c3b3fa
Brush the remaining sauce on the pork chops before serving topped with sliced scallions.
6ef5cf9a-c554-42d1-a429-780f16289429
In a large bowl, mix all the ingredients for the filling. Set aside.
6ef5cf9a-c554-42d1-a429-780f16289429
Soak the bean curd sheets in water for five minutes. Drain well.
6ef5cf9a-c554-42d1-a429-780f16289429
Divide the filling into seven equal portions.
6ef5cf9a-c554-42d1-a429-780f16289429
Lay a bean curd sheet flat and spread one portion of the filling in the center. Wrap the filling with the bean curd sheet as though making a spring roll (see visual guide).
6ef5cf9a-c554-42d1-a429-780f16289429
Repeat until you have used all the filling and bean curd sheets.
6ef5cf9a-c554-42d1-a429-780f16289429
Arrange the que-kiam in a steamer basket. Steam for 45 minutes (it won't hurt to steam them a little longer).
6ef5cf9a-c554-42d1-a429-780f16289429
Cool the steamed que-kiam to cool temperature.
6ef5cf9a-c554-42d1-a429-780f16289429
Heat at least two inches of oil in a frying pan.
6ef5cf9a-c554-42d1-a429-780f16289429
Fry the cooled steamed que-kiam over medium-low heat until the bean curd wrapper is golden and crisp.
6ef5cf9a-c554-42d1-a429-780f16289429
Cool the fried que-kiam slightly before slicing.
6ef5cf9a-c554-42d1-a429-780f16289429
Serve the que-kiam with sweet chili sauce for dipping. It's great as a finger food or as a main dish.
83646ee4-2fdf-49d8-a9b5-74be2e3b2192
Cut the pork slices into bite-size pieces. Throw into a bowl with the ginger, garlic, salt, pepper and rice wine. Mix well. Cover and allow to marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.
83646ee4-2fdf-49d8-a9b5-74be2e3b2192
Heat enough cooking oil in a wok or frying pan to reach a depth of at least two inches.
83646ee4-2fdf-49d8-a9b5-74be2e3b2192
Take the pork out of the fridge.
83646ee4-2fdf-49d8-a9b5-74be2e3b2192
Crack the egg directly into a bowl and stir. Add the starch and whisk to form a loose batter.
83646ee4-2fdf-49d8-a9b5-74be2e3b2192
Add the pork to the batter and mix well.
83646ee4-2fdf-49d8-a9b5-74be2e3b2192
Drop the battered pork, one at a time, into the hot oil. Fry the pork in two to three batches to avoid overcrowding the pan. If the pork has been sliced thinly enough, the cooking time should be short, no more than three to four minutes per batch.
83646ee4-2fdf-49d8-a9b5-74be2e3b2192
Drain the pork in a strainer or a stack of paper towels.
83646ee4-2fdf-49d8-a9b5-74be2e3b2192
Pour off the oil from the wok or frying pan.
83646ee4-2fdf-49d8-a9b5-74be2e3b2192
Turn the heat to high. Stir fry the bell pepper, carrot and scallions with salt and pepper for about half a minute.
83646ee4-2fdf-49d8-a9b5-74be2e3b2192
Add the pork to the vegetables and toss to reheat.
83646ee4-2fdf-49d8-a9b5-74be2e3b2192
Pour in the sauce. Stir. Boil for a few seconds.
83646ee4-2fdf-49d8-a9b5-74be2e3b2192
Tip the contents of the wok or frying pan into a platter. Garnish with more scallions, optionally. Serve the Chinese-style sweet and sour pork immediately.
deed807e-c218-44f5-a8a3-a04547d546b9
Place the pork ribs in a pot. Cover with water. Boil, uncovered, for ten minutes.
deed807e-c218-44f5-a8a3-a04547d546b9
Pour the ribs into a strainer. Throw out the boiling liquid.
deed807e-c218-44f5-a8a3-a04547d546b9
Rinse each piece of pork well under the tap making sure to remove any scum attached to the meat and bones.
deed807e-c218-44f5-a8a3-a04547d546b9
Wash the pot (or use another) and put the rinsed pork ribs in it. Pour in enough water to cover.
deed807e-c218-44f5-a8a3-a04547d546b9
Place the pot on the stove and turn the heat to high.
deed807e-c218-44f5-a8a3-a04547d546b9
Add all the remaining ingredients to the pork.
deed807e-c218-44f5-a8a3-a04547d546b9
When the liquid boils, lower the heat, cover the bowl and simmer for an hour and a half to two hours or until the meat is very tender and easily separates from the bone. Taste the broth once in a while and add more seasonings, if needed. Tip: if the broth lacks saltiness, you may add salt rather than more soy sauce to prevent the broth from turning too dark.
deed807e-c218-44f5-a8a3-a04547d546b9
If adding shiitake mushrooms, put them in the pot during the last half hour of cooking.
deed807e-c218-44f5-a8a3-a04547d546b9
If adding tofu, drop them into the pot during the last ten minutes of cooking.
deed807e-c218-44f5-a8a3-a04547d546b9
To serve, put a few pieces of pork ribs, mushrooms and tofu into bowls, ladle in the broth and arrange some greens on the side.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Cook the pork Pat the pork belly dry with paper towels.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Cook the pork Heat the cooking oil in a shallow pan.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Cook the pork Sear all sides of the pork belly in hot oil until browned.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Cook the pork Pour in the soy sauce, rice wine and bone broth. Bring to the boil and cook, uncovered, for about five minutes.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Cook the pork Stir in the sugar, ginger, garlic, five-spice powder and hoisin sauce. Lower the heat, cover the pan tightly and simmer for an hour to an hour and half, turning the pork belly halfway through the cooking.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Cook the pork Preheat the oven to 350F.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Cook the pork Transfer the pork belly to a baking dish.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Cook the pork Boil the sauce, uncovered, until thick and reduced to about a quarter cup.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Cook the pork Brush the reduced sauce all over the pork belly.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Cook the pork Bake the pork belly in a preheated 350F oven for 10 to 15 minutes or just until the glaze caramelizes. Remove from the oven and cool slightly.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Blanch the bok choy Rinse the bok choy well. DO NOT separate the stalks. Just make sure there is no soil hiding between them.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Blanch the bok choy Boil about four cups water with one teaspoon salt in a shallow pan.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Blanch the bok choy Cook the bok choy in the salted water for about five minutes. Scoop out, drain and set aside.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Stir fry the noodles Throw out the salted water and pour another four cups into the pan. Bring to the boil.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Stir fry the noodles Cook the dried egg noodles just until done. DO NOT allow to get soggy.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Stir fry the noodles Drain the noodles. Dump in a bowl of iced water and leave for a minute until the noodles are cold. This stabilizes the starch to allow the noodles to be stir fried without sticking to one another. Drain well.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Stir fry the noodles Heat the sesame seed oil in a wok or frying pan. Stir fry the egg noodles to coat every strand with oil.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Stir fry the noodles Pour in the soy sauce and hoisin sauce. Stir fry until the coloring is even.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Assemble the dish Arrange the blanched bok choy on the sides of a platter.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Assemble the dish Spread the noodles to fill the plate.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Assemble the dish Cut the pork belly into one-fourth inch sliced and arrange on top of the noodles.
63e0ee12-848c-4980-bf28-8925f27deb7d Assemble the dish Serve the five-spice braised pork belly with noodles and bok choy immediately.
1ba55e1d-c62a-4416-a5f5-b2ef0757c38e
Place the beef shank, bone hole side up, in a pot and cover with water. Boil for 10 minutes. Drain and rinse; throw out the water.
1ba55e1d-c62a-4416-a5f5-b2ef0757c38e
In a pot tall enough to allow the shank to be cooked in an upright position with the bone hole side up, pour in the tomato sauce and two cups of bone broth, and bring to a gentle boil.
1ba55e1d-c62a-4416-a5f5-b2ef0757c38e
Drop the rinsed beef shank into the pot, bone hole side up preferably, and sprinkle in salt and pepper. Cover the pot and simmer until the meat is tender and can be easily separated from the bone. Check the liquid occasionally to make sure that the meaty portion of the shank is submerged in liquid throughout the cooking. Add more broth, if needed, about half a cup at a time.
1ba55e1d-c62a-4416-a5f5-b2ef0757c38e
When the meat is tender, uncover the pot and continue cooking the beef shank over medium heat to reduce and thicken the sauce.
1ba55e1d-c62a-4416-a5f5-b2ef0757c38e
Meanwhile, boil about three cups of water with a teaspoonful of salt in another pot.
1ba55e1d-c62a-4416-a5f5-b2ef0757c38e
Trim the ends and edges of the green beans and cook in the salted water for five to seven minutes.
1ba55e1d-c62a-4416-a5f5-b2ef0757c38e
While the green beans cook, peel the carrot and potato. Cut both into cubes.
1ba55e1d-c62a-4416-a5f5-b2ef0757c38e
Scoop out the green beans and set aside.
1ba55e1d-c62a-4416-a5f5-b2ef0757c38e
Stir in another teaspoonful of salt into the water and dump in the carrot and potato cubes. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes or until tender then drain.
1ba55e1d-c62a-4416-a5f5-b2ef0757c38e
Scoop out the beef shank from the sauce and place in a serving bowl.
1ba55e1d-c62a-4416-a5f5-b2ef0757c38e
Ladle the reduced tomato sauce into the bowl with the shank.
1ba55e1d-c62a-4416-a5f5-b2ef0757c38e
Arrange the cooked vegetables around the beef shank.
1ba55e1d-c62a-4416-a5f5-b2ef0757c38e
Serve your bulalo stew at once.
9d5fb232-eeb4-44ab-82e7-c4167291ad3b
Cut the pork belly into one-inch cubes. Separate any large chunks of pork fat.
9d5fb232-eeb4-44ab-82e7-c4167291ad3b
Peel and finely slice the shallots.
9d5fb232-eeb4-44ab-82e7-c4167291ad3b
Peel and mince the garlic.
9d5fb232-eeb4-44ab-82e7-c4167291ad3b
Peel and finely chop the ginger.
9d5fb232-eeb4-44ab-82e7-c4167291ad3b
Thinly slice the lemongrass (white and light green portions only; see visual guide for preparing lemongrass for cooking).
9d5fb232-eeb4-44ab-82e7-c4167291ad3b
Thinly slice the finger chilies. If you prefer less heat, slit the chilies and scrape off the seeds and white pith inside before slicing (see if you want your chilies mildly hot instead of very hot). Reserve a tablespoon for garnish.
9d5fb232-eeb4-44ab-82e7-c4167291ad3b
Heat a thick pan (Speedy used our carbon steel wok). Toss in the pork fat and cook over medium heat until you have about two tablespoons of rendered fat. Scoop out any remaining solids (it's chicharon!).
9d5fb232-eeb4-44ab-82e7-c4167291ad3b
Add the pork cubes to the rendered fat and cook over high heat until well browned. Ideally, the rind should be puffed.
9d5fb232-eeb4-44ab-82e7-c4167291ad3b
Add the shallots, garlic, ginger, lemongrass and chilies. Pour in a tablespoon of patis. Saute for a minute or so until aromatic.
9d5fb232-eeb4-44ab-82e7-c4167291ad3b
Pour in the coconut cream. Add another tablespoon of patis. Bring to a gentle boil, lower the heat, cover the pan and simmer until the pork is tender and the liquid is reduced.
9d5fb232-eeb4-44ab-82e7-c4167291ad3b
Taste, add more patis, if needed. before turning off the heat.
9d5fb232-eeb4-44ab-82e7-c4167291ad3b
Serve your Bicol Express garnished with the reserved chilies.
46e1fea8-80bd-4ae8-997f-70f3b2fa521d
Arrange the pork belly slices in a wide shallow pan. Cover with water. Boil for 10 minutes.
46e1fea8-80bd-4ae8-997f-70f3b2fa521d
Drain the pork belly and rinse well to remove scum. Discard the water.
46e1fea8-80bd-4ae8-997f-70f3b2fa521d
Clean out the pan (or use another wide shallow pan) and spread the pork belly slices on the bottom. Pour in the broth and bring to the boil. Cover, lower the heat and simmer for 45 minutes to an hour or until tender. Halfway through the cooking time, taste the broth and add salt, if needed.
46e1fea8-80bd-4ae8-997f-70f3b2fa521d
While the pork cooks, toast the rice flour in an oil-free frying pan over medium heat until lightly browned and nutty in aroma. Set aside.
46e1fea8-80bd-4ae8-997f-70f3b2fa521d
Scoop out the pork belly slices, move to a rack and allow to cool.
46e1fea8-80bd-4ae8-997f-70f3b2fa521d
Pour the broth into a pot and reheat. Dump in the annatto seeds and boil until the broth turns reddish. Scoop out the annatto seeds and discard.
46e1fea8-80bd-4ae8-997f-70f3b2fa521d
Reheat the broth. Throw in the sitaw and cabbage wedges. Cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Scoop out, transfer to a plate and set aside. Do not turn off the heat.
46e1fea8-80bd-4ae8-997f-70f3b2fa521d
Add the banana heart and eggplant to the boiling broth. Cook just until done, about 10 minutes. Scoop out, move to a plate and set aside.
46e1fea8-80bd-4ae8-997f-70f3b2fa521d
Make the peanut sauce. Take out half a cup of the broth from the pan and pour into a heat proof bowl. Add the peanut butter and rice flour; stir until smooth.
46e1fea8-80bd-4ae8-997f-70f3b2fa521d
Pour the peanut butter mixture into the hot broth. Cook over medium heat, stirring, until smooth and thickened. Set aside.
46e1fea8-80bd-4ae8-997f-70f3b2fa521d
Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan. Fry the pork belly slices until browned and crisp. Do this in batches, if necessary, so that the pork slices do not touch one another during frying to ensure even cooking and browning.
46e1fea8-80bd-4ae8-997f-70f3b2fa521d
Reheat the sauce. Add all the cooked vegetables, stirring gently. Cook just until simmering.
46e1fea8-80bd-4ae8-997f-70f3b2fa521d
Pour the sauce and vegetables into a bowl. Top with the crispy pork belly. Serve immediately.
32ff5b24-bff9-4f97-b135-a7e4d9d14f86
Rinse the knee caps and wipe dry with paper towels.
32ff5b24-bff9-4f97-b135-a7e4d9d14f86
In a wok or frying pan, heat enough cooking to reach a depth of at least half an inch.
32ff5b24-bff9-4f97-b135-a7e4d9d14f86
Sear both sides of the knee cap until browned. Scoop out and move to a pot.
32ff5b24-bff9-4f97-b135-a7e4d9d14f86
Pour four cups of bone broth into the pot.
32ff5b24-bff9-4f97-b135-a7e4d9d14f86
Add the garlic, shallots, peppercorns and bay leaves.
32ff5b24-bff9-4f97-b135-a7e4d9d14f86
Bring to the boil, lower the heat and simmer. After an hour, taste the broth and add salt, if needed. Because you're dousing the meat later with sauce, it is best to under season at this point. Go easy on the salt.
32ff5b24-bff9-4f97-b135-a7e4d9d14f86
Cook the beef until the meat is separating from the bones. Depending on the age of the animal, that should take anywhere from two to three hours.
32ff5b24-bff9-4f97-b135-a7e4d9d14f86
When the beef is almost done, lightly fry the onion rings in the same oil where the beef was seared. Set aside.
32ff5b24-bff9-4f97-b135-a7e4d9d14f86
Scoop out the meat and move to a serving bowl or plate.
32ff5b24-bff9-4f97-b135-a7e4d9d14f86
Pour the soy sauce and kalamansi juice into a sauce pan. Add enough broth (in which the beef knee caps were simmered) to make a salty-tangy sauce. Bring to the boil then turn off the heat.
32ff5b24-bff9-4f97-b135-a7e4d9d14f86
Ladle the sauce over the beef knee caps. Garnish with the fried onion rings, crispy garlic and sliced scallions.
80069d2f-49bf-4c2a-adbd-0aa83702ef00
Place the pork chunks in a bowl. Sprinkle with 1 and 1/2 teaspoons salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Mix well. Set aside.
80069d2f-49bf-4c2a-adbd-0aa83702ef00
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a wok or frying pan.
80069d2f-49bf-4c2a-adbd-0aa83702ef00
Saute the carrot, mushrooms and bell pepper with a sprinkle of salt and pepper for about a minute. Do not overcook. Scoop out, move to a plate and set aside.
80069d2f-49bf-4c2a-adbd-0aa83702ef00
Pour enough oil into the wok or frying pan to reach a depth of at least two inches. Heat until fine wisps of smoke float on the surface.
80069d2f-49bf-4c2a-adbd-0aa83702ef00
Add the starch to the seasoned pork and toss to coat each piece.
80069d2f-49bf-4c2a-adbd-0aa83702ef00
Drop the pork chunks one by one into the hot oil, shaking off excess starch back into the bowl.
80069d2f-49bf-4c2a-adbd-0aa83702ef00
Cook the pork, in batches of your wok or pan is on the small side, until golden, crisp and cooked through. Scoop out and move to a rack or strainer.
80069d2f-49bf-4c2a-adbd-0aa83702ef00
Pour off the oil from the wok or frying pan.
80069d2f-49bf-4c2a-adbd-0aa83702ef00
Reheat the pan and pour in the honey and balsamic vinegar. Stir and allow to get bubbly. Turn off the heat.
80069d2f-49bf-4c2a-adbd-0aa83702ef00
Add the fried pork to the sauce and toss to coat each piece.
80069d2f-49bf-4c2a-adbd-0aa83702ef00
Add the sauteed vegetables and mushrooms to the pork and toss to distribute.
80069d2f-49bf-4c2a-adbd-0aa83702ef00
Transfer the crispy pork chunks with honey balsamic sauce to a platter. Sprinkle with sliced scallions before serving.
750b065e-a072-4240-93b8-78b4606d16a6
71cbf77c-8645-41e2-8cf0-532de8289719
2b6fb3db-3a95-49fc-b862-a8441f34be54
Place the pork belly slices in a shallow container large enough so that the pork slices are spread evenly. Sprinkle the herb salt over the meat.
2b6fb3db-3a95-49fc-b862-a8441f34be54
Pour in the ginger age. Tilt the container around a bit to distribute the herb salt as evenly as possible.
2b6fb3db-3a95-49fc-b862-a8441f34be54
Cover the container and allow the meat to marinate in the fridge for at least an hour.
2b6fb3db-3a95-49fc-b862-a8441f34be54
Drain the pork slices and transfer to a large mixing bowl.
2b6fb3db-3a95-49fc-b862-a8441f34be54
Beat the egg and pour over the pork. Mix. Make sure the pork slices are evenly coated with egg.
2b6fb3db-3a95-49fc-b862-a8441f34be54
Dump the starch over the egg-coated pork. Mix until you get a thin batter coating all the pork slices.
2b6fb3db-3a95-49fc-b862-a8441f34be54
Alternatively, stir the beaten egg and starch together before mixing in the pork.
2b6fb3db-3a95-49fc-b862-a8441f34be54
Heat enough cooking oil in a frying pan to reach a depth of at least two inches. The ideal temperature of the oil should be 350F.
2b6fb3db-3a95-49fc-b862-a8441f34be54
Fry the pork belly slices, in batches if your frying pan is rather smallish, until the batter is crisp and golden brown, about five minutes per batch, at which time the meat should be cooked through.
2b6fb3db-3a95-49fc-b862-a8441f34be54
Serve the crispy bacon-cut pork belly by itself as an appetizer or over rice as a main dish.
c5abdf85-be23-4be1-b9e6-ab7137a5f6eb
Arrange the beef on a baking tray and roast in a preheated 400F oven for 15 to 20 minutes until the edges are lightly browned.
c5abdf85-be23-4be1-b9e6-ab7137a5f6eb
Heat the oil in a thick-bottomed pot.
c5abdf85-be23-4be1-b9e6-ab7137a5f6eb
Saute the garlic and onion with the cumin, cayenne, paprika, pepper and bay leaves.
c5abdf85-be23-4be1-b9e6-ab7137a5f6eb
Pour in the diced tomatoes and broth. Season with salt (the amount depends on how well-seasoned the broth is).
c5abdf85-be23-4be1-b9e6-ab7137a5f6eb
Drop the roasted beef into the pan. Cover and simmer for three to three-and-a-half hours.
c5abdf85-be23-4be1-b9e6-ab7137a5f6eb
Scoop out the beef and transfer to a large plate or the chopping board.
c5abdf85-be23-4be1-b9e6-ab7137a5f6eb
Using two forks, shred the meat. Cut tendons and fat into small pieces.
c5abdf85-be23-4be1-b9e6-ab7137a5f6eb
Fish out the bay leaves from the cooking liquid and discard.
c5abdf85-be23-4be1-b9e6-ab7137a5f6eb
Return the beef (minus the bones, if any), to the cooking broth. Add the bell peppers and olives. Cook uncovered over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has reduced considerably. Taste once in a while and add salt, if needed. I like my ropa vieja to be almost dry. If you prefer a saucy stew, stop cooking while there is still a generous amount of sauce.
dafd294e-54ad-4926-91ea-a50e42fb121b Simmer the tripe Rinse the tripe well. Use a soft brush to scrub the surface to remove any impurities. Rinse again and place in a pot.
dafd294e-54ad-4926-91ea-a50e42fb121b Simmer the tripe Pour enough water into the pot to cover the tripe completely. Bring to the boil and boil hard for about 10 minutes. Drain, discard the water and rinse the tripe well.
dafd294e-54ad-4926-91ea-a50e42fb121b Simmer the tripe Put the tripe in a clean pot and cover with water. Add the salt, peppercorns, garlic, shallot, ginger and bay leaf. Simmer until tender (see notes below). Top with water as needed every two hours or so.
dafd294e-54ad-4926-91ea-a50e42fb121b Simmer the tripe Drain the tripe and cool.
dafd294e-54ad-4926-91ea-a50e42fb121b Marinate the tripe Cut the cooled tripe into strips about half an inch wide and three inches long.
dafd294e-54ad-4926-91ea-a50e42fb121b Marinate the tripe Place the tripe strips in a bowl, add the nuoc mam pha and kaffir lime leaves. Mix well.
dafd294e-54ad-4926-91ea-a50e42fb121b Marinate the tripe Cover the bowl and marinate the tripe in the fridge overnight.
dafd294e-54ad-4926-91ea-a50e42fb121b Deep fry the tripe Heat enough cooking oil in a wok or pan to reach a depth of at least three inches.
dafd294e-54ad-4926-91ea-a50e42fb121b Deep fry the tripe Drain the tripe and discard the strips of kaffir lime leaves.
dafd294e-54ad-4926-91ea-a50e42fb121b Deep fry the tripe Add the starch to the drained tripe and toss to coat each piece well with starch.
dafd294e-54ad-4926-91ea-a50e42fb121b Deep fry the tripe When the oil is hot, drop the starched tripe strips into it. Fry, about 10 to 12 pieces at a time, until a deep golden crust forms on the surface of the tripe.
dafd294e-54ad-4926-91ea-a50e42fb121b Deep fry the tripe Drain the deep-fried tripe on a rack or a stack of paper towels.
dafd294e-54ad-4926-91ea-a50e42fb121b Deep fry the tripe Serve the deep-fried honeycomb tripe with your preferred dipping sauce as an appetizer, or pair with rice for your meal.
64d3f2ff-adf7-4038-8cc6-c7b1cd7cbf03 Sear the beef Cut the beef into half inch slices. Make sure to remove any sinews. Cut each slice into strips about two inches long.
64d3f2ff-adf7-4038-8cc6-c7b1cd7cbf03 Sear the beef Place the beef in a bowl. Add the salt, pepper and garlic. Mix well. Cover and marinate in the fridge for at least an hour.
64d3f2ff-adf7-4038-8cc6-c7b1cd7cbf03 Sear the beef Heat a heavy frying pan (a pan with a thin bottom will not do for this cooking method). Drop in the butter, lift the pan and swirl to melt the butter without burning.
64d3f2ff-adf7-4038-8cc6-c7b1cd7cbf03 Sear the beef Set the pan on the stove and, working fast, spread the beef strips on the bottom of the pan. Sear over high heat without disturbing for a minute and a half or until the undersides are browned.
64d3f2ff-adf7-4038-8cc6-c7b1cd7cbf03 Sear the beef Flip the pieces over, sear for a minute then stir. Cook for a minute longer, stirring occasionally.
64d3f2ff-adf7-4038-8cc6-c7b1cd7cbf03 Sear the beef Scoop out the beef, transfer to a plate and cover loosely.
64d3f2ff-adf7-4038-8cc6-c7b1cd7cbf03 Make the cheese gravy Add the butter to the remaining oil in the pan. Drop in the rosemary. Melt the butter over medium heat.
64d3f2ff-adf7-4038-8cc6-c7b1cd7cbf03 Make the cheese gravy Add the flour all at once then stir to remove lumps.
64d3f2ff-adf7-4038-8cc6-c7b1cd7cbf03 Make the cheese gravy Cook the butter and flour, scraping the bottom of the pan, for five minutes to make a blonde roux.
64d3f2ff-adf7-4038-8cc6-c7b1cd7cbf03 Make the cheese gravy Mix the milk and cream. Pour a cup into the roux, stirring as you pour. Cook, stirring, until thickened.
64d3f2ff-adf7-4038-8cc6-c7b1cd7cbf03 Make the cheese gravy Stir in the cheeses and continue cooking until melted and well incorporated. Taste. Add salt and pepper, if needed.
64d3f2ff-adf7-4038-8cc6-c7b1cd7cbf03 Make the cheese gravy If the cheese gravy is too thick for your liking, add the rest of the milk-cream mixture until you get the consistency that you prefer. Remember to adjust the seasonings if adding more liquid.
64d3f2ff-adf7-4038-8cc6-c7b1cd7cbf03 Make the cheese gravy To serve, simply drizzle cheese gravy over the seared beef. Buttered vegetables on the side complete the meal.
a52e789e-3d0c-4d8c-99aa-a9f6ebcf6e09
Start by cutting the pork. I suggest two- to three-inch cubes. Season liberally with salt and black pepper. Place in a covered container and allow to sit in the fridge overnight.
a52e789e-3d0c-4d8c-99aa-a9f6ebcf6e09
Preheat the oven to 300F.
a52e789e-3d0c-4d8c-99aa-a9f6ebcf6e09
Arrange the pork cubes in an oven-proof pan in a single layer. Add the crushed garlic and bay leaves. Cover the pan tightly with foil and cook the pork for an hour and a half to two hours.
a52e789e-3d0c-4d8c-99aa-a9f6ebcf6e09
Take the pork out of the oven.
a52e789e-3d0c-4d8c-99aa-a9f6ebcf6e09
Turn up the oven temperature to 450F.
a52e789e-3d0c-4d8c-99aa-a9f6ebcf6e09
Separate the meat from the fat. I suggest, however, that you do not dispense with all the fat. Discard the garlic cloves and bay leaves.
a52e789e-3d0c-4d8c-99aa-a9f6ebcf6e09
Take the meat (with a little fat) and transfer to a large tray. Using two forks or your CLEAN fingers, pull the meat apart to create shreds.
a52e789e-3d0c-4d8c-99aa-a9f6ebcf6e09
Return the pork to the oven and cook, uncovered, for 20 to 30 minutes or until the meat is nicely browned and lightly crisp. Optionally, pull apart again for finer shreds.
a52e789e-3d0c-4d8c-99aa-a9f6ebcf6e09
Serve the carnitas as a main dish (great as rice topping) or a filling for tacos, burritos or enchiladas.
195215f6-4ead-45b6-ae56-b6482bb8332a
Cut the pork belly into two-inch cubes.
195215f6-4ead-45b6-ae56-b6482bb8332a
Place the pork cubes in a wide shallow pan, add the crushed garlic, crushed peppercorns and bay leaf. Pour in 1/4 cup vinegar. Set the heat on high and bring to the boil without stirring.
195215f6-4ead-45b6-ae56-b6482bb8332a
With the heat still on high, pour in 1/4 cup soy sauce and about a quarter cup of water. Bring to the boil.
195215f6-4ead-45b6-ae56-b6482bb8332a
Lower the heat, cover and simmer the adobo with occasional stirring for an hour to an hour and a half or until the pork is very tender and the liquid considerably reduced.
195215f6-4ead-45b6-ae56-b6482bb8332a
Serve the pork and pineapple adobo over rice topped with torn cilantro and with hard-boiled eggs on the side, if you wish.
9c0ca7c3-7e4e-4350-8f15-f2163f097f9e
Add the corned beef cubes. Cook, stirring, until the meat changes color.
9c0ca7c3-7e4e-4350-8f15-f2163f097f9e
Pour in the bone broth. Add the finger chilies. Season with patis. Bring to the boil, cover and simmer for two to two and a half hours, or until the beef is tender.
9c0ca7c3-7e4e-4350-8f15-f2163f097f9e
About 20 minutes before the beef is done, add the taro wedges.
9c0ca7c3-7e4e-4350-8f15-f2163f097f9e
When the eggplants are almost done, pour in the tamarind extract and add the kangkong to the pot, pressing the kangkong down gently into the broth. Let boil for five minutes. Taste the broth and add more patis if necessary.
c63382b9-e29b-4004-bdc5-fddc87b8a8aa
Peel and thinly slice the shallots.
c63382b9-e29b-4004-bdc5-fddc87b8a8aa
Peel and mince the garlic.
c63382b9-e29b-4004-bdc5-fddc87b8a8aa
Peel and thinly slice the ginger.
c63382b9-e29b-4004-bdc5-fddc87b8a8aa
Chop the chilies.
c63382b9-e29b-4004-bdc5-fddc87b8a8aa
Heat the cooking oil in a pan.
c63382b9-e29b-4004-bdc5-fddc87b8a8aa
Saute the shallots, garlic, ginger and chilies.
c63382b9-e29b-4004-bdc5-fddc87b8a8aa
Add the pork to the pan. Stir to coat with oil.
c63382b9-e29b-4004-bdc5-fddc87b8a8aa
Pour in the soy sauce, rice wine, rice vinegar and half of the broth. Stir in the sugar and pepper. Bring to the boil. Cook, uncovered, for one to two minutes. Taste the sauce. Add salt if too bland (adding more soy sauce will make the sauce too dark).
c63382b9-e29b-4004-bdc5-fddc87b8a8aa
In the remaining broth, stir in the oyster sauce, starch and sesame seed oil. Pour into the pan. Cook, stirring, until the sauce is thick and clear. Cook for another two to three minutes to make sure that the starch leaves no powdery feel in the mouth.
c63382b9-e29b-4004-bdc5-fddc87b8a8aa
Transfer the sweet sour leftover roast pork belly to a serving bowl. Garnish with scallions and cilantro. Best served with rice.
1c8f3942-a69d-4114-995f-b26343b159a6
Cut the beef into half-inch wide strips.
1c8f3942-a69d-4114-995f-b26343b159a6
Place the beef in a bowl. Add the salt, pepper, garlic, ginger and starch. Mix well. Cover and leave in the fridge while you prepare the vegetables.
1c8f3942-a69d-4114-995f-b26343b159a6
Cut the bok choy to separate the leaves from the stalks. Reserve the leaves for another dish. Cut the stalks horizontally into half-inch slices. You should have about four cups of sliced stalks to feed four people with normal appetite.
1c8f3942-a69d-4114-995f-b26343b159a6
Peel and julienne the onion and carrot.
1c8f3942-a69d-4114-995f-b26343b159a6
Set a wok or thick-bottomed frying pan on the stove over high heat. Pour in the cooking oil and swirl.
1c8f3942-a69d-4114-995f-b26343b159a6
Spread the beef on the hot oil. Cook without disturbing for a minute or so. Stir, breaking up lumps, and stir fry for another minute.
1c8f3942-a69d-4114-995f-b26343b159a6
Add the julienned carrot and onion. Stir fry for half a minute.
1c8f3942-a69d-4114-995f-b26343b159a6
Add the bok choy stalks. Stir well.
1c8f3942-a69d-4114-995f-b26343b159a6
Pour in the soy sauce and half cup of bone broth. Sprinkle in the sugar. Cook, stirring often, until the sauce thickens and is no longer cloudy. If you want a thinner sauce, pour in the remaining quarter cup of bone broth.
1c8f3942-a69d-4114-995f-b26343b159a6
Taste. Adjust the seasonings, if needed.
1c8f3942-a69d-4114-995f-b26343b159a6
Off the heat, drizzle in the sesame seed oil and toss everything to blend.
1c8f3942-a69d-4114-995f-b26343b159a6
Sprinkle the Chinese-style beef and bok choy stir fry with toasted sesame seeds before serving.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Brown the pork cheeks Preheat the oven to 425F.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Brown the pork cheeks Cut the pork cheeks into strips about half an inch wide.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Brown the pork cheeks Line a baking tray with foil, lightly spray the foil with oil then spread the pork cheek slices on the oiled foil.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Brown the pork cheeks Cook the sliced pork cheeks in the oven for about 20 minutes or until browned and crisp.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Prep the vegetables While the pork cheek slices are in the oven, prepare the vegetables. Deseed and cut the bell pepper into thin strips.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Prep the vegetables Peel and thinly slice the onion.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Prep the vegetables Peel and grate the ginger.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Prep the vegetables Peel and mince the garlic.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Prep the vegetables Peel and julienne the carrot.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Stir fry the pork and vegetables Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Stir fry the pork and vegetables Stir fry the bell pepper, carrot and onion for half a minute.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Stir fry the pork and vegetables Add the ginger and garlic, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and continue cooking for another half a minute.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Stir fry the pork and vegetables Add the pork to the vegetables.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Stir fry the pork and vegetables Pour in the sweet chili sauce and oyster sauce.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Stir fry the pork and vegetables Cook, stirring, until the sauce is bubbly.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Stir fry the pork and vegetables Off the heat, stir in the sesame seed oil.
56ee594d-187b-4ef4-a047-2c92df96804e Stir fry the pork and vegetables Sprinkle the sweet spicy pork cheeks with sliced scallions before serving.
944616cb-8688-4d52-bb3f-234588106ebc
Cut the pork into one-inch cubes.
944616cb-8688-4d52-bb3f-234588106ebc
Heat the olive oil in a pot.
944616cb-8688-4d52-bb3f-234588106ebc
Lightly brown the pork cubes in the hot oil.
944616cb-8688-4d52-bb3f-234588106ebc
Add the garlic, onion, tomatoes, oregano, bell pepper, bay leaf and paprika. Cook, stirring, often, until the vegetables start to soften.
944616cb-8688-4d52-bb3f-234588106ebc
Pour in the tomato sauce and bone broth.
944616cb-8688-4d52-bb3f-234588106ebc
Stir in the cranberries.
944616cb-8688-4d52-bb3f-234588106ebc
Bring to the boil, cover the pot, lower the heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
944616cb-8688-4d52-bb3f-234588106ebc
Taste the sauce. Add just enough salt and pepper to balance the flavors. How much salt depends on how salty the bone broth is. A quarter teaspoon of pepper should be enough unless you like the flavor of pepper to really stand out (I don't!), in which case, you are welcome to use more than a quarter teaspoon.
944616cb-8688-4d52-bb3f-234588106ebc
Cover the pan and continue simmering the pork for another 15 to 20 minutes. At this point, the sauce should have reduced considerably.
944616cb-8688-4d52-bb3f-234588106ebc
Add the eggplant, sweet potato cubes and peas. Stir. Simmer the stew, covered, for another seven to 10 minutes.
944616cb-8688-4d52-bb3f-234588106ebc
Give the sauce one last taste and add more salt and pepper, if needed, before serving.
f0a867dc-9eac-42df-b246-1b5463691555
Brown the pork, in batches if necessary, turning the pieces around for even coloring.
f0a867dc-9eac-42df-b246-1b5463691555
Scoop out the browned pork and discard the oil.
f0a867dc-9eac-42df-b246-1b5463691555
Put the pork back into the pan.
f0a867dc-9eac-42df-b246-1b5463691555
Add the garlic, shallot, ginger, peppercorns, chili powder, paprika, bay leaf, soy sauce, rice vinegar and sugar.
f0a867dc-9eac-42df-b246-1b5463691555
Bring to the boil. Set the heat to low, cover the pan and simmer the pork for an hour to an hour and a half, or until the meat is very tender.
f0a867dc-9eac-42df-b246-1b5463691555
While the pork simmers, toast the sesame seeds. Place them in a small frying pan and set over medium-low heat. Shake the pan often for even toasting (see illustration).
f0a867dc-9eac-42df-b246-1b5463691555
When the pork is done, peel the eggs. Add to the pork. Stir to add color to the egg whites.
f0a867dc-9eac-42df-b246-1b5463691555
Ladle the pork, eggs and sauce into a serving bowl Sprinkle with sesame seeds and chopped parsley. Serve hot.
586d9636-17ce-4502-ae00-8119bc5d052e
Cut the brisket into one-inch cubes. Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper.
586d9636-17ce-4502-ae00-8119bc5d052e
Slice the andouille into rings about a quarter inch thick.
586d9636-17ce-4502-ae00-8119bc5d052e
Peel and mince the garlic.
586d9636-17ce-4502-ae00-8119bc5d052e
Peel and chop the onion.
586d9636-17ce-4502-ae00-8119bc5d052e
Heat the olive oil in a pot. Brown the beef cubes lightly. Add the andouille and cook until the sausages render fat.
586d9636-17ce-4502-ae00-8119bc5d052e
Add the rosemary, thyme, oregano, bay leaves, cayenne, paprika, tomato sauce, broth and sugar. Sprinkle with salt and pepper; how much or how little depends on how the tomato sauce and bone broth had been seasoned.
586d9636-17ce-4502-ae00-8119bc5d052e
Bring to a gentle boil. Cover the pot, lower the heat and simmer the meat for two hours or until the brisket is tender. Taste the broth. Add more salt, pepper and sugar, or all of them, IF needed.
586d9636-17ce-4502-ae00-8119bc5d052e
Add the diced bell peppers and drained beans to the meat.
586d9636-17ce-4502-ae00-8119bc5d052e
Cover the pot once more and simmer the chili for another 15 to 20 minutes.
586d9636-17ce-4502-ae00-8119bc5d052e
Taste the chili one last time and adjust the seasonings if necessary.
586d9636-17ce-4502-ae00-8119bc5d052e
Serve your beef and sausage chili with bread or rice.
96d1a92f-ca8e-4344-abb8-bb70c1bd06e2
For instructions on how to precook the beef brisket, click here. Cut the cooled beef into half-inch slices. Set aside.
96d1a92f-ca8e-4344-abb8-bb70c1bd06e2
In an oil-free pan, toast the cloves and fennel seeds until aromatic, about two minutes over medium heat. Grind to a powder.
96d1a92f-ca8e-4344-abb8-bb70c1bd06e2
Heat the olive oil and sesame seed oil in a pan. Saute the half of the chilies, all the garlic, ginger, kaffir lime leaves and the ground cloves and fennel seeds.
96d1a92f-ca8e-4344-abb8-bb70c1bd06e2
Pour in the soy sauce, mirin and about half a cup of water. Stir in the sugar, lemon zest and lemon juice. Taste and add salt and pepper, if needed.
96d1a92f-ca8e-4344-abb8-bb70c1bd06e2
Bring the sauce to a simmer. Add the slices of beef brisket in one layer. Cook for a minute per side.
96d1a92f-ca8e-4344-abb8-bb70c1bd06e2
To serve, arrange four to five beef slices on the middle of a plate. Pile kimchi rice on one side and salad on the opposite side. Sprinkle cashew nuts and some of the remaining chili slices over the beef. Serve at once.
96d1a92f-ca8e-4344-abb8-bb70c1bd06e2
Tear the lettuce by hand (or cut with a knife) into bite size pieces. Rinse well. Dry in a salad spinner.
96d1a92f-ca8e-4344-abb8-bb70c1bd06e2
Thinly slice the cucumber into rings (a mandoline is useful).
96d1a92f-ca8e-4344-abb8-bb70c1bd06e2
Peel and julienne the carrot.
96d1a92f-ca8e-4344-abb8-bb70c1bd06e2
Separate the kani into thin strips.
96d1a92f-ca8e-4344-abb8-bb70c1bd06e2
In a bowl, toss the lettuce, cucumber rings, julienned carrot and kani together lightly.
96d1a92f-ca8e-4344-abb8-bb70c1bd06e2
Stir all the ingredients for the dressing. Drizzle over the salad and toss.
e61047f7-c9d7-40b2-865b-3e288c5561b8
Boil thee inches of water in a wide pan (I used a wok). Add 1 to 2 tablespoons salt, coarsely cracked black pepper, the garlic and onion.
e61047f7-c9d7-40b2-865b-3e288c5561b8
Drop the pork belly slices side by side in the hot water. When the water reaches boiling point once more, lower the heat, cover the pan and simmer the pork belly slices for 30 to 40 minutes.
e61047f7-c9d7-40b2-865b-3e288c5561b8
While the pork simmers, start cooking the rice. Keep it warm after it's cooked.
e61047f7-c9d7-40b2-865b-3e288c5561b8
Pierce the skin of the chorizos to prevent them from bursting in the pan.
e61047f7-c9d7-40b2-865b-3e288c5561b8
Peel the saba bananas and cut diagonally into half-inch thick slices.
e61047f7-c9d7-40b2-865b-3e288c5561b8
Slice the cucumber.
e61047f7-c9d7-40b2-865b-3e288c5561b8
Take the pork belly slices out of the pan and move to a rack to cool and to allow the excess liquid to drip off.
e61047f7-c9d7-40b2-865b-3e288c5561b8
Fry the chorizos, eggs and saba bananas. Keep warm.
e61047f7-c9d7-40b2-865b-3e288c5561b8
When cool enough to handle, lay the pork belly slices on a chopping board and snip the meat about an inch apart without cutting all the way through the skin.
