e61047f7-c9d7-40b2-865b-3e288c5561b8
Pour enough cooking oil in a large frying pan to reach a depth of at least three inches. Heat until fine wisps of smoke float on the surface (350F if you have a thermometer).
e61047f7-c9d7-40b2-865b-3e288c5561b8
Carefully slide the pork belly slices into the hot oil. Cover the pan (for best results, use a cover with steam vents). If your cover is lightweight, weigh it down (I placed the bowl part of a mortar and pestle upside down on the cover) to prevent it from flying off when the oil starts to spatter.
e61047f7-c9d7-40b2-865b-3e288c5561b8
Cook the pork in the hot oil for 7 to 10 minutes. Be very careful of oil spatters when you lift off the cover of the frying pan. If the temperature of the oil is correct, the pork will be perfectly browned and crisp.
e61047f7-c9d7-40b2-865b-3e288c5561b8
Assemble the bandeja paisa. Scoop rice at the center of a plate. Top it with a fried egg. Surround them with the fried bananas, chorizo, cucumber and fried pork belly.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Tear the pork into small pieces.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Rinse the potatoes well and cut into half-inch cubes.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Peel and finely slice the onion.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Peel and mince (or you may chop) the garlic.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan or wok.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Spread the potato cubes in the hot oil and cook over high heat without disturbing for a few minutes, or until the undersides are browned. Stir and continue cooking until browned all over and cooked through.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Scoop out the fried potato cubes and move to a plate.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
In the remaining oil in the pan, cook the onion slices over medium heat until lightly browned and softened.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Scoop out the onion slices and move to the plate beside the potato cubes.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Spread the pork meat on the bottom of the pan.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Sprinkle in garlic and pepper. Throw in the bay leaf.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Pour in the vinegar and soy sauce.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Cook the pork over high heat, stirring often, until the meat has soaked up the vinegar and soy sauce. Taste and adjust the seasonings. If you need to pour in more vinegar or soy sauce, or both, cook longer to allow the meat to soak up the liquids.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Lower the heat to medium and continue cooking pork in the rendered fat until the meat is browned and lightly caramelized.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Add the potatoes and onion slices to the pork. Stir to distribute evenly.
3f1745b2-f7a2-41df-a008-275e401e3dc4
Serve the pork adobo hash with rice and egg.
ce1db585-5043-4562-8180-fa9bfd22652b
Spread the pork belly cubes in a wide pan. Add the garlic, pepper, chilies, cayenne and bay leaves.
ce1db585-5043-4562-8180-fa9bfd22652b
Pour the vinegar over the pork and spices. Bring to the boil. Cook over high heat, stirring occasionally, until the vinegar has been soaked up by the meat.
ce1db585-5043-4562-8180-fa9bfd22652b
Lower the heat to medium and lightly fry the pork in the fat that it has rendered. Cook until the meat is lightly browned.
ce1db585-5043-4562-8180-fa9bfd22652b
Pour in the soy sauce. Stir.
ce1db585-5043-4562-8180-fa9bfd22652b
Set the heat to low. Cover the pan and braise the pork for an hour to an hour and a half or until fork tender (the actual cooking time depends on the quality of the meat). If the liquid dries up before the pork is done, add water, a quarter cup at a time.
ce1db585-5043-4562-8180-fa9bfd22652b
When the pork is tender and the sauce has dried up, pour in the lechon sauce. Stir. Taste and adjust the seasonings, as needed. Simmer for a few minutes.
ce1db585-5043-4562-8180-fa9bfd22652b
You may garnish the fiery adobo with chili slices before serving. Best with rice.
d6ae126b-6ab7-470e-a902-58891bcc3f68
Cut the beef into two-inch chunks (or have the butcher do this for you).
d6ae126b-6ab7-470e-a902-58891bcc3f68
Heat the olive oil in a heavy sauce pot or casserole. Over high heat, brown the beef chunks with a little salt and pepper, in batches if necessary.
d6ae126b-6ab7-470e-a902-58891bcc3f68
Add the garlic, onions, tomatoes, bay leaf, chilies and chopped bell peppers. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until the vegetables are soft.
d6ae126b-6ab7-470e-a902-58891bcc3f68
Add the diced tomatoes. Fill the can with water and pour into the pot. Sprinkle in more salt and pepper.
d6ae126b-6ab7-470e-a902-58891bcc3f68
Lower the heat, cover and simmer for two to two-and-a-half hours or until the meat is fork tender. Stir occasionally during cooking. If the sauce becomes too dry before the meat is cooked, add more water, about half a cup at a time.
d6ae126b-6ab7-470e-a902-58891bcc3f68
While the beef simmers, prepare the potatoes and carrots. Peel and cut them into wedges.
d6ae126b-6ab7-470e-a902-58891bcc3f68
When the beef is tender, add the potatoes and carrot wedges. Continue simmering for another 20 minutes or until the vegetables are done. Taste the sauce and add more salt and pepper, if needed.
d6ae126b-6ab7-470e-a902-58891bcc3f68
Add the peas, olives and mashed liver. Simmer for 5 minutes. Adjust the seasonings on last time.
d6ae126b-6ab7-470e-a902-58891bcc3f68
Serve the spicy beef kaldereta hot with rice or crusty bread.
d2134493-0e12-4cd4-b002-9c56c15ca335
Cut the beef tenderloin into medallions about three quarters of an inch thick. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drizzle liberally with oil. Mix well. Place in a covered bowl and leave to marinate in the fridge for 30 minutes.
d2134493-0e12-4cd4-b002-9c56c15ca335
Take the meat out of the fridge. Remove the cover to allow the meat to go back to room temperature.
d2134493-0e12-4cd4-b002-9c56c15ca335
Fire up the grill (we used a stovetop grill). Ultra high heat is required. Brush or spray lightly with oil.
d2134493-0e12-4cd4-b002-9c56c15ca335
When the oiled grill starts to smoke, lay the beef tenderloin medallions in a single layer about two inches apart. Grill for two to three minutes per side depending on the doneness that you prefer.
d2134493-0e12-4cd4-b002-9c56c15ca335
Take the grilled beef tenderloin off the grill, transfer to a chopping board, cover loosely with foil and leave to rest for ten minutes.
d2134493-0e12-4cd4-b002-9c56c15ca335
Meanwhile, lower the heat of the grill to medium. Heat both sides of the tortillas.
d2134493-0e12-4cd4-b002-9c56c15ca335
Slice the beef tenderloin across the grain to about one-fourth to one-third inch thickness.
d2134493-0e12-4cd4-b002-9c56c15ca335
Assemble your tacos. Place a tortilla (or two) on a plate, arrange beef tenderloin slices on top and drizzle with chimichurri.
d2134493-0e12-4cd4-b002-9c56c15ca335
Serve the beef tenderloin and chimichurri verde tacos with shredded lettuce and chopped tomatoes on the side.
cd524eca-cfb4-4147-a91d-af831f9f4de6
Cut the beef slices into strips about an inch wide. Place in a bowl with the vegetables.
cd524eca-cfb4-4147-a91d-af831f9f4de6
Stir together all the ingredients for the marinade. Pour over the beef and vegetables. Cover the bowl and leave to marinate in the fridge for at least six hours or overnight.
cd524eca-cfb4-4147-a91d-af831f9f4de6
Heat your grill or skillet. Optionally, brush with oil.
cd524eca-cfb4-4147-a91d-af831f9f4de6
Drain the beef and vegetables. Spread on the hot grill or skillet and cook until the underside is nicely browned, about two to three minutes. Using a wide spatula, scoop and flip to brown the opposite side for about two minutes. Stir around for another minute or two to make sure that the beef is cooked through.
cd524eca-cfb4-4147-a91d-af831f9f4de6
Sprinkle the bulgogi with toasted sesame seeds before serving.
40f5d0a8-3536-4ac9-ade8-1549fc1cd363
975dcda7-de01-4e5c-8339-ed234664df56
Preheat the oven to 400F.
975dcda7-de01-4e5c-8339-ed234664df56
Rinse the pork loin and dry with a kitchen towel.
975dcda7-de01-4e5c-8339-ed234664df56
Lay the pork loin flat with one long side on your right (or left if you're left-handed). Lightly pressing the top with one hand, cut the pork horizontally in the middle without going all the way through. Just like splitting a bun.
975dcda7-de01-4e5c-8339-ed234664df56
Turn the pork loin so that the cut side is on your right (or left if you're left handed). Again pressing the top lightly with one hand, cut through the upper half horizontally (going in the opposite direction of the first cut) again without going all the way through. Do the same with the lower half.
975dcda7-de01-4e5c-8339-ed234664df56
Pull the pork loin open. You should now have a larger but thinner slab of pork. Place a sheet of cling film over it. Pound with a mallet so that the meat is of uniform thickness. Somewhere between 1/4 to 1/2 inch thick is good.
975dcda7-de01-4e5c-8339-ed234664df56
Discard the cling film. Rub the salt and pepper all over the surface of the pork (not on the underside though).
975dcda7-de01-4e5c-8339-ed234664df56
Mix together the chopped sun-dried tomatoes, bacon, minced garlic and oregano. Spread on the pork.
975dcda7-de01-4e5c-8339-ed234664df56
Starting with one long end of the meat, roll it away from you as tightly as you can until the filling is enclosed. You may optionally divide the rolled pork into two portions at this point.
975dcda7-de01-4e5c-8339-ed234664df56
Take a sheet of aluminum foil and wrap the rolled pork in it. If you divided the rolled pork into two portions, wrap them in foil separately.
975dcda7-de01-4e5c-8339-ed234664df56
Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan. Drop in the foil-wrapped rolled pork and sear on all sides. Alex learned this in culinary school. Searing without loss of moisture. It is, of course, optional. But it is more convenient than tying up the rolled pork with twine and browning it.
975dcda7-de01-4e5c-8339-ed234664df56
Unwrap the rolled pork and transfer to a rack positioned over a baking pan. If you seared the meat sufficiently, it will not unroll when unwrapped. Bake at 400F for about 45 minutes.
975dcda7-de01-4e5c-8339-ed234664df56
Take the bacon-stuffed rolled pork out of the oven. Cover loosely with foil and rest for 15 minutes.
975dcda7-de01-4e5c-8339-ed234664df56
Slice the rolled pork into half-inch rings. Serve with your favorite salad.
8100cb4b-6e47-466d-a49d-d957fa30bf64
Rinse the pork belly and pat dry with a kitchen towel or paper towels.
8100cb4b-6e47-466d-a49d-d957fa30bf64
In an oil-free pan, toast the salt, Sichuan peppercorns and cumin until aromatic. Cool.
8100cb4b-6e47-466d-a49d-d957fa30bf64
Using a mortar and pestle (or whatever grinding tool you usually use), grind the cooled spices with the Kaffir lime leaves.
8100cb4b-6e47-466d-a49d-d957fa30bf64
Spread the ground mixture on the entire surface of the pork belly. Wrap in cling film and store in the fridge overnight. Take out of the fridge about 30 minutes before cooking to bring the meat to room temperature.
8100cb4b-6e47-466d-a49d-d957fa30bf64
Heat enough oil in a frying pan to reach a depth of at least one inch.
8100cb4b-6e47-466d-a49d-d957fa30bf64
Brown the pork belly in the hot oil. Flip it over to ensure even browning. Scoop out and set aside.
8100cb4b-6e47-466d-a49d-d957fa30bf64
In a sauce pan, stir together the garlic, onion, bay leaf, cayenne and broth with just enough salt and pepper to create a good balance. Bring to the boil.
8100cb4b-6e47-466d-a49d-d957fa30bf64
Add the browned pork belly to the boiling broth. Lower the heat and cook the meat for 45 minutes. Flip the meat over and cook for another 30 to 35 minutes. Scoop out, move to a plate and cool.
8100cb4b-6e47-466d-a49d-d957fa30bf64
Cut the pork belly into half inch slices. Cut each slice into pieces about two inches wide.
8100cb4b-6e47-466d-a49d-d957fa30bf64
In a wide pan, stir together the ingredients for the sauce. Heat gently. Add the sliced pork belly to the sauce, stirring the pieces around to coat them well. Cook just until the pork slices are heated through and the sauce is thick and sticky.
8100cb4b-6e47-466d-a49d-d957fa30bf64
Arrange the pork belly slices on a serving plate and, optionally, sprinkle with sliced scallions. Serve the Sichuan and lime braised pork with hot rice.
1c8867b1-ac91-4eab-8dd5-27d5398a3b40
Wipe the pork belly steaks fry with paper towels. Rub with salt and pepper.
1c8867b1-ac91-4eab-8dd5-27d5398a3b40
In a frying pan, heat the oil. Tilt the pan around to cover the entire bottom with oil.
1c8867b1-ac91-4eab-8dd5-27d5398a3b40
Over high heat, sear the pork steaks on both sides until most of the surface is browned. Scoop out the meat, transfer to a plate and set aside.
1c8867b1-ac91-4eab-8dd5-27d5398a3b40
Into the hot pan, add the butter. Swirl around to melt.
1c8867b1-ac91-4eab-8dd5-27d5398a3b40
Saute the onion, garlic, bay leaf, rosemary until the onion slices are softened and translucent.
1c8867b1-ac91-4eab-8dd5-27d5398a3b40
Pour in the wine and deglaze. Scrape off the bottom of the pan to loosen any bits stuck on it. Boil the mixture, uncovered, until almost dry.
1c8867b1-ac91-4eab-8dd5-27d5398a3b40
Throw in the capers and pour in the bone broth, mustard, apple cider vinegar, balsamic vinegar, soy sauce and brown sugar. Stir to blend. Bring to a simmer.
1c8867b1-ac91-4eab-8dd5-27d5398a3b40
Arrange the pork steaks in the pan so that the liquid covers as much of the meat as possible. Lower the heat, cover the pan and braise the pork steaks for 40 to 50 minutes. Taste the sauce midway through the cooking and adjust the seasonings, as needed. If the bone broth was not well seasoned to begin with, you may need to add salt and pepper.
1c8867b1-ac91-4eab-8dd5-27d5398a3b40
You have the option to remove the pork as soon as they are done. Move to a plate, then boil the sauce, uncovered, until sticky and thick. Ladle the sauce over the pork steaks and serve.
1c8867b1-ac91-4eab-8dd5-27d5398a3b40
The second option is to leave the pork steaks in the pan while reducing the sauce. Uncover the pan, turn up the heat to high and continue cooking until the sauce has reduced to a sticky delicious mess that looks like jam. You will have to flip the pork steaks occasionally over during this stage to prevent one side from turning darker than the other.
1c8867b1-ac91-4eab-8dd5-27d5398a3b40
Serve your pork steaks with red wine sauce with rice or bread and your favorite side salad.
b40ca86d-023c-471b-989d-31fddb2d4c12
Sprinkle the beef cubes with salt and pepper. Place in a resealable bag. Add the flour. Seal. Toss to coat each piece of meat lightly.
b40ca86d-023c-471b-989d-31fddb2d4c12
Heat the olive oil in a frying pan. Spread the beef cubes in a single layer and brown all sides. You may have to do this in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan.
b40ca86d-023c-471b-989d-31fddb2d4c12
Transfer the browned beef to the slow cooker.
b40ca86d-023c-471b-989d-31fddb2d4c12
Pour off the oil from the pan (save to reuse another time) leaving only about two tablespoonfuls. Add the butter and heat until melted.
b40ca86d-023c-471b-989d-31fddb2d4c12
Saute the onions, garlic, tarragon, sage, cayenne and capers until the onion pieces are translucent. Pour in the wine. Stir and scrape the bottom of the pan to loosen any stuck bits. Continue cooking until the mixture is almost dry.
b40ca86d-023c-471b-989d-31fddb2d4c12
Tip the contents of the pan over the beef in the slow cooker. Add the bay leaf. Pour in enough bone broth to cover the meat. Sprinkle in more salt and pepper. How much depends on how well seasoned the broth is. Turn the slow cooker on LOW and cook the meat for eight hours. The actual cooking time depends on the quality of the meat. So, use "eight hours" as a guide.
b40ca86d-023c-471b-989d-31fddb2d4c12
On the stovetop, make a roux for the gravy base. Melt the butter in a sauce pan and add the mushrooms. Cook for a minute. Scoop out and set aside.
b40ca86d-023c-471b-989d-31fddb2d4c12
In the remaining butter, dump the flour all at once, and stir until smooth. Add the mushrooms. Cook, stirring occasionally, for six to seven minutes to make a brown roux.
b40ca86d-023c-471b-989d-31fddb2d4c12
Take about a cup of broth from the slow cooker and pour slowly over the brown roux, stirring as you pour. Cook until the mixture has thickened.
b40ca86d-023c-471b-989d-31fddb2d4c12
Scrape the gravy into the slow cooker and stir well taking care not to break apart the tender beef cubes. Taste and add more salt and pepper, as needed. Turn the slow cooker to HIGH and cook for another 30 to 45 minutes.
b40ca86d-023c-471b-989d-31fddb2d4c12
Serve your slow cooker beef and gravy with bread, rice or noodles while hot. Optionally, sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds before serving.
c0fce1de-5cf9-4f11-a382-bb3c560ecccd
Place the ground pork in a bowl. Add the black bean sauce, chili oil and garlic sauce and hoisin sauce. Mix well. Set aside to marinate.
c0fce1de-5cf9-4f11-a382-bb3c560ecccd
Break off the tough portion of the stalk of the asparagus and discard. Cut the asparagus into two-inch lengths.
c0fce1de-5cf9-4f11-a382-bb3c560ecccd
Cut off the root ends of the shimeji mushrooms. Rinse, if needed, then dry in a salad spinner.
c0fce1de-5cf9-4f11-a382-bb3c560ecccd
Pound the garlic cloves, shake off the skins and discard.
c0fce1de-5cf9-4f11-a382-bb3c560ecccd
Peel the ginger and roughly chop.
c0fce1de-5cf9-4f11-a382-bb3c560ecccd
Mince the garlic and ginger together.
c0fce1de-5cf9-4f11-a382-bb3c560ecccd
Peel the shallot and thinly slice.
c0fce1de-5cf9-4f11-a382-bb3c560ecccd
Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan. Saute the garlic-ginger mixture and shallots until aromatic, about one minute.
c0fce1de-5cf9-4f11-a382-bb3c560ecccd
Add the asparagus and mushrooms to the sauteed ingredients. Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Stir fry for one to two minutes. Scoop out and transfer to a shallow bowl.
c0fce1de-5cf9-4f11-a382-bb3c560ecccd
To the remaining oil, add the ground pork. Stir to break up any lumps. Cook for about five to six minutes until done and the sauces have caramelized.
c0fce1de-5cf9-4f11-a382-bb3c560ecccd
Add the mushroom-asparagus mixture to the pork. Stir fry for half a minute. Taste and adjust the seasonings, if needed.
c0fce1de-5cf9-4f11-a382-bb3c560ecccd
Serve the spicy pork, mushrooms and asparagus stir fry at once.

Arrange the crispy fried adobo on top of rice. Sprinkle with crisp garlic bits and sliced scallions. Serve with the dipping sauce on the side.

To serve, fill a bowl with rice. Arrange several pieces of beef on top. Drizzle with a few tablespoonfuls of sauce. Garnish with toasted garlic, fried shallots and scallions.
b1fda74e-86ee-4aa9-ab37-3e2781d8d866
e0c40198-54e8-4031-ae90-f576c8acafcc

8d2ea581-0870-44bf-9675-9059352ab9bf
Heat enough cooking oil in a wok or frying pan to reach a depth of at least two inches. Wait until wisps of smoke are visible on the surface.
8d2ea581-0870-44bf-9675-9059352ab9bf
Turn up the heat. Add the bell peppers, onion and fried tofu. Stir fry for about a minute.
23de4c50-925b-41ae-8804-69191f6992ac
088b22a3-282d-478c-baba-0dc5e5cdd351
bd7a7d03-6c53-4fdc-822e-a7a42c0d3c34
To cook the cured beef, rinse under the tap then place in a pot. Cover with cold water. Add whatever aromatics you like. Onion or leeks, garlic, carrot, celery are the basic things. Simmer for two and a half to three hours or until the beef is very, very tender.
bd7a7d03-6c53-4fdc-822e-a7a42c0d3c34
To make sure that the very tender corned beef won’t crumble when sliced, cool completely first. You can cool it in the liquid or on a plate. If you have time, chill for half an hour after it has cooled to room temperature.
75b6838e-d6f2-402d-a74e-9b1f445ea684
a81d07b4-112c-4434-97ba-7b1be2b02c98
73e46316-b5f5-4cbc-9657-70287c938e91
c33fcd3b-6c27-45d2-a104-02afdcaba6e8
53254de6-8938-4a84-92e6-80fb5a7fe301
af2f753d-530b-4640-8fc8-dbfc3aa56de9
e951b704-0669-44c3-9bb5-dbd3ebbd939c
If using a slow cooker, put the beans in the cooker, add the pork, 1 whole onion, 6 garlic cloves, peppercorns and bay leaf. Pour in enough water to cover the beans and pork. Sprinkle generously with salt. Cook on high for two hours; shift to low and cook for eight hours. Remove the pork. Cook the beans for another two hours.
e951b704-0669-44c3-9bb5-dbd3ebbd939c
Slice the remaining onion and mince the remaining cloves of garlic.
e951b704-0669-44c3-9bb5-dbd3ebbd939c
Heat the cooking oil in a wok or other shallow pan. Saute the onion, garlic, ginger, tomato and chili for about a minute.
e951b704-0669-44c3-9bb5-dbd3ebbd939c
Add the pork meat and the drained beans.
e951b704-0669-44c3-9bb5-dbd3ebbd939c
Pour in the coconut milk. Season with salt. Boil gently for about five minutes. Serve hot with slice.
e951b704-0669-44c3-9bb5-dbd3ebbd939c
Serve hot over rice.
febddf51-9324-4fce-8611-c9acf20cc835
f75d63f4-2576-4a76-994d-450cf470adf6
63a900ff-c625-4305-838d-a9712b78e3ff
2333af78-3d1d-4e71-bd52-0a8ba81fba27
Place the pork cubes in a wide shallow pan, add the crushed garlic, chopped chilies (or flakes), sugar, crushed peppercorns and bay leaf. Pour in the vinegar. Set the heat on high and bring to the boil without stirring.
4084717d-8dce-43d5-8d26-d87a0cafdccd
5cc3fc68-b7a9-4200-9fc6-b59c9ed223d4
c0ce3c22-c578-4d49-9e02-b2b189a87068
Sprinkle with sliced scallions and serve.

7ce074dd-827e-4691-ad19-dc124d1731fd
Add the garlic, shallots (or onion), ginger and chilis. Season with fish sauce and pepper. Stir. Cook until the vegetables soften.
f88c712e-177f-4ac1-9e08-47f66cb0ce9b
df821686-9024-4eeb-b467-a1aec9d60008
f68938d0-af7f-4569-84ba-1c647061d11e

Line the bottom of a serving platter with mashed potatoes and squash. Arrange the pork slices on top. Sprinkle with sliced scallions.

Heat 3 to 4 tbsps. of butter in a pan. Lightly brown both sides of the pork hock slices. Pour in enough water to completely cover all the pork. Add the celery, carrot, onion, garlic, peppercorns and some salt. Bring to the boil, lower the heat, cover and simmer for an hour and a half to two hours, or until the pork is very tender. Do not be tempted to add more water as you want the broth to be highly concentrated in flavor. When the pork is done, turn off the heat and allow the pork to cool in the broth. The ideal time to boil the pork is the night before so that the pork can cool slowly overnight.
62a0ea48-c521-4224-bf25-dbe5801071ce
While the pork is simmering, you may also make the pie crust. Gather into a ball, wrap in cling film and keep the fridge until needed.
e469e6ef-71a4-4c95-8af3-8294e88ea3d6
Fish out the star anise and cinnamon stick. Transfer the pork to a serving bowl, pour in the sauce, drizzle some sesame seed oil and garnish with finely sliced scallions.

775cf2f7-b0ce-47a1-8503-d8b761a9a25e Make the burgers
775cf2f7-b0ce-47a1-8503-d8b761a9a25e Make the mushroom gravy Melt the butter in a small sauce pan. Add the flour, all at once, stirring to get rid of lumps. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is lightly to deeply browned (whatever your preference is), about three to five minutes.
775cf2f7-b0ce-47a1-8503-d8b761a9a25e Make the mushroom gravy Pour in the broth in the thin stream, stirring as you pour. Stop pouring when you reach the desired consistency. Some people like very thick gravy, others prefer thin gravy.
775cf2f7-b0ce-47a1-8503-d8b761a9a25e Make the mushroom gravy Add the mushrooms, season with salt, pepper, steak sauce and whatever herbs and spices you would like to add.
775cf2f7-b0ce-47a1-8503-d8b761a9a25e Complete the dish
1c298caa-c9f7-46f0-86c6-a186a49a4b1f
6d67ea13-343b-4e9c-905c-dbe7ef7b4882
9de14739-3d1f-4d80-a41b-923272c21472

86cfe36b-91ab-472e-b943-8ffd17c56a6c
Preheat the oven to 350F. Set to “bake.”
86cfe36b-91ab-472e-b943-8ffd17c56a6c
Arrange the pork ribs in a single layer in a glass baking dish.
86cfe36b-91ab-472e-b943-8ffd17c56a6c
Mix together all the ingredients for the marinade. Pour over the pork. Mix to coat every part of every piece of rib.
86cfe36b-91ab-472e-b943-8ffd17c56a6c
Cover the baking dish with a piece of foil and bake for one hour.
86cfe36b-91ab-472e-b943-8ffd17c56a6c
After an hour, remove the foil and turn up the heat to 475F. Switch the setting to “broil.” Continue cooking for another 10 minutes or until the pork ribs are nicely browned around the edges.
86cfe36b-91ab-472e-b943-8ffd17c56a6c
To serve, place two pieces of ribs on a plate and drizzle with some of the thickened sauce. Serve with rice and a light salad.
3af9f73d-5980-424b-885e-70ce8fb32ffb
9bb2d80a-3caa-4022-82f3-2608c036a386
21fddf22-74a1-4c52-97e0-b7edcc75d98e

Place the pork cubes in a wide shallow pan, add the crushed garlic, crushed peppercorns and bay leaves Pour in 1/4 cup vinegar.
e1361e09-0ac6-4755-89da-05db9a78efff
Set the heat on high and bring to the boil without stirring.
e1361e09-0ac6-4755-89da-05db9a78efff
Cook, uncovered, until most of the liquid has evaporated and the pork starts to render fat.
4069584a-67fc-4fb9-bdef-a7935a12c066
0b7fd312-ac3e-4183-a152-b9136cb53e45

e4430ba3-d13b-4717-a8a8-b4a3faf7d44f
Peel the garlic and onion and chop coarsely.
e4430ba3-d13b-4717-a8a8-b4a3faf7d44f
Chop the tomatoes as well. Don’t be tempted to chop them very finely. You don’t want them expelling their liquid before they get into the oven.
e4430ba3-d13b-4717-a8a8-b4a3faf7d44f
Spread the chopped vegetables on the entire surface of the pork.
e4430ba3-d13b-4717-a8a8-b4a3faf7d44f
Sprinkle the basil on top.
e4430ba3-d13b-4717-a8a8-b4a3faf7d44f
Roll up the pork as tightly as you can so that the fatty side is on top while the edge is tucked underneath.
e4430ba3-d13b-4717-a8a8-b4a3faf7d44f
Brush a shallow baking pan with 1 tbsp. of olive oil.
e4430ba3-d13b-4717-a8a8-b4a3faf7d44f
Lay the rolled pork on the pan, fat side up.
e4430ba3-d13b-4717-a8a8-b4a3faf7d44f
Sprinkle salt lightly over the pork. Sprinkle liberally with freshly ground pepper.
e4430ba3-d13b-4717-a8a8-b4a3faf7d44f
Pour the remaining olive oil over the pork.
e4430ba3-d13b-4717-a8a8-b4a3faf7d44f
Roast in a 180oC oven for 25 minutes.
e4430ba3-d13b-4717-a8a8-b4a3faf7d44f
Remove from the oven and transfer to a chopping board. Let rest for about 10 minutes before cutting into half-inch slices.
93debcde-b660-4d3b-99b2-32fd9af6c452
To make the basting sauce, mix together bottled vinaigrette (available in the grocery) and the brown sugar. If you don’t have bottled vinaigrette, make your own by mixing together olive oil (you can even use virgin coconut oil), lemon or kalamansi juice, salt, pepper and lots of aromatics (I recommend rosemary and thyme).
c07d14a8-6a53-428f-ba41-d9eb43e1537c
Take about two teaspoonfuls of (refined) salt or two tablespoonfuls of rock salt and spread on both sides of the meat, rubbing the salt in.
c07d14a8-6a53-428f-ba41-d9eb43e1537c
Place in a covered container and let sit in the fridge for about 6 hours.
c07d14a8-6a53-428f-ba41-d9eb43e1537c
Take the meat from the fridge and rinse off the salt under the tap.
c07d14a8-6a53-428f-ba41-d9eb43e1537c
Pat the meat dry with absorbent kitchen paper.
c07d14a8-6a53-428f-ba41-d9eb43e1537c
Lay it flat, fat side down, and spread the bacon over the entire surface.
c07d14a8-6a53-428f-ba41-d9eb43e1537c
Sprinkle the onion, basil and rosemary evenly over the bacon. Season with lots of freshly ground pepper.
c07d14a8-6a53-428f-ba41-d9eb43e1537c
Roll up tightly and wrap in aluminum foil, tucking in the edges. No, you don’t need to string the meat.
c07d14a8-6a53-428f-ba41-d9eb43e1537c
Bake in a preheated 170C oven for 40 minutes.
c07d14a8-6a53-428f-ba41-d9eb43e1537c
Remove from the oven and allow to cool for about an hour without removing the wrapping. If you slice the meat while still hot, it will crumble. So, let it cool for a while.
c07d14a8-6a53-428f-ba41-d9eb43e1537c
After the meat has cooled, peel off the foil and cut the rolled porkloin into half-inch slices.
a15d668d-6e6a-4e08-8c08-6887fea965bd
bfc9cacb-21eb-4cae-b6cd-ac79fbd18fd3
71e561f0-f90c-441b-8e46-f7b28f228d6b
007227e2-8040-4170-944c-3fdc6ba8967a
1288bcf3-5bfe-4af6-a5fa-f2b217dc1101
520655ba-7722-43a9-b971-e3023b25fdf4
Add the carrot, chayote, garlic, ginger and chilies. Drizzle in about a teaspoon of fish sauce. Saute for about a minute.
520655ba-7722-43a9-b971-e3023b25fdf4
Pour in the wine. Boil uncovered until the wine is reduced to almost nothing and the vegetables are cooked through but not mushy. Depending on the age of the vegetables (younger ones are more tender and cook faster), this stage takes anywhere from five to 10 minutes (see notes after the recipe).
520655ba-7722-43a9-b971-e3023b25fdf4
When the vegetables are done, add the shrimps.
520655ba-7722-43a9-b971-e3023b25fdf4
Continue sauteeing just until the shrimps change color. DO NOT OVERCOOK.
520655ba-7722-43a9-b971-e3023b25fdf4
Turn off the heat. Taste and season with more fish sauce, if needed.
520655ba-7722-43a9-b971-e3023b25fdf4
Serve your sayote at hipon guisado at once.
eec387cc-13c1-48ef-ae49-9efe26005e94
Halve the shelled salted eggs, dump into a mixing bowl and press with a fork until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
eec387cc-13c1-48ef-ae49-9efe26005e94
Halve the tomatoes, scoop out and discard the seeds. Cut the tomatoes into cubes smaller than ¼ inch.
eec387cc-13c1-48ef-ae49-9efe26005e94
Finely chop the chili, if using.
eec387cc-13c1-48ef-ae49-9efe26005e94
Thinly slice the scallions.
eec387cc-13c1-48ef-ae49-9efe26005e94
Wrap one heaping teaspoon of the filling with the spring roll wrapper (see illustrated guide on how to wrap spring rolls). Repeat until all the filling has been used.
eec387cc-13c1-48ef-ae49-9efe26005e94
In a fryer, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least three inches.
eec387cc-13c1-48ef-ae49-9efe26005e94
Fry the spring rolls (in batches if necessary) until browned and crisp. Drain on paper towels.
eec387cc-13c1-48ef-ae49-9efe26005e94
Half fill bowls with rice, top with spring rolls and serve, optionally, with lettuce and cucumber on the side.
eec387cc-13c1-48ef-ae49-9efe26005e94
Recommended dipping sauce: Vietnamese mixed fish sauce.
44a91db9-46a9-4060-842f-e75fef72dff6
Wipe the fish fillets with paper towels and rub generously with salt and pepper. Keep in a covered container in the fridge for at least an hour to allow the seasonings to be absorbed.
44a91db9-46a9-4060-842f-e75fef72dff6
Place the cornstarch, beaten egg and panko in three separate shallow bowls.
44a91db9-46a9-4060-842f-e75fef72dff6
Heat your fryer (heating before pouring in the oil prevents food from sticking to the metal) then pour in enough oil to reach a depth of about three inches.
44a91db9-46a9-4060-842f-e75fef72dff6
Take the fish fillets out of the fridge. Dredge each one in flour, dip in egg then roll in panko to cover every inch of the surface. If you need a visual guide, see my tonkatsu recipe. It's the same procedure except you're using fillets here instead of pork.
44a91db9-46a9-4060-842f-e75fef72dff6
Over medium heat, fry the fish fillets until the crust is golden and the fish flesh just cooked through. Depending on the size of the fillets, this can take anywhere from six to eight minutes.
44a91db9-46a9-4060-842f-e75fef72dff6
Scoop out the fried fish and rest on a rack.
44a91db9-46a9-4060-842f-e75fef72dff6
Mix together all the ingredients for the sauce.
44a91db9-46a9-4060-842f-e75fef72dff6
Ladle hot rice into bowls. Arrange a fillet on top. Add shredded cabbage on the side. Drizzle sauce over the fish and serve.
18b5acfe-78cc-4b6e-b298-95fae26aebb2
6eaa084b-2092-4d33-8c83-f25649cd495f
Place the shrimps in a bowl. Add the grated ginger, a tablespoonful of soy sauce, a drizzle of rice wine, a tablespoonful of starch and a drizzle of sesame seed oil. Mix well. Set aside.
6eaa084b-2092-4d33-8c83-f25649cd495f
In a small bowl, make the sauce by mixing together the oyster sauce, sugar, shrimp broth, a tablespoonful of starch and a tablespoonful of light soy sauce.
6eaa084b-2092-4d33-8c83-f25649cd495f
Pour the remaining cooking oil into the pan. When starting to smoke, spread the marinated shrimps in a single layer. Do not move them for half a minute or so. Flip over and brown the opposite side for another half a minute.
6eaa084b-2092-4d33-8c83-f25649cd495f
Add the garlic, sliced black fungus, cucumber and eggs to the shrimps. Stir fry for half a minute.
6eaa084b-2092-4d33-8c83-f25649cd495f
Serve the moo shu shrimp over hot rice.
e5d86234-319d-4746-a495-67b280635bea
Split the coconut (or have it done by the vendor), save the juice and scrape the meat to separate it from the husk.
e5d86234-319d-4746-a495-67b280635bea
Cut the coconut meat into thin strips.
e5d86234-319d-4746-a495-67b280635bea
Cut the bangus belly fillets into one to two-inch pieces. Smaller or larger, that depends on you.
e5d86234-319d-4746-a495-67b280635bea
Peel and thinly slice the shallot and ginger.
e5d86234-319d-4746-a495-67b280635bea
Pick the sili leaves from the stalks; discard the stalks.
e5d86234-319d-4746-a495-67b280635bea
Heat the cooking oil in a sauce pan.
e5d86234-319d-4746-a495-67b280635bea
Saute the ginger and shallot until aromatic, about four minutes.
e5d86234-319d-4746-a495-67b280635bea
Pour in the coconut juice and stir in the coconut meat. Season with patis and pepper. Bring to the boil.
e5d86234-319d-4746-a495-67b280635bea
Add the bangus belly, season with more patis and bring to the boil.
e5d86234-319d-4746-a495-67b280635bea
Lower the heat and simmer for one minute (a little longer if you cut your bangus belly into larger pieces). DO NOT overcook the fish.
e5d86234-319d-4746-a495-67b280635bea
Turn off the heat. Add the sili leaves and push them down into the soup.
e5d86234-319d-4746-a495-67b280635bea
Cover the pan and leave for five minutes to allow the fish to cook completely in the residual heat and to wilt the sili leaves.
e5d86234-319d-4746-a495-67b280635bea
Taste and adjust the seasonings before serving your bangus belly binakol.
62f07603-7f8e-4e5a-9bed-8b65a716dba4
Boil plenty of water in a pot. Throw in a heaping tablespoonful of salt. Cook the pasta al dente.
62f07603-7f8e-4e5a-9bed-8b65a716dba4
While the pasta boils, spread the bacon in a hot frying pan. Cook until browned and fat has been rendered. Scoop out and set aside.
62f07603-7f8e-4e5a-9bed-8b65a716dba4
Pour off the bacon fat leaving two tablespoonfuls in the frying pan. Add the olive oil and heat.
62f07603-7f8e-4e5a-9bed-8b65a716dba4
Cook the garlic in the hot oil over medium heat just until starting to brown.
62f07603-7f8e-4e5a-9bed-8b65a716dba4
Throw the asparagus into the hot oil, sprinkle with salt and cook for about two minutes.
62f07603-7f8e-4e5a-9bed-8b65a716dba4
Stir in the shrimps, sprinkle in more salt, add pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, for about two minutes or just until the shrimps are done (see notes after the recipe).
62f07603-7f8e-4e5a-9bed-8b65a716dba4
Drain the pasta (reserve a quarter cup of the cooking liquid) and dump into the frying pan.
62f07603-7f8e-4e5a-9bed-8b65a716dba4
Pour in the pasta liquid. Cook, tossing everything together, for another minute.
62f07603-7f8e-4e5a-9bed-8b65a716dba4
Off the heat, add the bacon to the pasta and toss a few more times.
62f07603-7f8e-4e5a-9bed-8b65a716dba4
Serve the bacon, shrimps and asparagus spaghetti with Parmesan.
36d61bda-5ffc-4789-b2c8-2c5a7786b11a
Rinse the fish and wipe dry with paper towels. Sprinkle generously with salt and pepper on all sides.
36d61bda-5ffc-4789-b2c8-2c5a7786b11a
Heat the oil in a frying pan.
36d61bda-5ffc-4789-b2c8-2c5a7786b11a
Lightly fry the fish on both sides just until done. DO NOT overcook. Scoop out and move to a plate.
36d61bda-5ffc-4789-b2c8-2c5a7786b11a
Using two forks, cut the fish flesh into chunks.
36d61bda-5ffc-4789-b2c8-2c5a7786b11a
In the remaining oil, lightly fry the eggplants. Scoop out and spread on a plate just before they are done (they will continue to soften off the heat).
36d61bda-5ffc-4789-b2c8-2c5a7786b11a
In the remaining cooking oil, saute the garlic, shallots and bay leaves.
36d61bda-5ffc-4789-b2c8-2c5a7786b11a
Pour in the vinegar, sprinkle in salt and pepper, and allow to bubble until the liquid is reduced by half.
36d61bda-5ffc-4789-b2c8-2c5a7786b11a
Pour in the coconut cream. Taste. Adjust the seasonings, as needed. Heat just until the mixture is bubbly.
36d61bda-5ffc-4789-b2c8-2c5a7786b11a
Add the fish and eggplants to the sauce. Toss lightly (be careful not to break the eggplants and fish) but thoroughly to coat each piece of fish and eggplant with sauce.
36d61bda-5ffc-4789-b2c8-2c5a7786b11a
Garnish the fish and eggplant adobo with coconut cream with toasted garlic, fried shallots and sliced scallion. Serve immediately.
de7396e7-71c4-4874-92bb-b0afe251a215
Heat the cooking oil in a pot.
de7396e7-71c4-4874-92bb-b0afe251a215
Saute the garlic and shallots until lightly browned and fragrant.
de7396e7-71c4-4874-92bb-b0afe251a215
Pour in six to eight cups of water. Bring to a simmer.
de7396e7-71c4-4874-92bb-b0afe251a215
Lower the fish bone into the pot. Cook over low heat just until the flesh attached to the bone turns opaque.
de7396e7-71c4-4874-92bb-b0afe251a215
Lift the bone out of the liquid, transfer to a plate and cool.
de7396e7-71c4-4874-92bb-b0afe251a215
Carefully separate the salmon flesh from the bone.
de7396e7-71c4-4874-92bb-b0afe251a215
Return the bone to the pot, pour in two tablespoons of fish sauce, sprinkle in the pepper and simmer for 15 minutes or so.
de7396e7-71c4-4874-92bb-b0afe251a215
Remove the fish bones from the broth and discard.
de7396e7-71c4-4874-92bb-b0afe251a215
Taste the broth. Add more fish sauce, of needed.
de7396e7-71c4-4874-92bb-b0afe251a215
Plunge the spinach into the liquid. Cook just until wilted.
de7396e7-71c4-4874-92bb-b0afe251a215
Add the salmon flesh to the soup. Stir gently.
de7396e7-71c4-4874-92bb-b0afe251a215
Taste the broth. Adjust the seasonings, if needed, before serving.
fe9db4c7-ac18-493d-ae13-7da05f9c353e
Split the cucumbers lengthwise, scoop out the seeds and discard.
fe9db4c7-ac18-493d-ae13-7da05f9c353e
Grate the cucumbers coarsely.
fe9db4c7-ac18-493d-ae13-7da05f9c353e
Dump the grated cucumbers into a bowl and stir in the yogurt.
fe9db4c7-ac18-493d-ae13-7da05f9c353e
Mince the garlic. Stir into the cucumber-yogurt mixture.
fe9db4c7-ac18-493d-ae13-7da05f9c353e
Drizzle in the lime or lemon juice. Add the dill. Mix.
fe9db4c7-ac18-493d-ae13-7da05f9c353e
Taste the sauce. If you want it more tangy, add more lime or lemon juice. If you prefer a bit of saltiness, sprinkle in a little salt and stir. Adjust to your heart's delight. You're the one who's going to eat it so had better like the way it tastes.
fe9db4c7-ac18-493d-ae13-7da05f9c353e
Arrange your fried fish on a platter. Serve the sauce on the side.
1554f118-4523-42de-be64-a65f463759b6
Mix together all the ingredients for the fish balls. Divide into three portions. Form each portion into a ball.
1554f118-4523-42de-be64-a65f463759b6
Heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least three inches.
1554f118-4523-42de-be64-a65f463759b6
Fry the fishballs until browned and crisp.
1554f118-4523-42de-be64-a65f463759b6
On a plate, smother the tops of the fishballs with tomato sauce. Place a slice of Parmesan and mozzarella on top of each.
1554f118-4523-42de-be64-a65f463759b6
Using a kitchen torch, melt the cheeses until bubbly and speckled.
1554f118-4523-42de-be64-a65f463759b6
Sprinkle in chopped parsley before serving the fishballs a la Parmigiana.
ac3f7e60-9c14-4a57-b0cc-6a5571cabb77 Make the sauce In a small sauce pan, mix together all the ingredients for the sauce except the onion.
ac3f7e60-9c14-4a57-b0cc-6a5571cabb77 Make the sauce Pour in a quarter cup of water. Boil the sauce just until the sugar is melted. Taste. If you want a different balance between sweet and sour, add more sugar or lime juice. If the sauce is too strong for you, stir in more water.
ac3f7e60-9c14-4a57-b0cc-6a5571cabb77 Make the sauce Off the heat, stir in the sliced onion. Set aside.
ac3f7e60-9c14-4a57-b0cc-6a5571cabb77 Cook the fish Rinse the fish steaks and pat dry with paper towels. Sprinkle both sides with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with starch; shake off excess.
ac3f7e60-9c14-4a57-b0cc-6a5571cabb77 Cook the fish In a frying pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least two inches.
ac3f7e60-9c14-4a57-b0cc-6a5571cabb77 Cook the fish Deep fry the fish steaks until golden and crisp. Scoop out and arrange on a serving plate.
ac3f7e60-9c14-4a57-b0cc-6a5571cabb77 Assemble the dish Ladle the sauce over the fried fish.
ac3f7e60-9c14-4a57-b0cc-6a5571cabb77 Assemble the dish Garnish with lime or lemon slices, scallions, chili and cilantro.
ac3f7e60-9c14-4a57-b0cc-6a5571cabb77 Assemble the dish Serve immediately.
f31941ce-750a-4eb3-91f6-aaf5aca18714
In a bowl, toss together all the ingredients for the salad. For tips on cutting the mango, see the kani salad recipe. Cover the bowl and keep the salad in the fridge while you prepare the fish.
f31941ce-750a-4eb3-91f6-aaf5aca18714
Line your work surface with cling wrap. Arrange the fish fillets on top. Sprinkle with salt, pepper and cayenne. Cover with another sheet of cling wrap. Using a mallet, lightly pound the fillets to flatten.
f31941ce-750a-4eb3-91f6-aaf5aca18714
In a bowl, mix the starch, salt and pepper with just enough water to make thin batter.
f31941ce-750a-4eb3-91f6-aaf5aca18714
Heat enough cooking oil in a wok or frying pan to reach a depth of at least two inches.
f31941ce-750a-4eb3-91f6-aaf5aca18714
Dip a fish fillet in batter, slide into the hot oil and fry over high heat until golden and crisp, about two two three minutes. Do this one to two pieces at a time to avoid overcrowding the pan.
f31941ce-750a-4eb3-91f6-aaf5aca18714
Place a warmed tortilla on a plate, spread about two heaping tablespoons of salad on the center then top with a fried fish fillet. Drizzle Sriracha over the fish. Garnish with sliced scallions. Serve at once.
9f90f694-c04f-454f-a8e0-857f40d26c8e
94aca33d-80dd-4d2d-8038-c3f92fe22b04
Pour in about two tablespoons of fish sauce. Stir. Set the heat to low, cover the pot and cook until everything softens and starts to liquefy. It'll take about ten minutes.
94aca33d-80dd-4d2d-8038-c3f92fe22b04
Meanwhile, prepare the rest of the vegetables. Halve each okra. Dice the eggplant. Rinse the sitaw well then cut into two- to three-inch lengths. Peel the radish and slice into 1/4-inch rings.
94aca33d-80dd-4d2d-8038-c3f92fe22b04
Pour the fish stock into the pot and bring to the boil. Taste and add more fish sauce, if needed.
94aca33d-80dd-4d2d-8038-c3f92fe22b04
Add the vegetables, starting with what takes longest to cook. My preferred order is okra, sitaw, and eggplants and radish together with two- to three-minute intervals.
94aca33d-80dd-4d2d-8038-c3f92fe22b04
Finally, add the fish roe and tamarind juice. When the soup comes to a hard boil, turn off the heat, cover the pot and leave to cook the fish roe in the residual heat for five minutes.
c80fe217-1fc2-40f9-845f-6fd8b4dacf82
Discard the mussels that do not open. Rinse under running water again. Pull out the “beards”. Set aside.
c80fe217-1fc2-40f9-845f-6fd8b4dacf82
Heat a large pot. Pour in the cooking oil. Saute the shallot, ginger and garlic until softened and aromatic.
c80fe217-1fc2-40f9-845f-6fd8b4dacf82
Pour in the water. Season with fish sauce and pepper. Bring to a full boil. Do not lower the heat at this point.
c80fe217-1fc2-40f9-845f-6fd8b4dacf82
Add the cleaned mussels to the boiling water. When the water is boiling again, lower the heat. Cover and simmer for two to three minutes. Do not overcook the mussels.
c80fe217-1fc2-40f9-845f-6fd8b4dacf82
Off the heat, taste the broth and add more fish sauce and pepper, as needed.
c80fe217-1fc2-40f9-845f-6fd8b4dacf82
Garnish the gingered mussel soup with sliced scallions before serving.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Prep the shiitake Place the shiitake mushrooms in a bowl and pour in warm water. Soak for 15 minutes, flip them over and soak for 15 minutes more (soaking them for as long as three hours won't hurt).
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Prep the shiitake Snip off the stems of the shiitake and discard. Cut the caps into halves if large. You want bite-size pieces.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Prep the shiitake Strain the liquid in which the mushrooms have soaked. You will need about three cups.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Pre-cook the sea cucumbers While the shiitake mushrooms rehydrate, rinse the sea cucumbers and make sure the cavities are clean.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Pre-cook the sea cucumbers Drop the sea cucumbers into a pot, add half of the ginger and cover with water. Bring to the boil, lower the heat, cover the pot and cook the sea cucumbers with the ginger for 15 to 20 minutes to remove the strong fishy odor.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Pre-cook the sea cucumbers Drain the sea cucumbers, rinse under the tap (or plunge in an ice bath) then cut into bite-size pieces.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Braise the sea cucumbers and shiitake Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Braise the sea cucumbers and shiitake Saute the remaining ginger, all of the garlic and shallot(s) in the oil until fragrant.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Braise the sea cucumbers and shiitake Turn up the heat. Add the shiitake and sea cucumbers. Stir fry until every piece is coated with oil.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Braise the sea cucumbers and shiitake Reserve a quarter cup of the mushroom liquid and pour the rest into the wok with the sea cucumbers and mushrooms.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Braise the sea cucumbers and shiitake Stir in the soy sauce, pepper, sugar and oyster sauce. Bring to the boil. Set the heat to low, cover the wok and cook the sea cucumbers and mushrooms until tender and the liquid is reduced to less than half.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Braise the sea cucumbers and shiitake Stir the starch in the reserved mushroom liquid.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Braise the sea cucumbers and shiitake Pour the starch solution into the wok. Cook, stirring, until the sauce is thick and clear. Taste. Add salt, as needed.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Braise the sea cucumbers and shiitake Off the heat, drizzle in the sesame seed oil and toss everything to blend.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Assemble the dish Arrange the blanched broccoli florets on one side of a serving platter. Ladle your delicious Chinese-style braised sea cucumbers and shiitake mushrooms, with the sauce, on the opposite side.
f6a15643-ed46-463a-8579-9409a20ce2ce Assemble the dish Serve at once.
548bdc88-4fe7-49ac-8e83-e6dd32d820ad
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
Rinse the mussels several times. Place in a bowl. Cover with water. Soak in the fridge for several hours.
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
Clean the squids (see how) and cut into chunks.
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
Cut off the antennae of the shrimps. I do not recommend peeling the shrimps.
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
Take a shrimp and pierce with a toothpick between the first and second segments of the shell counting from the head. Twist the toothpick then pull out to remove the black thread that runs through the length of the shrimp (see the technique). Alternatively, cut the shell along its back to expose the black thread to make it easier to remove (see how). Repeat with the rest of the shrimps.
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
Take the mussels out of the fridge and rinse again. Pull off the beards.
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
Boil six cups of water in a pot with two tablespoons of salt. When the water is boiling, dump in the mussels. Once the mussels open, scoop them out and set aside. Optionally, when cool enough to handle, you may break off and discard the empty half shells.
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
Scoop a cup of the hot mussel broth into a bowl. Drop in the saffron threads. Leave to soak for five minutes.
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
Pour the rice in the rice cooker. Add the mussel broth and saffron with the soaking liquid. Cook the rice as you ordinarily would in the rice cooker.
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
Meanwhile, heat half of the olive oil in the paella pan.
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
Over medium-high heat, cook the shrimps hot olive oil with a teaspoon of salt and a quarter teaspoon of pepper. DO NOT OVERCOOK. Two minutes on each side should do it. Scoop out and set aside.
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
In the remaining oil, still over medium-high heat, cook the squids with a teaspoon of salt and a quarter teaspoon of pepper. Again, DO NOT OVERCOOK. Two to three minutes with occasional stirring should be sufficient. Scoop out and set aside.
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
Turn down the heat to medium. Pour the remaining olive oil in the paella pan. Saute the garlic, onion and bell peppers with the paprika and bay leaves.
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
Turn up the heat to high. Scoop out the cooked rice directly into the paella pan. Add the peas. Stir. Taste and add more salt and pepper, if needed.
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
Spread the rice evenly on the paella pan. Arrange the shrimps, squids and mussels on top. Continue cooking over high heat (a little scorching at the bottom gives the paella a more authentic touch) for three to five minutes or just until the shrimps, squids and mussels are heated through.
8eeefbc4-3261-4a2f-904f-cf0e49420398
Sprinkle the seafood paella with thinly sliced basil leaves and serve immediately.
cbca317e-9b67-429d-92f1-c13d157da1e0
Rinse the fish. Pat dry with paper towels. Score both sides and rub with salt and pepper. Sprinkle flour on both sides.
cbca317e-9b67-429d-92f1-c13d157da1e0
Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan until smoke floats on the surface. Plunge the floured fish into the hot oil. Cook over high heat for five minutes. Flip the fish over and cook for another four minutes. Scoop out and arrange on a serving plate.
cbca317e-9b67-429d-92f1-c13d157da1e0
Pour off the oil from the wok or frying pan, leaving only about a tablespoonful.
cbca317e-9b67-429d-92f1-c13d157da1e0
Reheat the oil. Saute the white and light green portions of the scallions, bell pepper and mushrooms with salt and pepper for about half a minute.
cbca317e-9b67-429d-92f1-c13d157da1e0
In a bowl, stir together the black bean garlic sauce, chili garlic sauce, grated ginger, sugar, tapioca starch and sesame seed oil with 1 and 1/4 cups water. Pour the mixture into the pan. Cook, stirring, until no longer cloudy. Simmer for two to three minutes.
cbca317e-9b67-429d-92f1-c13d157da1e0
Pour the sauce and vegetables over the fish. Garnish with the dark green portion of the scallions.
cbca317e-9b67-429d-92f1-c13d157da1e0
Serve the Chinese-style fried fish with black beans and chili sauce at once. Best with rice on the side.
73b1af5c-597c-441e-9add-7ac019d50ff4
Rinse the mussels and drain well.
73b1af5c-597c-441e-9add-7ac019d50ff4
Heat the olive oil in a wide pan.
73b1af5c-597c-441e-9add-7ac019d50ff4
Over medium heat, cook the chorizo in the hot oil until it has rendered fat and the oil in the pan has colored.
73b1af5c-597c-441e-9add-7ac019d50ff4
Add the chopped onion to the chorizo and cook, stirring often, until softened.
73b1af5c-597c-441e-9add-7ac019d50ff4
Throw in the tomatoes, garlic and parsley. Stir. Set the heat to medium-low, cover the pan and cook the vegetables until they are just started to liquefy.
73b1af5c-597c-441e-9add-7ac019d50ff4
Turn up the heat to medium-high. Pour in the ginger ale. Allow to reduce by a quarter. Taste and add as much as salt as is needed to get a pleasant balance between salty and sweet.
73b1af5c-597c-441e-9add-7ac019d50ff4
Pour the mussels into the pan. Stir. Cover the pan and let the mussels cook for about five minutes or just until the shells open.
73b1af5c-597c-441e-9add-7ac019d50ff4
Serve the mussels and chorizo in ginger ale hot.
bb1e5f9a-5932-4737-b273-fd824807b413
Rinse the fish and wipe dry with a kitchen towel. Score both sides of the fish. Rub generously with salt and pepper. Sprinkle flour over the entire fish.
bb1e5f9a-5932-4737-b273-fd824807b413
Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan. When the oil is just starting to smoke (or 350F to 375F if you're using a thermometer), slide the fish in. Over high heat, cook until browned and crisp, about four minutes per side. Scoop out and lay on a serving plate.
bb1e5f9a-5932-4737-b273-fd824807b413
Pour off the oil from the wok or frying pan.
bb1e5f9a-5932-4737-b273-fd824807b413
Pour the sweet chili sauce, fish sauce and pineapple juice into the pan. Bring to a simmer. Add the pineapple chunks and bird's eye chili slices. Simmer for 30 seconds.
bb1e5f9a-5932-4737-b273-fd824807b413
Pour the sauce, pineapple and chili over the fish. Garnish with scallions before serving.
3acd592a-43a5-48e0-bd65-cea0c82172f9 Make the sauce Roughly chop the corn kernels.
3acd592a-43a5-48e0-bd65-cea0c82172f9 Make the sauce Stir the starch into the liquid from the can (plus vegetable broth) until dissolved.
3acd592a-43a5-48e0-bd65-cea0c82172f9 Make the sauce In a sauce pan, heat the cooking oil. Saute the garlic and onion until aromatic and softened. Add the corn and continue cooking until heated through.
3acd592a-43a5-48e0-bd65-cea0c82172f9 Make the sauce Stir the starch solution again (the starch has a nasty way of settling at the bottom) and pour into the pan. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring, until thickened and clear. Simmer uncovered for five minutes.
3acd592a-43a5-48e0-bd65-cea0c82172f9 Make the sauce Off the heat, season the sauce with salt and pepper. Keep hot.
3acd592a-43a5-48e0-bd65-cea0c82172f9 Cook the fish Over high heat, start heating the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan.
3acd592a-43a5-48e0-bd65-cea0c82172f9 Cook the fish Wipe the fish fillets dry with paper towels. Cut into serving size pieces. Sprinkle liberally with salt and pepper on both sides.
3acd592a-43a5-48e0-bd65-cea0c82172f9 Cook the fish Whisk the flour and starch together. Pour in enough ice-cold water to make a fairly thin batter (the ideal consistency is thinner than pancake batter).
3acd592a-43a5-48e0-bd65-cea0c82172f9 Cook the fish Dip each piece of fish fillet in the flour-starch mixture to cover completely.
3acd592a-43a5-48e0-bd65-cea0c82172f9 Cook the fish When the oil is hot (you should see fine wisps of smoke float on the surface), drop in the battered fish fillets. Cook in batches if necessary so as not to overcrowd the pan and make the temperature drop. Depending on the thickness of the fillets, cook for three to five minutes or until the batter has turn crisp and lightly browned and the fish is cooked all the way through. For even cooking, flip the fish fillet midway through the frying.
3acd592a-43a5-48e0-bd65-cea0c82172f9 Cook the fish Arrange the fish fillets on a plate. Pour corn sauce over them. Optionally, you may garnish your Chinese-style fish fillet with sticky corn sauce with sliced scallions before serving.
c8edb660-02e6-4adf-ae5b-2460e72f2680
Rinse the fish then wipe dry with paper towels.
c8edb660-02e6-4adf-ae5b-2460e72f2680
Cut the fish fillet into cubes. Make them thick cubes. Two inches thick is a good size.
c8edb660-02e6-4adf-ae5b-2460e72f2680
Toss the fish cubes with salt and pepper. I'll leave it to you how much salt and pepper. I like to use generous amounts of both.
c8edb660-02e6-4adf-ae5b-2460e72f2680
Place the sesame seeds in a bowl. Roll each fish cube in sesame seeds, pressing the seeds on all sides.
c8edb660-02e6-4adf-ae5b-2460e72f2680
In a frying pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least three inches. The ideal frying temperature is 350F.
c8edb660-02e6-4adf-ae5b-2460e72f2680
Drop the sesame seed-crusted fish cubes in the hot oil. Fry for two to three minutes. Please don't overcook them. Scoop out, drain on a stack of paper towels and serve.
0eef1745-9cbe-42d7-a3c1-aff80bb65b9a
9ea18d30-4876-43b3-8db6-57651e1fdd6e
c878c8d8-66bf-471d-b233-36f180cfdec3
c18a01c2-35ab-45f9-ac8a-1f9a6f8c0822
7d3e09fc-f129-4727-8c92-31fa129e58fa
ba203ade-ed53-4687-b802-97ab9ffc6682
24cf1225-feee-477e-957b-0e7ed7b0061d

d2a3cfb2-6ce9-436f-b80a-92a8f95a1939
36b1e32f-bd4d-4d61-bb2e-0be98f5ebf13
2014cab0-a50d-4fd1-90ab-125565c8c232
51849945-8879-4a72-9ac5-b028160f6fbf
Pour enough cooking oil in a frying pan to reach a depth of at least three inches. Heat the oil until wisps of smoke float on the surface.
c03c0ac5-d14b-4dac-af06-4a1300cf57d5
df91feff-5641-45d1-8305-c0a4022038ee
9a405597-53a0-41c2-b1f5-3f934c58e488
c675a938-9462-444e-9e12-d7196b41c04a
51a855ce-0897-4dbc-a42f-407dbb3bb224
Rub all the fish generously with salt and pepper. Make sure to rub inside the cavities and slashes where you had scored them.
a9cc77db-50f4-4c06-a053-897469004db4
b6d37d27-a16c-4955-81e1-e92deb5403ca
Clean the fish by gutting and removing the gills. Pompano has very small fine scales and you can remove them easily by scraping the fish’s skin with a small knife. Some cooks don’t find it necessary to do this; you decide if you wish to.
b6d37d27-a16c-4955-81e1-e92deb5403ca
Cut off the fins and tail.
b6d37d27-a16c-4955-81e1-e92deb5403ca
Make a diagonal incision along the entire length of the fish, from half an inch below the head to half an inch above the tail about one-fourth inch deep.
b6d37d27-a16c-4955-81e1-e92deb5403ca
Place the fish in a heat proof plate.
b6d37d27-a16c-4955-81e1-e92deb5403ca
When the fish is done, remove the plate from the steamer and pour the reserved sauce over the fish.
b6d37d27-a16c-4955-81e1-e92deb5403ca
Sprinkle with toasted garlic and chopped cilantro (coriander leaves, locally known as wansuy).
dae5d51e-700c-42eb-a8a3-edb5f1f21506
4ce850dc-4b6a-4303-b62f-ff2377ce9cb1
03d0b1e4-89d8-45a4-9f77-671123c95e93
Transfer to a platter. Garnish your stir fried mussels and shiitake mushrooms with oyster sauce with sliced greens. Serve immediately.
847d8911-c281-46d2-8228-fcf97c566641
23830af5-dece-4e6b-8157-9102eb563752
3f8c4847-c167-48d4-9977-615537942594
88184a44-3951-49d1-be64-dbdfc0adfe50
8c7dc5cc-4ad9-4a0d-b9e1-6b16236cf75a
Add the ginger, chilies, garlic, onions and tomatoes.
a413cd97-5486-486e-ac89-5d802e5d152e
5754bcb5-caa8-4c5d-9175-6df5f0295bc2
3d3937c8-f1bd-43f8-bee2-fbe0d608fb1e
