d6cd2cbc-10f0-43f4-aead-8253f4e20e66
5e5853c6-9ffb-4ffc-a2e5-3462f2014dd9
1d47a562-4bf5-4161-ae73-6987b86273b3
b75eef8e-fe49-4085-8edb-cccc996051bd
60a5ac78-b3b7-4f02-8843-0df6610242b7
0a507473-ec48-4c61-aa49-2957670b1c3b
27300987-dae8-4237-aa15-7d5d292591d9
7759ac0a-0632-43ac-b405-3e39e0695365
d0c9d0c5-a4dc-4b38-9423-6b538d8df693
f5ec1b84-853e-46f5-9a31-d4c40e076f45
Fry the fish. Heat the cooking oil until wisps of smoke float on the surface. Sprinkle the tilapia with starch and slide into the hot oil. Flip halfway through for even cooking and browning.
0b862d3f-e28f-46ff-a539-6d60970cad41
d4bf3ad6-1a8f-4ef3-bb79-f0d33a20551d
aa8d3ebe-4621-4947-b385-fc686f46f6b0
98d4e2df-8c48-4330-9eb6-e9c94e7a1c51
ab91b44a-e661-4d06-ba3e-8311f8eb87d3
a7354e36-d856-4f30-a1c5-769cc715dd0f
56153293-0ec3-4705-961a-13b005b685fc
e96dd384-cb25-4430-86a4-500e0bc440cb
f6ec1939-15e1-460b-a92a-6bb476413d29
26783826-ab9c-430b-9bec-cb6a11d37940
87172fc1-6cc8-44d6-b6bf-2281ff5ec4a0
99045244-080d-4de9-aaf9-5207cabf5bf7
d865bc6b-ff1e-4dd8-b759-431bd3cf5b69
4a5ee737-c54a-489c-885a-24c51d5c4837
248715c2-37bf-4db5-8f77-fea11ff71a4a
Pour the sauce and potatoes (with the butter in which they were fried) over the fish. Serve at once.
d9c037a9-baa7-485d-9ced-e20827404d6b
6be7ef72-c42e-46b2-bbc9-c476955e1863
fe003f27-c294-4ce6-bd50-1f9b5f353534
83187c21-3061-41d6-b2f1-b9b9b6f459e3
6069b7ff-95ca-4f23-b09c-65999d2c1294
10d46465-d3a6-4a63-bf4f-c6708ff53a88
a3d54ebf-f82a-493e-8bb0-f42de6cfdcb5
da04746e-5acc-42be-828a-930dd7e84310
8429a411-f045-4e9f-acda-afe582af21b7
24ca8768-2088-40b7-b727-6fabf1ae88c1
Heat the cooking oil in a pot.
24ca8768-2088-40b7-b727-6fabf1ae88c1
Saute the garlic, shallots and tomatoes for a couple of minutes or until the tomatoes start to soften and render color.
24ca8768-2088-40b7-b727-6fabf1ae88c1
Pour in the fish broth. Season with patis. Bring to the boil.
24ca8768-2088-40b7-b727-6fabf1ae88c1
Add the bangus belly fillets, allow to broth to boil again, lower the heat and simmer for about three minutes (see notes after the recipe).
43cbd010-19ef-4ca9-9d71-586e50a5339f
Dice the tomatoes and onion and place in a large bowl.
43cbd010-19ef-4ca9-9d71-586e50a5339f
Tear the salmon into large chunks; add to the bowl.
43cbd010-19ef-4ca9-9d71-586e50a5339f
Tear (or cut) the cilantro and add to the salmon and vegetables.
43cbd010-19ef-4ca9-9d71-586e50a5339f
Season with salt and pepper.
43cbd010-19ef-4ca9-9d71-586e50a5339f
Add the chili flakes, pour in the lemon juice and mango sauce and toss lightly.
43cbd010-19ef-4ca9-9d71-586e50a5339f
I recommend chilling before serving to allow the flavors to blend. It’s really wonderful — no superlatives can suffice.
feaad345-7f2d-407e-aa5f-45c01790223c Clean the fish
feaad345-7f2d-407e-aa5f-45c01790223c Fry the fish Heat enough cooking oil in a fryer or a wok so that the fish pieces are totally submerged in oil. You can do this in batches so don't worry if your largest fryer won't allow you to cook all the pieces at the same time (see notes below).
feaad345-7f2d-407e-aa5f-45c01790223c Fry the fish Cook the fish until the outside is crisp. Scoop out and allow to drain well on a rack.
feaad345-7f2d-407e-aa5f-45c01790223c Braise the fish
feaad345-7f2d-407e-aa5f-45c01790223c Garnish and serve
d10c0f82-c443-4153-805e-49fd223ded20
07c820bf-2e08-44cf-b0d1-6ee4b2f6f88f
Rub the fish all over with rock salt to remove the sliminess. Rinse and repeat a few times.
07c820bf-2e08-44cf-b0d1-6ee4b2f6f88f
Dry the fish with a kitchen towel. Removing excess liquid will help in making the fish crisp.
07c820bf-2e08-44cf-b0d1-6ee4b2f6f88f
Season the fish by rubbing salt and pepper liberally directly on the flesh (see notes below).
07c820bf-2e08-44cf-b0d1-6ee4b2f6f88f Make the dipping sauce
d84fef67-38ba-4aa0-b858-26c5c561513a
e787335c-013d-4314-b997-97240a6f5aec
The first step is the most important as this will ensure that the bread crumbs will stick to the fish. PAT THE FISH DRY WITH ABSORBENT KITCHEN TOWELS.
e787335c-013d-4314-b997-97240a6f5aec
Cut the tilapia fillets into strips, about half an inch wide and three inches long. Season with salt and pepper, cover and set aside while preparing the sauce.
e787335c-013d-4314-b997-97240a6f5aec
Start heating the cooking oil.
e787335c-013d-4314-b997-97240a6f5aec
Pour the beaten egg over the seasoned fish strips. Mix to coat each piece well.
e787335c-013d-4314-b997-97240a6f5aec
Dredge each strip of fish in bread crumbs, shake off the excess and deep fry in hot oil. Do this in batches. I fried 10 fish strips at a time to make sure that I didn’t overcrowd the pan. Overcrowding will make the temperature of the oil drop and that will make your fish soggy. It will only take about a minute for the fish to cook.
e787335c-013d-4314-b997-97240a6f5aec
The moment they turn golden brown, scoop them out of the oil and drain on paper towels or place on a wire strainer and allow any excess oil to drip off.
e787335c-013d-4314-b997-97240a6f5aec
When the fish is done, arrange on a serving platter. Pour the sauce over the fish.
94813571-b12c-4a58-b4c6-71552a69cd80
Rinse the shrimps. Cut off the heads and devein if they haven’t been cleaned yet.
94813571-b12c-4a58-b4c6-71552a69cd80
Shred the cabbage.
94813571-b12c-4a58-b4c6-71552a69cd80
Crush, peel and finely chop the garlic.
94813571-b12c-4a58-b4c6-71552a69cd80
Peel and dice the onion.
94813571-b12c-4a58-b4c6-71552a69cd80
Core the bell pepper, remove the seeds and veins and cut into thin strips.
94813571-b12c-4a58-b4c6-71552a69cd80
Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan or wok.
94813571-b12c-4a58-b4c6-71552a69cd80
Throw in the shrimps.
94813571-b12c-4a58-b4c6-71552a69cd80
Add the diced onion, grated ginger and chopped garlic. Cook, stirring, just until fragrant (about 15 seconds).
94813571-b12c-4a58-b4c6-71552a69cd80
Add the shredded cabbage and bell peppers.
94813571-b12c-4a58-b4c6-71552a69cd80
Season with a little salt and lots of freshly ground pepper.
94813571-b12c-4a58-b4c6-71552a69cd80
Cook for about a minute to a minute and a half, just long enough to cook the shrimps and NOT overcook the vegetables.
94813571-b12c-4a58-b4c6-71552a69cd80
Off the heat, drizzle with a little sesame seed oil and you’re done.
3676dfdd-1553-4223-b5d7-4288cc798ac3
401ae56f-3743-4659-9489-787f59fa1188
e3b36d67-1cad-4d3c-a29b-72b8bafe30e5
9afb78d3-4e29-432c-a656-2298e50e09cf
ba9836c8-ac06-414e-bc10-e54f7267a2dd
Boil 2 cups of water with 1 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon vinegar.
ba9836c8-ac06-414e-bc10-e54f7267a2dd
Strain the mushroom water with a double layer of clean cheesecloth (katsa) and set aside.
ba9836c8-ac06-414e-bc10-e54f7267a2dd
Mix soy sauce with the mushroom water and pour over the eel and vegetables.
c650d00c-9f08-4f60-914c-0d6fa5e232da
Clean the squids. Holding the tentacles, pull out the head. Cut off the intestines and the eyes. Remove the backbone. Pull off the skin (see illustrated instructions). Wash the cavity under running water. Sprinkle inside and with salt and pepper.
c650d00c-9f08-4f60-914c-0d6fa5e232da
Finely chop trimmed squid heads, bell pepper, onion and tomatoes. Mix with garlic. Season with salt and pepper.
c650d00c-9f08-4f60-914c-0d6fa5e232da
Stuff each squid with the chopped vegetables mixture. Push the mixture inside the cavity with your finger. Secure the opening with a toothpick.
c650d00c-9f08-4f60-914c-0d6fa5e232da
Grill squids about 6 inches above live coals (f you place them lower, the outside might be burned before the inside in fully cooked), about 4 to 5 minutes on each side. The best way to do it is to roll the squids while cooking to make sure that they are evenly cooked.
c650d00c-9f08-4f60-914c-0d6fa5e232da
Remove toothpicks before serving the grilled stuffed squids.
f3e6a66d-2aba-433b-a5b1-649da34f0a05
Add the carrot, chayote, garlic, ginger and chilies. Drizzle in about a teaspoon of fish sauce. Saute for about a minute.
f3e6a66d-2aba-433b-a5b1-649da34f0a05
Pour in the wine. Boil uncovered until the wine is reduced to almost nothing and the vegetables are cooked through but not mushy. Depending on the age of the vegetables (younger ones are more tender and cook faster), this stage takes anywhere from five to 10 minutes (see notes after the recipe).
f3e6a66d-2aba-433b-a5b1-649da34f0a05
When the vegetables are done, add the shrimps.
f3e6a66d-2aba-433b-a5b1-649da34f0a05
Continue sauteeing just until the shrimps change color. DO NOT OVERCOOK.
f3e6a66d-2aba-433b-a5b1-649da34f0a05
Turn off the heat. Taste and season with more fish sauce, if needed.
f3e6a66d-2aba-433b-a5b1-649da34f0a05
Serve your sayote at hipon guisado at once.
8a2f1c9a-c6d4-4e21-83b2-ae09f83b75ee
Heat two tablespoons coconut oil in a wide frying pan.
8a2f1c9a-c6d4-4e21-83b2-ae09f83b75ee
Spread the sweet potato cubes and leave to brown a bit. Cook, stirring, to evenly brown on all sides. You're not cooking them through at this point but just browning them. As soon as they are browned, scoop out and set aside.
8a2f1c9a-c6d4-4e21-83b2-ae09f83b75ee
Pour in the remaining coconut oil into the pan and heat.
8a2f1c9a-c6d4-4e21-83b2-ae09f83b75ee
Spread the pork strips, leave to brown a little, stir and cook, stirring often, until the edges are lightly browned.
8a2f1c9a-c6d4-4e21-83b2-ae09f83b75ee
Add the onion, garlic, ginger and tomato to the pork. Drizzle in a tablespoon of fish sauce and sprinkle in quarter teaspoon of pepper. Cook, stirring, until the vegetables soften.
8a2f1c9a-c6d4-4e21-83b2-ae09f83b75ee
Stir in the kimchi juice and half of the coconut milk. Taste and add more fish sauce, as needed.
8a2f1c9a-c6d4-4e21-83b2-ae09f83b75ee
Cover then pan and simmer the pork and kimchi in coconut milk until the pork is tender.
8a2f1c9a-c6d4-4e21-83b2-ae09f83b75ee
Add the kimchi, green beans and the remaining coconut milk. Stir in the fried sweet potatoes. Cook, uncovered, until the green beans are done and the sweet potato cubes are cooked through (see notes after the recipe).
8a2f1c9a-c6d4-4e21-83b2-ae09f83b75ee
Taste and add more fish sauce (and sugar, optionally) to balance the flavors.
1ee503f6-a6c8-42eb-baaa-8773c923f19d
Place the chicken pieces in a large thick-bottomed pot. Pour in enough water to cover. Set over high heat and bring to the boil and leave to boil briskly for five minutes
1ee503f6-a6c8-42eb-baaa-8773c923f19d
Strain the chicken and discard the water. Rinse the chicken pieces and make sure to get rid of any impurities.
1ee503f6-a6c8-42eb-baaa-8773c923f19d
Place the rinsed chicken in a clean pot and pour in the chicken bone broth. Set over high heat.
1ee503f6-a6c8-42eb-baaa-8773c923f19d
With a sharp pointed knife, pierce the garlic in several places, and add to the chicken.
1ee503f6-a6c8-42eb-baaa-8773c923f19d
Add the onion, peppercorns about two tablespoons of patis to the chicken.
1ee503f6-a6c8-42eb-baaa-8773c923f19d
When the liquid comes to a boil, lower the heat, cover the pot and simmer for 40 minutes. Taste occasionally and add more patis, as needed.
1ee503f6-a6c8-42eb-baaa-8773c923f19d
Add the white cabbage and potatoes to the chicken. Simmer for another 10 minutes.
1ee503f6-a6c8-42eb-baaa-8773c923f19d
Taste the broth and add more patis, if needed (see notes after the recipe).
1ee503f6-a6c8-42eb-baaa-8773c923f19d
Drop in the sweet potato wedges. Simmer for 10 minutes.
1ee503f6-a6c8-42eb-baaa-8773c923f19d
Taste the broth again and add more patis, as needed. Add the Chinese cabbage leaves, pressing them into the broth. Simmer for another 10 minutes.
1ee503f6-a6c8-42eb-baaa-8773c923f19d
Taste the broth one last time, adding more patis, as needed, before serving.
37587018-5c94-4c30-b86f-3b690adb0eaf
Reserve 1/4 cup of broth and heat the rest in a pot until boiling.
37587018-5c94-4c30-b86f-3b690adb0eaf
Add the cauliflower florets to the broth, lower the heat, cover the pot and simmer for five minutes.
37587018-5c94-4c30-b86f-3b690adb0eaf
Dissolve the tapioca starch in the reserved broth and pour into the pot. Cook, stirring, until the broth has thickened and is no longer cloudy.
37587018-5c94-4c30-b86f-3b690adb0eaf
Stir in the spinach leaves and chicken meat.
37587018-5c94-4c30-b86f-3b690adb0eaf
Taste the broth; add salt and pepper, as needed.
37587018-5c94-4c30-b86f-3b690adb0eaf
Bring the soup to a gentle boil and cotinue cooking, uncovered and with occasional stirring, for a few minutes.
37587018-5c94-4c30-b86f-3b690adb0eaf
Whisk the eggs in bowl.
37587018-5c94-4c30-b86f-3b690adb0eaf
Turn off the heat. Pour the eggs in a thin stream over the entire surface of the soup. Leave to set for a few seconds before stirring.
37587018-5c94-4c30-b86f-3b690adb0eaf
Taste the soup one last time and adjust the seasonings, if needed, before serving.
54fde2f6-73ec-4e97-938e-bac0b004ce57
Preheat the oven (top heat only) to 400F.
54fde2f6-73ec-4e97-938e-bac0b004ce57
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, half of the Parmesan and all of the Cheddar with a generous pinch of salt and a regular pinch of pepper. Set aside.
54fde2f6-73ec-4e97-938e-bac0b004ce57
In a frying pan that can go into the oven (no plastic parts!), heat the olive oil.
54fde2f6-73ec-4e97-938e-bac0b004ce57
Saute the onion until softened.
54fde2f6-73ec-4e97-938e-bac0b004ce57
Add the salami and garlic, and continue sauteeing until the reddish oil of the salami has mixed into the onion and garlic bits.
54fde2f6-73ec-4e97-938e-bac0b004ce57
Throw in the kale, sprinkle in a bit of salt and pepper (how much depends on how salty and spicy your salami is) and cook, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is quite dry.
54fde2f6-73ec-4e97-938e-bac0b004ce57
Pour in the egg and cheese mixture and stir well.
54fde2f6-73ec-4e97-938e-bac0b004ce57
Allow the eggs to partially cook (edges firm but center still jiggly).
54fde2f6-73ec-4e97-938e-bac0b004ce57
Sprinkle the remaining Parmesan on top of the torta and transfer to the preheated oven.
54fde2f6-73ec-4e97-938e-bac0b004ce57
Let the torta finish cooking in the oven until the top is lightly browned and crisp, about 15 minutes.
54fde2f6-73ec-4e97-938e-bac0b004ce57
Take the torta out of the oven, slice into wedges and serve while hot.
8daabb7d-50bb-46c3-a1d4-36d05d85a494
15c643c7-3223-4a00-84ac-f45e858081b3
In a cooking pan, heat enough oil to reach a depth of at least two inches.
15c643c7-3223-4a00-84ac-f45e858081b3
Dump the sitaw in the hot oil and cook, stirring occasionally, for about three minutes. Scoop out and move to a strainer.
15c643c7-3223-4a00-84ac-f45e858081b3
Add the eggplants to the hot oil and cook for two minutes. Scoop out before they are completely done because the eggplants will continue cooking off the heat. Again, move to a strainer.
15c643c7-3223-4a00-84ac-f45e858081b3
Next, fry the okra for about two minutes.
15c643c7-3223-4a00-84ac-f45e858081b3
Lastly, fry the squash cubes in the oil just long enough for the edges to brown. Scoop out and move to a strainer.
15c643c7-3223-4a00-84ac-f45e858081b3
Heat a frying pan. Drizzle in about two tablespoons of the hot oil from the other pan.
15c643c7-3223-4a00-84ac-f45e858081b3
Over medium heat, saute the garlic, chili, shallots, tomatoes and bagoong until the mixture is almost dry.
15c643c7-3223-4a00-84ac-f45e858081b3
Add the fried vegetables to the pan. Toss gently but thoroughly. Taste. If too bland, drizzle in patis, a little at a time.
15c643c7-3223-4a00-84ac-f45e858081b3
When the vegetables are heated through and done, add the cubed lechon kawali. Toss a few times to distribute evenly and to coat the meat with the shrimp paste spice base.
15c643c7-3223-4a00-84ac-f45e858081b3
Serve your pinakbet with lechon kawali with hot rice.
d93bf040-33df-41db-a7c8-3aed2e437035
Rinse the okra well then dry with paper towels. Optionally, cut off the top tips. We left them on because we served the okra as finger food and the top tips were useful for picking up the okra with the fingers.
d93bf040-33df-41db-a7c8-3aed2e437035
Slit each okra on the side to form a pocket.
d93bf040-33df-41db-a7c8-3aed2e437035
Place the okra in a bowl. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Mix, rubbing the salt and pepper into the okra.
d93bf040-33df-41db-a7c8-3aed2e437035
Push a strip of cheese into each okra.
d93bf040-33df-41db-a7c8-3aed2e437035
Cut the bacon rashers into halves.
d93bf040-33df-41db-a7c8-3aed2e437035
Wrap each cheese-stuffed okra with a piece of bacon.
d93bf040-33df-41db-a7c8-3aed2e437035
Set a non-stick frying pan on the stove and turn the heat to medium-low.
d93bf040-33df-41db-a7c8-3aed2e437035
Arrange the cheese-stuffed bacon-wrapped okra in the frying pan in a single layer. Cook slowly, turning the okra several times to brown the bacon evenly.
d93bf040-33df-41db-a7c8-3aed2e437035
Serve the cheese-stuffed bacon-wrapped okra immediately.
2847d695-430d-4d8e-934f-3f58303e09d2 Cook the laing Heat the cooking oil in a pan the spread the ground pork in the hot oil. Cook over high heat just until no longer pink.
2847d695-430d-4d8e-934f-3f58303e09d2 Cook the laing Lower the heat to medium. Add the dried shrimps, shallots, garlic, ginger and chilies. Saute until the mixture is almost dry.
2847d695-430d-4d8e-934f-3f58303e09d2 Cook the laing Add the taro leaves. Pour in two cups of coconut milk. Drizzle in a teaspoon of fish sauce. Bring to a gentle boil, pushing down the taro leaves to submerge in the liquid.
2847d695-430d-4d8e-934f-3f58303e09d2 Cook the laing Cook the laing uncovered over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the coconut milk has been absorbed. Taste. If the taro leaves are still not tender enough, add the rest of the coconut milk. Add more fish sauce, if needed. Continue cooking until the taro leaves are tender and the mixture is quite dry.
2847d695-430d-4d8e-934f-3f58303e09d2 Cook the laing Cool the laing.
2847d695-430d-4d8e-934f-3f58303e09d2 Make the spring rolls Place the cooled laing in a bowl and stir in the cheese cubes.
2847d695-430d-4d8e-934f-3f58303e09d2 Make the spring rolls Separate the spring roll wrappers.
2847d695-430d-4d8e-934f-3f58303e09d2 Make the spring rolls Lay a wrapper flat, place a tablespoonful or two of the mixture (depending on the size of your spring roll wrappers) near the center and wrap sealing the edges with beaten egg (see step-by-step guide for wrapping spring rolls). Repeat until all the wrappers have been filled or until you run out of filling.
2847d695-430d-4d8e-934f-3f58303e09d2 Fry the spring rolls In a frying pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least three inches.
2847d695-430d-4d8e-934f-3f58303e09d2 Fry the spring rolls Fry the spring rolls, in batches if your frying pan is rather small, until the wrappers are browned and crisp. Drain in paper towels.
2847d695-430d-4d8e-934f-3f58303e09d2 Serve the cheese and laing spring rolls If you use small spring roll wrappers, I suggest that you serve the spring rolls whole. If you use large wrappers, you may want to cut each spring roll in half before serving.
2847d695-430d-4d8e-934f-3f58303e09d2 Serve the cheese and laing spring rolls Optionally, serve the spring rolls on a bed of lettuce with cucumber slices on the side.
71dd6976-b77c-4cd0-a95d-483426aa674d
Boil plenty of water in a pot. Throw in a heaping tablespoonful of salt. Cook the pasta al dente.
71dd6976-b77c-4cd0-a95d-483426aa674d
While the pasta boils, spread the bacon in a hot frying pan. Cook until browned and fat has been rendered. Scoop out and set aside.
71dd6976-b77c-4cd0-a95d-483426aa674d
Pour off the bacon fat leaving two tablespoonfuls in the frying pan. Add the olive oil and heat.
71dd6976-b77c-4cd0-a95d-483426aa674d
Cook the garlic in the hot oil over medium heat just until starting to brown.
71dd6976-b77c-4cd0-a95d-483426aa674d
Throw the asparagus into the hot oil, sprinkle with salt and cook for about two minutes.
71dd6976-b77c-4cd0-a95d-483426aa674d
Stir in the shrimps, sprinkle in more salt, add pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, for about two minutes or just until the shrimps are done (see notes after the recipe).
71dd6976-b77c-4cd0-a95d-483426aa674d
Drain the pasta (reserve a quarter cup of the cooking liquid) and dump into the frying pan.
71dd6976-b77c-4cd0-a95d-483426aa674d
Pour in the pasta liquid. Cook, tossing everything together, for another minute.
71dd6976-b77c-4cd0-a95d-483426aa674d
Off the heat, add the bacon to the pasta and toss a few more times.
71dd6976-b77c-4cd0-a95d-483426aa674d
Serve the bacon, shrimps and asparagus spaghetti with Parmesan.
9ff1e799-4195-41a8-b582-bc3f1130f29b
Grill (can also be steamed, broiled or boiled) the eggplants until soft. Cool.
9ff1e799-4195-41a8-b582-bc3f1130f29b
Heat and frying pan and spread the bacon in it. Cook until crisp and fat has been rendered. Scoop out the bacon and set aside.
9ff1e799-4195-41a8-b582-bc3f1130f29b
In the rendered bacon fat, saute the ground pork until no longer pink. Add the shallot and garlic, sprinkle in salt and pepper, and cook until the shallot pieces are translucent. Scoop everything out and transfer to a plate. Cool.
9ff1e799-4195-41a8-b582-bc3f1130f29b
While the ground pork mixture cools, peel the eggplants. Discard the skins; lightly flatten the flesh (the back of a fork is useful for this purpose).
9ff1e799-4195-41a8-b582-bc3f1130f29b
Beat the eggs in a bowl. Stir in the bacon and ground pork mixture.
9ff1e799-4195-41a8-b582-bc3f1130f29b
Set the stove to medium and reheat the remaining fat in the frying pan.
9ff1e799-4195-41a8-b582-bc3f1130f29b
Lay the eggplants in the pan. If your frying pan is not large enough to hold all three side by side, you will have to cook the eggplant torta one by one.
9ff1e799-4195-41a8-b582-bc3f1130f29b
Spoon the bacon and ground pork mixture over the eggplants. Top with mozzarella slices. Cover the pan and cook the torta until the eggs are set and the cheese is melted.
9ff1e799-4195-41a8-b582-bc3f1130f29b
Serve the eggplant torta at once.
431c67ba-3ab2-442d-b4e7-69652b3e70a3
Rinse the fish and wipe dry with paper towels. Sprinkle generously with salt and pepper on all sides.
431c67ba-3ab2-442d-b4e7-69652b3e70a3
Heat the oil in a frying pan.
431c67ba-3ab2-442d-b4e7-69652b3e70a3
Lightly fry the fish on both sides just until done. DO NOT overcook. Scoop out and move to a plate.
431c67ba-3ab2-442d-b4e7-69652b3e70a3
Using two forks, cut the fish flesh into chunks.
431c67ba-3ab2-442d-b4e7-69652b3e70a3
In the remaining oil, lightly fry the eggplants. Scoop out and spread on a plate just before they are done (they will continue to soften off the heat).
431c67ba-3ab2-442d-b4e7-69652b3e70a3
In the remaining cooking oil, saute the garlic, shallots and bay leaves.
431c67ba-3ab2-442d-b4e7-69652b3e70a3
Pour in the vinegar, sprinkle in salt and pepper, and allow to bubble until the liquid is reduced by half.
431c67ba-3ab2-442d-b4e7-69652b3e70a3
Pour in the coconut cream. Taste. Adjust the seasonings, as needed. Heat just until the mixture is bubbly.
431c67ba-3ab2-442d-b4e7-69652b3e70a3
Add the fish and eggplants to the sauce. Toss lightly (be careful not to break the eggplants and fish) but thoroughly to coat each piece of fish and eggplant with sauce.
431c67ba-3ab2-442d-b4e7-69652b3e70a3
Garnish the fish and eggplant adobo with coconut cream with toasted garlic, fried shallots and sliced scallion. Serve immediately.
5327ac37-d1dd-4a30-8510-a79abce905b3
Cut the beef into thin slices.
5327ac37-d1dd-4a30-8510-a79abce905b3
Rinse the lettuce and break up unto bite-size pieces. Pass through the salad spinner to remove as much water as possible.
5327ac37-d1dd-4a30-8510-a79abce905b3
Dump the bean sprouts in a large bowl and fill with water. Pick out bean skins that float and discard. Pour off the water. Rinse the sprouts a few times and drain. Pass through the salad spinner (don’t overdo this!) to remove surface water.
5327ac37-d1dd-4a30-8510-a79abce905b3
Toast the cashew nuts in an oil-free pan until lightly browned. Cool.
5327ac37-d1dd-4a30-8510-a79abce905b3
To make the dressing, start by thinning the peanut butter. Place in a bowl, add a quarter cup of hot water and mix until smooth.
5327ac37-d1dd-4a30-8510-a79abce905b3
Add the rest of the salad dressing ingredients to the peanut butter and mix well. Add more hot water, a tablespoon at a time, until the dressing is pourable. Note that I used a total of one-half cup hot water.
5327ac37-d1dd-4a30-8510-a79abce905b3
In a large mixing bowl, toss the beef, lettuce and bean sprouts.
5327ac37-d1dd-4a30-8510-a79abce905b3
Drizzle the dressing over the salad.
5327ac37-d1dd-4a30-8510-a79abce905b3
Sprinkle in the cashew nuts.
5327ac37-d1dd-4a30-8510-a79abce905b3
Serve the remaining dressing on the side.
eedb747a-9126-4ba8-b06a-334fc7a3f5ad
Cut the cauliflower into bite-sized florets.
eedb747a-9126-4ba8-b06a-334fc7a3f5ad
Trim the ends and edges of the snap peas (see guide).
eedb747a-9126-4ba8-b06a-334fc7a3f5ad
Slice the button mushrooms
eedb747a-9126-4ba8-b06a-334fc7a3f5ad
Cut each baby corn into three to four pieces.
eedb747a-9126-4ba8-b06a-334fc7a3f5ad
Heat the olive oil in a wok or frying pan. Add the butter. When the butter melts, stir in the garlic. This is sauteeing so keep the heat at medium.
eedb747a-9126-4ba8-b06a-334fc7a3f5ad
When the aroma of garlic starts to waft through your kitchen (don't wait for the garlic to brown too much!), throw the cauliflower florets and mushrooms into the wok or frying pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Saute for about two minutes.
eedb747a-9126-4ba8-b06a-334fc7a3f5ad
Add the snap peas and baby corn. Sprinkle with more salt and pepper. Saute for another minute or so.
eedb747a-9126-4ba8-b06a-334fc7a3f5ad
Turn off the heat. Take a piece of vegetable and taste. Add more salt and pepper, if needed.
eedb747a-9126-4ba8-b06a-334fc7a3f5ad
Serve the buttered mixed vegetables at once as a side dish to your meat or seafood main dish, or as a main dish for vegetarians.
d7b2212b-4bac-4fbb-98a4-d1500def6094
Arrange the pork belly slices in a wide shallow pan. Cover with water. Boil for 10 minutes.
d7b2212b-4bac-4fbb-98a4-d1500def6094
Drain the pork belly and rinse well to remove scum. Discard the water.
d7b2212b-4bac-4fbb-98a4-d1500def6094
Clean out the pan (or use another wide shallow pan) and spread the pork belly slices on the bottom. Pour in the broth and bring to the boil. Cover, lower the heat and simmer for 45 minutes to an hour or until tender. Halfway through the cooking time, taste the broth and add salt, if needed.
d7b2212b-4bac-4fbb-98a4-d1500def6094
While the pork cooks, toast the rice flour in an oil-free frying pan over medium heat until lightly browned and nutty in aroma. Set aside.
d7b2212b-4bac-4fbb-98a4-d1500def6094
Scoop out the pork belly slices, move to a rack and allow to cool.
d7b2212b-4bac-4fbb-98a4-d1500def6094
Pour the broth into a pot and reheat. Dump in the annatto seeds and boil until the broth turns reddish. Scoop out the annatto seeds and discard.
d7b2212b-4bac-4fbb-98a4-d1500def6094
Reheat the broth. Throw in the sitaw and cabbage wedges. Cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Scoop out, transfer to a plate and set aside. Do not turn off the heat.
d7b2212b-4bac-4fbb-98a4-d1500def6094
Add the banana heart and eggplant to the boiling broth. Cook just until done, about 10 minutes. Scoop out, move to a plate and set aside.
d7b2212b-4bac-4fbb-98a4-d1500def6094
Make the peanut sauce. Take out half a cup of the broth from the pan and pour into a heat proof bowl. Add the peanut butter and rice flour; stir until smooth.
d7b2212b-4bac-4fbb-98a4-d1500def6094
Pour the peanut butter mixture into the hot broth. Cook over medium heat, stirring, until smooth and thickened. Set aside.
d7b2212b-4bac-4fbb-98a4-d1500def6094
Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan. Fry the pork belly slices until browned and crisp. Do this in batches, if necessary, so that the pork slices do not touch one another during frying to ensure even cooking and browning.
d7b2212b-4bac-4fbb-98a4-d1500def6094
Reheat the sauce. Add all the cooked vegetables, stirring gently. Cook just until simmering.
d7b2212b-4bac-4fbb-98a4-d1500def6094
Pour the sauce and vegetables into a bowl. Top with the crispy pork belly. Serve immediately.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Marinate the ground pork Place the ground pork in a bowl. Add the soy sauce, rice wine and ginger. Mix well. Cover the bowl and let sit in the fridge for 30 minutes.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Prep the rest of the ingredients About five minutes before the marinating time is up, string the beans and cut into one-inch lengths.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Prep the rest of the ingredients Peel and roughly chop the shallot.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Prep the rest of the ingredients Peel and mince the garlic.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Prep the rest of the ingredients Cut the tofu into half-inch cubes.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Prep the rest of the ingredients Make a simple sauce by mixing together the bone broth, tapioca starch, pepper and sesame seed oil.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Stir fry the dish Heat the cooking oil in a work or frying pan.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Stir fry the dish Spread the ground pork on the hot oiled wok, leaving behind any liquid in the bowl in which it was marinated. Save the liquid.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Stir fry the dish Stir fry the ground pork for about three minutes or until just starting to brown.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Stir fry the dish Pour in any leftover marinade and sprinkle in the sugar. Continue stir frying until the liquid has been absorbed.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Stir fry the dish Add the green beans, sliced shallots and garlic. Stir fry until the beans are almost done, about three minutes.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Stir fry the dish Add the tofu and toss.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Stir fry the dish Stir the sauce to make sure that the starch to disperse any starch that has settled on the bottom, then pour into the pan. Cook, stirring, until the sauce is thick and clear.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Stir fry the dish Taste. Add salt, as needed. Toss to blend.
0ff2ef62-a4f8-4d44-af73-7f61099aa7ee Stir fry the dish Sprinkle with fried garlic before serving.
0a6d2567-1f53-474b-92ea-89a7af7007f3
In a wok or frying pan, heat the cooking oil to smoking point.
0a6d2567-1f53-474b-92ea-89a7af7007f3
Spread the ground beef in the hot oil. Cook without disturbing for a minute or two then stir to break up large lumps.
0a6d2567-1f53-474b-92ea-89a7af7007f3
Pour in the soy sauce. Sprinkle in two pinches of pepper. Stir fry until the mixture is quite dry.
0a6d2567-1f53-474b-92ea-89a7af7007f3
Throw in the sliced onion and minced garlic. Stir fry for half a minute.
0a6d2567-1f53-474b-92ea-89a7af7007f3
Add the sliced shiitake and julienned carrot. Sprinkle in a quarter teaspoon of salt and another pinch of pepper. Stir fry for half a minute.
0a6d2567-1f53-474b-92ea-89a7af7007f3
Next, add the bok choy tips and stir.
0a6d2567-1f53-474b-92ea-89a7af7007f3
Stir together all the ingredients for the sauce and pour into the pan. Cook, stirring, until the sauce is thick and clear. That should be just enough time to cook the bok choy tips through and still be lightly crisp.
0a6d2567-1f53-474b-92ea-89a7af7007f3
Serve your ground beef, shiitake and bok choy tips stir fry over rice with split boiled eggs on the side.
b710a510-60ce-4ea7-baf3-226aadb0b656
Add the corned beef cubes. Cook, stirring, until the meat changes color.
b710a510-60ce-4ea7-baf3-226aadb0b656
Pour in the bone broth. Add the finger chilies. Season with patis. Bring to the boil, cover and simmer for two to two and a half hours, or until the beef is tender.
b710a510-60ce-4ea7-baf3-226aadb0b656
About 20 minutes before the beef is done, add the taro wedges.
b710a510-60ce-4ea7-baf3-226aadb0b656
When the eggplants are almost done, pour in the tamarind extract and add the kangkong to the pot, pressing the kangkong down gently into the broth. Let boil for five minutes. Taste the broth and add more patis if necessary.
9ebb7b88-f2b9-483f-8d06-c30bcec112fd
Cut the chicken meat into bite-size pieces, or smaller. Place in a bowl, add the soy sauce, garlic and sesame seed oil. Mix well. Cover and allow to marinate in the fridge for at least two hours (overnight is even better).
9ebb7b88-f2b9-483f-8d06-c30bcec112fd
Place the quail eggs in a small pan and cover with water. Bring to the boil and cook for five minutes. Scoop out and dump in bowl of cold water to cool.
9ebb7b88-f2b9-483f-8d06-c30bcec112fd
While the quail eggs cook, string the chicharo, peel and thinly slice the onion, deseed and dice the bell pepper and cut the mushrooms into quarters.
9ebb7b88-f2b9-483f-8d06-c30bcec112fd
Peel the quail eggs.
9ebb7b88-f2b9-483f-8d06-c30bcec112fd
Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan until fine wisps of smoke float on the surface. Stir the chicken in the bowl in which it had been marinating. Spread the chicken evenly on the hot oil. Cook over high heat without disturbing for a minute or two. Flip the chicken pieces over and cook for another minute.
9ebb7b88-f2b9-483f-8d06-c30bcec112fd
Meanwhile, while the chicken pieces cook, whisk together the rice wine, chicken broth, oyster sauce, sugar and corn starch in a bowl.
9ebb7b88-f2b9-483f-8d06-c30bcec112fd
Scoop out the chicken and set aside.
9ebb7b88-f2b9-483f-8d06-c30bcec112fd
In the remaining oil, stir fry the onion, chicharo, bell pepper and mushrooms with the salt and pepper for about 30 seconds.
9ebb7b88-f2b9-483f-8d06-c30bcec112fd
Add the chicken to the vegetables and stir.
9ebb7b88-f2b9-483f-8d06-c30bcec112fd
Stir the broth-starch solution once more before pouring it into the pan with the chicken and vegetables. Cook, stirring, until the sauce is thick and clear.
9ebb7b88-f2b9-483f-8d06-c30bcec112fd
Give the stir fry a taste and adjust the seasonings, if needed. Optionally, drizzle in more sesame seed oil before serving.
ce655a1b-9e24-4bcf-9d2d-e1a9b08cfc71
Cut the beef into half-inch wide strips.
ce655a1b-9e24-4bcf-9d2d-e1a9b08cfc71
Place the beef in a bowl. Add the salt, pepper, garlic, ginger and starch. Mix well. Cover and leave in the fridge while you prepare the vegetables.
ce655a1b-9e24-4bcf-9d2d-e1a9b08cfc71
Cut the bok choy to separate the leaves from the stalks. Reserve the leaves for another dish. Cut the stalks horizontally into half-inch slices. You should have about four cups of sliced stalks to feed four people with normal appetite.
ce655a1b-9e24-4bcf-9d2d-e1a9b08cfc71
Peel and julienne the onion and carrot.
ce655a1b-9e24-4bcf-9d2d-e1a9b08cfc71
Set a wok or thick-bottomed frying pan on the stove over high heat. Pour in the cooking oil and swirl.
ce655a1b-9e24-4bcf-9d2d-e1a9b08cfc71
Spread the beef on the hot oil. Cook without disturbing for a minute or so. Stir, breaking up lumps, and stir fry for another minute.
ce655a1b-9e24-4bcf-9d2d-e1a9b08cfc71
Add the julienned carrot and onion. Stir fry for half a minute.
ce655a1b-9e24-4bcf-9d2d-e1a9b08cfc71
Add the bok choy stalks. Stir well.
ce655a1b-9e24-4bcf-9d2d-e1a9b08cfc71
Pour in the soy sauce and half cup of bone broth. Sprinkle in the sugar. Cook, stirring often, until the sauce thickens and is no longer cloudy. If you want a thinner sauce, pour in the remaining quarter cup of bone broth.
ce655a1b-9e24-4bcf-9d2d-e1a9b08cfc71
Taste. Adjust the seasonings, if needed.
ce655a1b-9e24-4bcf-9d2d-e1a9b08cfc71
Off the heat, drizzle in the sesame seed oil and toss everything to blend.
ce655a1b-9e24-4bcf-9d2d-e1a9b08cfc71
Sprinkle the Chinese-style beef and bok choy stir fry with toasted sesame seeds before serving.
33b1ed80-37e1-44c7-ae22-8cfd619e4334
6321fe69-f76b-476c-84cc-d6ef319c2a85
Using a mandolin slicer, thinly slice the corn kernels off the cobs. Scrape off with a knife whatever portion of the kernels are left attached to the cobs.
6321fe69-f76b-476c-84cc-d6ef319c2a85
Boil the scrap bones in plenty of water. Drain. Rinse well.
6321fe69-f76b-476c-84cc-d6ef319c2a85
Place the bones in a clean pot. Add the sliced corn. Pour in enough water so that there is at least two inches of water above the corn and bones. Bring to the boil.
6321fe69-f76b-476c-84cc-d6ef319c2a85
While waiting for the corn and bones and corn to come to a boil, peel the onion and roughly chop.
6321fe69-f76b-476c-84cc-d6ef319c2a85
When the corn and bones are boiling, add the chopped onion. Season the soup generously with fish sauce and and two pinches of ground pepper.
6321fe69-f76b-476c-84cc-d6ef319c2a85
Lower the heat, cover and simmer until the corn is soft and the broth is thickened. Stir occasionally to make sure nothing sticks to the bottom of the pot. Taste occasionally too and adjust the seasonings, if needed.
6321fe69-f76b-476c-84cc-d6ef319c2a85
When the corn is soft, add the okra and cubed squash. Stir. Cover the pot and simmer for 10 minutes.
6321fe69-f76b-476c-84cc-d6ef319c2a85
Taste the soup. Add more fish sauce and / or pepper, as needed.
6321fe69-f76b-476c-84cc-d6ef319c2a85
Add the squash blossoms, squash vine leaves and spinach to the pot. Stir. Simmer for another 10 minutes.
6321fe69-f76b-476c-84cc-d6ef319c2a85
Give the white corn soup with squash blossoms a final taste. Adjust the seasonings one last time, if needed. Serve the soup hot. Topped with chicharon, if you like.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d
In a large sauce pan, start boiling about three liters of water.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Make the filling Peel and finely chop the carrot and onion.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Make the filling Peel and mince the garlic (or finely chop, if that's easier for you).
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Make the filling Discard the stems of the shiitake. Coarsely chop the caps.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Make the filling Place the ground pork in a mixing bowl. Add the chopped carrot, onion, minced garlic, chopped shiitake, parsley, salt, pepper and Parmesan. Mix well. Cover the bowl and let the filling sit in the fridge while you prepare the cabbage.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Make the filling No egg in the filling? None. The grated Parmesan acts as binder. It's tastier, believe me.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Prep the cabbage Place the cabbage on a cutting board.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Prep the cabbage Using a small pointed knife, cut around the core in the shape of a cone. Keep going until the core is loose. Pull it out and discard.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Prep the cabbage Drop the cabbage into the boiling water, cored side down, and let the water come to a rolling boil once more.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Prep the cabbage Lower the heat, cover the pan and cook the cabbage for about 10 minutes.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Prep the cabbage Scoop out the cabbage and dump in a bowl of iced water. When cool, place in a strainer, cored side up, and allow to drip for a few minutes.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Prep the cabbage Carefully loosen the cabbage leaves to separate.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Prep the cabbage Take one cabbage leaf and, using a sharp knife, shave off the thick portion that runs vertically in the middle of the leaf. Be careful not to shave too deep to avoid tearing the cabbage. Do this with all the cabbage leaves.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Prep the cabbage The too small ones near the core, you may chop finely and mix into the filling. But that's entirely optional.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Assemble the cabbage rolls Take the filling out of the fridge.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Assemble the cabbage rolls Lay a trimmed cabbage leaf on your work surface. Position it so that the thicker side is pointing towards you. Place a heaping tablespoon of filling near the center. Fold the thick side of the cabbage leaf over the filling. Then, fold in the left and right sides. Roll the cabbage leaf away from you to seal in the filling. Repeat until all the cabbage leaves have been filled or until you run out of filling. Optionally, you may secure the cabbage rolls with toothpicks.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Cook the cabbage rolls Heat up your tomato sauce if you've made it already. Use a pan wide enough to contain all the cabbage rolls snugly in a single layer.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Cook the cabbage rolls Or start cooking your tomato sauce (get the recipe). If you're not into homemade tomato sauce, use store-bought.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Cook the cabbage rolls When the tomato sauce is hot, arrange the cabbage rolls in the pan, seam side down, in a single layer.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Cook the cabbage rolls To prevent the cabbage rolls from opening during cooking, pack them as tightly as you can. AND keep the heat on LOW so that the sauce is barely simmering. The least agitation taking place in the pan during cooking, the less the chance that the cabbage rolls will open up and look ruined.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Cook the cabbage rolls Cook the cabbage rolls over LOW heat for about 30 minutes.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Cook the cabbage rolls Using a slotted spoon, scoop out the cabbage rolls and arrange in a bowl.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Cook the cabbage rolls Spoon the sauce over and around them. Optionally, sprinkle with more chopped parsley.
7addc0e3-8e60-427a-857e-e136e1da755d Cook the cabbage rolls Serve the cabbage rolls hot. With rice or crusty bread.
7f73e6ab-4154-4a22-8f96-a0351133e788
Place the ground pork in a bowl. Add the black bean sauce, chili oil and garlic sauce and hoisin sauce. Mix well. Set aside to marinate.
7f73e6ab-4154-4a22-8f96-a0351133e788
Break off the tough portion of the stalk of the asparagus and discard. Cut the asparagus into two-inch lengths.
7f73e6ab-4154-4a22-8f96-a0351133e788
Cut off the root ends of the shimeji mushrooms. Rinse, if needed, then dry in a salad spinner.
7f73e6ab-4154-4a22-8f96-a0351133e788
Pound the garlic cloves, shake off the skins and discard.
7f73e6ab-4154-4a22-8f96-a0351133e788
Peel the ginger and roughly chop.
7f73e6ab-4154-4a22-8f96-a0351133e788
Mince the garlic and ginger together.
7f73e6ab-4154-4a22-8f96-a0351133e788
Peel the shallot and thinly slice.
7f73e6ab-4154-4a22-8f96-a0351133e788
Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan. Saute the garlic-ginger mixture and shallots until aromatic, about one minute.
7f73e6ab-4154-4a22-8f96-a0351133e788
Add the asparagus and mushrooms to the sauteed ingredients. Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Stir fry for one to two minutes. Scoop out and transfer to a shallow bowl.
7f73e6ab-4154-4a22-8f96-a0351133e788
To the remaining oil, add the ground pork. Stir to break up any lumps. Cook for about five to six minutes until done and the sauces have caramelized.
7f73e6ab-4154-4a22-8f96-a0351133e788
Add the mushroom-asparagus mixture to the pork. Stir fry for half a minute. Taste and adjust the seasonings, if needed.
7f73e6ab-4154-4a22-8f96-a0351133e788
Serve the spicy pork, mushrooms and asparagus stir fry at once.
ffcaaca9-cc4f-42ae-9713-b3452848a4c0
Spread the hot adlai on a tray or baking sheet to cool.
ffcaaca9-cc4f-42ae-9713-b3452848a4c0
Meanwhile, prepare the rest of the ingredients. Peel and chop the carrot.
ffcaaca9-cc4f-42ae-9713-b3452848a4c0
Remove the seeds and white pith of the bell pepper, then chop.
ffcaaca9-cc4f-42ae-9713-b3452848a4c0
Peel and chop the shallot or onion.
ffcaaca9-cc4f-42ae-9713-b3452848a4c0
Cut the pork belly slices into strips about half an inch wide.
ffcaaca9-cc4f-42ae-9713-b3452848a4c0
Thinly slice the Chinese sausages.
ffcaaca9-cc4f-42ae-9713-b3452848a4c0
Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan.
ffcaaca9-cc4f-42ae-9713-b3452848a4c0
Throw the pork belly strips into the hot oil. Season with salt and pepper. Stir fry for about five minutes or until cooked through and lightly browned.
ffcaaca9-cc4f-42ae-9713-b3452848a4c0
Add the chopped carrot, bell pepper and shallot (or onion) to the pork. Season with more salt and pepper. Stir fry for a minute or two.
ffcaaca9-cc4f-42ae-9713-b3452848a4c0
Add the sliced Chinese sausages to the pork and vegetables in the wok. Stir fry for half a minute.
ffcaaca9-cc4f-42ae-9713-b3452848a4c0
Take the cooled adlai and dump into the wok. Pour in the soy sauce, oyster sauce and hoisin sauce. Stir fry until the adlai is heated through. Taste and add more salt and pepper, as needed.
ffcaaca9-cc4f-42ae-9713-b3452848a4c0
Make a well in the center of the wok and pour in the beaten eggs. When the eggs start to set along the edges, stir them into the adlai using a slow circular motion so that you gather more adlai with every circle you make.
ffcaaca9-cc4f-42ae-9713-b3452848a4c0
Off the heat, drizzle in the sesame seed oil and stir to blend.
ffcaaca9-cc4f-42ae-9713-b3452848a4c0
Serve the fried adlai a la yang chow immediately.
44333363-935b-4e2c-9912-0f1e4479d0b2
91426d07-caf9-41ca-959f-5a69cd5ed732
a05f17eb-8425-496f-b9e8-8e272f02116f
d90cf76d-cddf-42b4-b992-7c2b7e249d7a
1ba99a67-c3f9-4784-b97d-474c50d98a2e
d4d5100c-a273-4479-98fd-4fcaf4ba3396

45be97d1-f319-48f3-985f-99cbb12a5942

c7a2d30e-7260-4695-a5e7-cefe790dd617
5c9ec7b1-4db9-4124-aebf-fd1cef0db863
Cut the scallions into half-inch lengths.
5c9ec7b1-4db9-4124-aebf-fd1cef0db863
Peel and roughly chop the onion.
0bcb514f-77a4-4dc9-9fe3-3e67bf208ff5
1e5c47a8-4dbf-4474-8175-5f4f85c4e750
4770129e-d91b-46e0-ba23-ac661c6c3a55
3632c8ca-8c52-495f-881b-ca369628b907
Make the sauce by stirring together the broth, oyster sauce, soy sauce, sugar and starch. Pour into the wok. Stir until the sauce is thick and clear. Turn off the heat. Transfer the chicken chop suey in a platter and serve at once.
ea490ad4-dc0b-4ee3-9b6e-ff39092a4774
11a5642e-69e7-4a11-9370-50b6e9d33e6e
9bfca7a7-04ce-473d-b100-6d01323d9913
7ab79e7a-3b78-4561-873c-0460b1ab80c9
333a665b-8614-4082-a641-2173cd587880
83a2911e-e13b-44c6-8f72-71a00839024d
41b1b171-10e7-402a-9ce3-b0759c711a96
15d73c2a-07a9-4850-a44d-38c3e020a8f0
05afc911-926d-4d66-af1e-963e81824e8b
4110798a-fd35-4733-8e54-18098043490f
c42e7568-3589-4a09-ad0c-b581ba784162
ae734544-b97c-43e2-ba37-f81e31630c09
d2521b00-723f-45ad-a1d4-b085af246acc
94ccd511-0c10-45e8-a704-0d00ba1ea040
Heat the oil in a wok or frying pan.
94ccd511-0c10-45e8-a704-0d00ba1ea040
Over medium-low heat, sauté the onion, tomatoes, garlic, ginger and chili with a dash of fish sauce until soft.
94ccd511-0c10-45e8-a704-0d00ba1ea040
While the vegetables soften, flake the fish into fairly large chunks (discard the head, skin and tail).
94ccd511-0c10-45e8-a704-0d00ba1ea040
Throw in the winged beans into the pan. Season with another dash of fish sauce and stir.
94ccd511-0c10-45e8-a704-0d00ba1ea040
Add half of the flaked smoked milkfish to the winged beans. Stir.
94ccd511-0c10-45e8-a704-0d00ba1ea040
Pour in the coconut milk.
94ccd511-0c10-45e8-a704-0d00ba1ea040
Cook over medium-low heat, covered, until the winged beans are cooked through but still with a slight crunch, and the mixture is almost dry.
94ccd511-0c10-45e8-a704-0d00ba1ea040
Toss in the remaining half of the smoked milkfish, stir and cook, uncovered, for another minute.
94ccd511-0c10-45e8-a704-0d00ba1ea040
Taste and add more fish sauce, if necessary.
858d7758-9f2d-4d8f-b553-48544e67afab
930c0a3a-3c0e-4815-8fb0-f26656309747
4a52970b-384b-444a-90c1-b9ee924ee1a4
b76e4447-9bd7-4ae0-979e-fea4133a2f02

ae1f9002-d1ae-457a-8405-8479d4828fc1
f0301c61-5ab8-4582-b20f-cfbc5f04fc82
2f262e1b-f669-484c-9f93-10bad2acbd37
Heat 2 tablespoons of cooking oil and 2 tablespoons of butter.
15acf896-b488-4629-96c2-127b2ab275ce
b269b9d6-e848-4b83-9c88-003bb1a306b3
32209b5c-becb-43ad-9d97-7285b4c569a1
eec5f907-b59a-46a6-bbd3-1edf3f00431c
51bc6e20-e4b2-4013-bd30-6205607be53a
0501df51-9acf-4581-b6ba-3f5a6c89339b
431ee12c-73bd-424c-961f-de98983a91cf
1eb6bdbb-0910-4b44-93cb-cd8201b6346e
Blanch the broccoli florets. Dump in an ice bath and drain well (see "What is blanching and how is it different from parboiling?").
3b796cde-df13-4aa8-8fcc-10c02cc33911
b8982f22-0be7-4475-bbe6-17ae2226f174
514aa88e-ee45-4657-8afc-b49b304fba1a
b63b4497-fd32-4903-a3a8-63d823f3e90c
74382153-13d0-46ce-a990-0bb3b53a4864
7963c4f5-44fc-42cd-a263-0385748523dc
37bae720-9a36-4049-b883-76f666b9362c
b7a2cc49-c9d1-47fa-974a-d42b58b3ec3b
Pour in the rice vinegar. Add the sugar, garlic and chilis plus about a tablespoonful of fish sauce. Stir. Cook over high heat without disturbing until the liquid has been absorbed by the meat.
b7a2cc49-c9d1-47fa-974a-d42b58b3ec3b
Add the cooked eggplants to the pork. Sprinkle with a little more fish sauce (the eggplants are still unseasoned at this point, remember). Toss a few times.
6e11aca5-8b89-4b8f-a5a9-f7850f1a481b
a3be113d-008b-4df7-bdf0-7c2efb9e0f00
ffae323f-14f0-4283-97b2-23ffb9aad8a7
cc1a310a-947e-45ed-b64b-cb466dae9934
Transfer the stir fry to a platter. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds and sliced scallions. Serve hot with rice.
1d48d392-1bc7-4bdb-90f6-0e6a63ed8d1b
98d11141-9c79-4aa7-89fd-a3dc672d4be0

9acbb48d-f3b2-4ba4-a0aa-ce7a1cff72ef

61827b6a-d64d-4b95-8481-89b5fbe6428e

6a1eb3f8-3390-44b8-a761-8407b0da81a5

ed971e2d-c10c-493d-80a8-c8c01b15c440
987e3a5f-edbe-4cd0-be57-67e551041478
7c89312a-ca4d-4536-95ee-e030f6c6775a
9ddf2a25-56ef-4b37-a951-a2739adcc97c
25028e69-2e18-4f1f-bee0-43ae0184de65
1b83d345-847f-437f-8564-21736e8c11e0
e4253a39-5b2f-420d-af93-39e3a0f3410a
338648fc-1950-4064-9338-ed617f81fd76 Prepare the filling Cut the ubod into matchsticks.
338648fc-1950-4064-9338-ed617f81fd76 Cook the filling While the filling cools, make the wrappers
338648fc-1950-4064-9338-ed617f81fd76 Assemble the spring rolls Lay a wrapper flat on a plate. Place two tablespoonfuls of the filling across the middle. Fold the edge nearest you to cover the filling. Take the side edges and fold over the center then roll the entire thing.
338648fc-1950-4064-9338-ed617f81fd76 Make the peanut sauce
eb17abd7-06e0-488a-99bb-575d98507419
Dice the tomatoes and onion and place in a large bowl.
eb17abd7-06e0-488a-99bb-575d98507419
Tear the salmon into large chunks; add to the bowl.
eb17abd7-06e0-488a-99bb-575d98507419
Tear (or cut) the cilantro and add to the salmon and vegetables.
eb17abd7-06e0-488a-99bb-575d98507419
Season with salt and pepper.
eb17abd7-06e0-488a-99bb-575d98507419
Add the chili flakes, pour in the lemon juice and mango sauce and toss lightly.
eb17abd7-06e0-488a-99bb-575d98507419
I recommend chilling before serving to allow the flavors to blend. It’s really wonderful — no superlatives can suffice.
61dabf8b-ce5a-49cc-aed3-4972a3f610cc Cook the filling
61dabf8b-ce5a-49cc-aed3-4972a3f610cc Make the sauce
61dabf8b-ce5a-49cc-aed3-4972a3f610cc Assemble the spring rolls
f4773158-d848-45de-a4de-f41ac3b7dd00
4282603b-b524-4e9e-8078-369e4175749c
4dd9802f-8d6c-4629-a89e-bf12fcea070d
00f2de7f-f6da-43ae-80d9-5294d0c062a1
Rinse the pig’s brains well. With your hands, pull off the veins and membranes.
00f2de7f-f6da-43ae-80d9-5294d0c062a1
Boil the cleaned brains in 1/2 cup of salted water for 5 minutes.
00f2de7f-f6da-43ae-80d9-5294d0c062a1
Cut into quarter inch cubes.
00f2de7f-f6da-43ae-80d9-5294d0c062a1
Boil, steam or grill eggplants until tender but not mushy. Drain and cool.
00f2de7f-f6da-43ae-80d9-5294d0c062a1
Peel off the skins. Using the back of a fork, flatten the eggplants. Sprinkle with a little salt and pepper.
00f2de7f-f6da-43ae-80d9-5294d0c062a1
Finely chop the onion and carrot.
00f2de7f-f6da-43ae-80d9-5294d0c062a1
Beat eggs in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper.
00f2de7f-f6da-43ae-80d9-5294d0c062a1
Add cubed pig’s brain, minced garlic, chopped onion, carrot and parsley into the beaten eggs. Blend well.
00f2de7f-f6da-43ae-80d9-5294d0c062a1
Spoon the egg mixture into the flattened eggplants. Pat and smoothen the top.
00f2de7f-f6da-43ae-80d9-5294d0c062a1
Heat a large skillet. Pour in the cooking oil. Heat until it starts to smoke.
84492f56-4f0f-4eea-8674-0d922725f03c
Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan.
84492f56-4f0f-4eea-8674-0d922725f03c
Spread the carrot, bell pepper and mushrooms on the bottom. Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper.
84492f56-4f0f-4eea-8674-0d922725f03c
Cook over medium heat for about two minutes then stir and continue cooking for another minute.
84492f56-4f0f-4eea-8674-0d922725f03c
Stir in the grated caulilfower, spinach, kimchi and kimchi juice. Cook, stirring often, until the vegetables are cooked through but still a bit crisp, and the kimchi juice has been soaked up.
84492f56-4f0f-4eea-8674-0d922725f03c
Off the heat, taste and adjust the seasonings, if needed.
d54dabc5-b550-4427-9142-10fa67690220
Slice the mangoes to remove the stones. Cut the mango meat into small squares without piercing the skin. Scoop out with a spoon directly into a bowl.
d54dabc5-b550-4427-9142-10fa67690220
Peel the cucumbers, scoop out and discard the seeds, then cut the cucumber flesh into cubes about the same size as the mangoes.
d54dabc5-b550-4427-9142-10fa67690220
Cut the mangoes into halves, scoop out and discard the seeds, then cut the flesh into small cubes (see notes after the recipe).
d54dabc5-b550-4427-9142-10fa67690220
Peel and roughly chop the onions.
d54dabc5-b550-4427-9142-10fa67690220
Add the cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, scallions and cilantro to the mango in the bowl. Toss gently.
d54dabc5-b550-4427-9142-10fa67690220
Stir together all the ingredients for the dressing until the no solids are visible.
d54dabc5-b550-4427-9142-10fa67690220
Drizzle half of the dressing over the contents of the bowl. Toss everything together. Taste. If under-dressed, drizzle in the remaining dressing and toss a few more times.
4df1565e-6d92-43a9-acd4-cded10312736
15ce4fb1-060b-4cc5-b1d2-05513b6f6ace
Rinse the patola well under the tap.
15ce4fb1-060b-4cc5-b1d2-05513b6f6ace
Cut off the tops of the patola and discard. Slice the patola into halves lengthwise then cut into half inch slices.
15ce4fb1-060b-4cc5-b1d2-05513b6f6ace
Peel the garlic and mince.
15ce4fb1-060b-4cc5-b1d2-05513b6f6ace
Finely slice the chilies.
15ce4fb1-060b-4cc5-b1d2-05513b6f6ace
Heat the cooking oil.
15ce4fb1-060b-4cc5-b1d2-05513b6f6ace
Saute the garlic and chilies gently until fragrant, about a minute.
15ce4fb1-060b-4cc5-b1d2-05513b6f6ace
Add the patola slices, toss and drizzle in a teaspoon of fish sauce. Cook for about five minutes, stirring occasionally, until the patola is cooked through but before the inside turns too mushy.
15ce4fb1-060b-4cc5-b1d2-05513b6f6ace
Stir the soy sauce into the beaten eggs and drizzle over the patola. Cook, stirring gently, just until set.
15ce4fb1-060b-4cc5-b1d2-05513b6f6ace
Taste and drizzle in more fish sauce, if needed.
15ce4fb1-060b-4cc5-b1d2-05513b6f6ace
Garnish with more chili slices (optional) and serve immediately.
d78865a5-4ce6-4efd-aa04-006721ca0401
79b01034-43a1-41a0-9373-713c5d3267fc
4c0bcc94-4d8b-4a4e-b2df-553eade5e2cd
2841a7b8-20ba-48c4-9db6-e4561f1dfc71
Cut off and discard any tough portions of the spinach. Rinse well. Blanch, rinse and squeeze our excess water.
2841a7b8-20ba-48c4-9db6-e4561f1dfc71
Finely slice the spinach and place in a bowl.
2841a7b8-20ba-48c4-9db6-e4561f1dfc71
Cut the cheese into small cubes. Add to the spinach. Sprinkle in a few pinches of salt and pepper and mix.
2841a7b8-20ba-48c4-9db6-e4561f1dfc71
Place a tablespoon of the spinach-cheese mixture on a spring roll wrapper and wrap up sealing the edges with the egg mixture (see step-by-step guide for wrapping spring rolls).
2841a7b8-20ba-48c4-9db6-e4561f1dfc71
Heat enough cooking oil in a frying pan to reach a depth of about three inches.
2841a7b8-20ba-48c4-9db6-e4561f1dfc71
Fry the spring rolls (in batches if your frying pan is on the small side) until crisp and golden.
2841a7b8-20ba-48c4-9db6-e4561f1dfc71
If you use small spring roll wrappers, you may serve the spring rolls as soon as they are out of the hot oil. Of the wrappers are large, you may want to cut the spring rolls into halves or thirds before serving.
a5ebaff8-c85a-4e64-8a12-fbe82a46772b Prep the salad components Thinly slice the mushrooms.
a5ebaff8-c85a-4e64-8a12-fbe82a46772b Prep the salad components Peel, halve and thinly slice the onion.
a5ebaff8-c85a-4e64-8a12-fbe82a46772b Prep the salad components Tear the lettuce into bite-size pieces, rinse thoroughly and dry in a salad spinner.
a5ebaff8-c85a-4e64-8a12-fbe82a46772b Saute the mushrooms Over medium heat, melt the two tablespoons butter in a large frying pan. Tilt the pan around to cover the entire bottom.
a5ebaff8-c85a-4e64-8a12-fbe82a46772b Saute the mushrooms Spread the mushrooms slices evenly in the pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Leave for about two minutes to allow the undersides to brown a little then cook, stirring often, for another two to three minutes until lightly browned.
a5ebaff8-c85a-4e64-8a12-fbe82a46772b Saute the mushrooms Scoop out the mushrooms and transfer to a bowl.
a5ebaff8-c85a-4e64-8a12-fbe82a46772b Make the dressing Peel and grate the garlic.
a5ebaff8-c85a-4e64-8a12-fbe82a46772b Make the dressing Add the garlic to the pan drippings and cook over medium-low heat for about 10 seconds.
a5ebaff8-c85a-4e64-8a12-fbe82a46772b Make the dressing Off the heat, add the rest of the butter. Swirl the pan until the butter is just melted.
a5ebaff8-c85a-4e64-8a12-fbe82a46772b Make the dressing Stir in the lemon juice.
a5ebaff8-c85a-4e64-8a12-fbe82a46772b Make the dressing Taste. Add more salt, pepper or lemon juice, or all of them.
a5ebaff8-c85a-4e64-8a12-fbe82a46772b Assemble the salad Pour two tablespoons of dressing into a mixing bowl. Tilt the bowl to allow the dressing to spread to the sides.
a5ebaff8-c85a-4e64-8a12-fbe82a46772b Assemble the salad Dump in the lettuce. Toss well.
a5ebaff8-c85a-4e64-8a12-fbe82a46772b Assemble the salad Divide the lettuce among four salad bowls. Top with onion slices and the sauteed mushrooms. Drizzle in the remaining dressing. Serve at once.
d8aaddb3-882f-4b0f-85d1-107f1db9e82e
Drain the tofu and cut into two-inch cubes. Set aside.
d8aaddb3-882f-4b0f-85d1-107f1db9e82e
Drain the wood ears, cut off the tough portions and discard (see how). Dice the remaining gelatinous portions.
d8aaddb3-882f-4b0f-85d1-107f1db9e82e
Pour the soy sauce, mirin and rice wine vinegar into a wide shallow pan. If you want more sauce, add 1/4 cup well-seasoned vegetable broth. Stir in the sugar. Add the peppercorns, bay leaf, grated garlic and ginger. Heat and bring to the boil. Let boil, uncovered, for two to three minutes, or until slightly reduced. Stir in the Sriracha.
d8aaddb3-882f-4b0f-85d1-107f1db9e82e
Drop in the tofu cubes in a single layer. Scatter the wood ears over the tofu.
d8aaddb3-882f-4b0f-85d1-107f1db9e82e
Cover the pan, lower the heat and braise the tofu and wood ears for five minutes. Turn off the heat. Leave the tofu and wood ears in the sauce for another 10 minutes.
d8aaddb3-882f-4b0f-85d1-107f1db9e82e
Drizzle the sesame seed oil over the tofu and wood ears. Sprinkle in the scallions and toasted sesame seeds.
d8aaddb3-882f-4b0f-85d1-107f1db9e82e
Serve the soy braised tofu and wood ears hot, warm or at room temperature.
a1cc1333-f470-496e-98db-5ff1bfa3a75f
Boil two cups of water in a wok or frying pan. Dump in the trimmed beans and cook for two to three minutes. Scoop out and drain.
a1cc1333-f470-496e-98db-5ff1bfa3a75f
Discard the water and wipe the wok or drying pan dry. Set the stove to medium heat. Reheat the wok and frying pan.
a1cc1333-f470-496e-98db-5ff1bfa3a75f
Pour in the sesame seed oil.
a1cc1333-f470-496e-98db-5ff1bfa3a75f
Saute the chopped garlic and drained green beans for about half a minute or just until the aroma of garlic starts to waft through the kitchen.
a1cc1333-f470-496e-98db-5ff1bfa3a75f
Pour in the mirin (or whatever rice wine you're using) and soy sauce. Stir.
a1cc1333-f470-496e-98db-5ff1bfa3a75f
Cook the green beans, uncovered, for another two to three minutes or until done and until they have soaked up much of the sauce.
a1cc1333-f470-496e-98db-5ff1bfa3a75f
Transfer the cooked beans on a plate. Spoon the garlic and whatever sauce is left over them.
a1cc1333-f470-496e-98db-5ff1bfa3a75f
Sprinkle in the sesame seeds and serve at once.
8a12f0d2-652e-45e2-a10c-3c190382c808
Rinse the tofu and pat dry with paper towels. Cut into bite-size pieces.
8a12f0d2-652e-45e2-a10c-3c190382c808
In a wok or frying pan, heat enough oil to reach a depth of at least three inches.
8a12f0d2-652e-45e2-a10c-3c190382c808
Fry the tofu over high heat until golden and crisp. Scoop out and transfer to a strainer.
8a12f0d2-652e-45e2-a10c-3c190382c808
Pour off the oil leaving only about a teaspoonful.
8a12f0d2-652e-45e2-a10c-3c190382c808
Reheat the oil and saute the sliced onion until just starting to turn soft, about a minute.
8a12f0d2-652e-45e2-a10c-3c190382c808
Add the fried tofu back to the pan.
8a12f0d2-652e-45e2-a10c-3c190382c808
Add the sauces. Pour in about a quarter cup of water. Tip: You may mix the three sauces with water before pouring into the pan to make everything simpler.
8a12f0d2-652e-45e2-a10c-3c190382c808
Cook, tossing, until the tofu pieces are heated through and evenly coated with sauce.
8a12f0d2-652e-45e2-a10c-3c190382c808
Off the heat, drizzle in the sesame seed oil and toss the tofu a few more times.
8a12f0d2-652e-45e2-a10c-3c190382c808
Transfer the crispy fried tofu with chili garlic sauce to a serving bowl or individual bowls. Sprinkle with sliced scallions before serving.
2c02c58e-af1a-43b0-b1ac-8cda8777b1b9
1b080034-3fae-480d-979a-18aed7d8d049
Heat the olive oil in a small frying pan.
1b080034-3fae-480d-979a-18aed7d8d049
Cook the chickpeas in the hot oil until the surface is starting to brown.
1b080034-3fae-480d-979a-18aed7d8d049
Add the green beans. Cook, stirring often, for a minute.
1b080034-3fae-480d-979a-18aed7d8d049
Add the bell pepper and cook, stirring, for half a minute.
1b080034-3fae-480d-979a-18aed7d8d049
Stir in the tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Tip: if using a lot of feta, use salt sparingly. Stir once more and cook for another half a minute.
1b080034-3fae-480d-979a-18aed7d8d049
Tilt the contents of the frying pan into a salad bowl.
1b080034-3fae-480d-979a-18aed7d8d049
Spread the crumbled feta over the vegetables or crumble a piece of feta directly over them.
1b080034-3fae-480d-979a-18aed7d8d049
Sprinkle in the toasted cashew nuts.
1b080034-3fae-480d-979a-18aed7d8d049
Squeeze the lemon directly over everything making sure that no seeds fall into the bowl.
1b080034-3fae-480d-979a-18aed7d8d049
Drizzle extra virgin olive oil over the salad.
1b080034-3fae-480d-979a-18aed7d8d049
Garnish with basil chiffonade.
1b080034-3fae-480d-979a-18aed7d8d049
Serve the warm chickpea and green beans salad immediately.
e7c48897-25e3-4673-9c2f-d8cb35ee4496
Heat the butter in a frying pan. Add the chopped onion. Sprinkle with half of the salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat until the onion caramelizes.
e7c48897-25e3-4673-9c2f-d8cb35ee4496
Add the peppers and broccoli florets. Sprinkle with the remaining salt and pepper. Cook for a few minutes, tossing often, just until the broccoli florets are done.
e7c48897-25e3-4673-9c2f-d8cb35ee4496
Serve alongside your fried, grilled or broiled meat, seafood or vegetables.
585e83ef-b33d-4289-ace9-d85599407b45
Peel and core the chayote, then julienne (see tips).
585e83ef-b33d-4289-ace9-d85599407b45
Peel the carrot and julienne.
585e83ef-b33d-4289-ace9-d85599407b45
Deseed the bell pepper and julienne.
585e83ef-b33d-4289-ace9-d85599407b45
Peel and thinly slice the shallots.
585e83ef-b33d-4289-ace9-d85599407b45
Peel and mince the garlic.
585e83ef-b33d-4289-ace9-d85599407b45
Peel and grate the ginger.
585e83ef-b33d-4289-ace9-d85599407b45
Thinly slice the mushrooms.
585e83ef-b33d-4289-ace9-d85599407b45
Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan.
585e83ef-b33d-4289-ace9-d85599407b45
Saute the shallots, garlic and ginger until fragrant.
585e83ef-b33d-4289-ace9-d85599407b45
Turn up the heat to high and add the chayote, carrot, bell pepper and mushrooms. Sprinkle in the salt and pepper. Stir fry (see stir frying basics) for one minute.
585e83ef-b33d-4289-ace9-d85599407b45
Sprinkle in the sugar and add the rice wine. Stir fry for two to three minutes or until the vegetables are just beginning to get tender.
585e83ef-b33d-4289-ace9-d85599407b45
In a small bowl, stir together the soy sauce, lemon juice and starch with half a cup of water. Pour into the vegetables in the pan. Continue stir frying until the sauce is thick and clear. Cook a minute or two longer to make sure that the starch leaves no powdery sensation in the mouth.
585e83ef-b33d-4289-ace9-d85599407b45
Serve the vegan mushrooms and chayote stir fry topped with sliced scallions and fried garlic. Serve over rice or toss with cooked noodles.
f7f01e8d-7954-467b-b20e-a78ae875affe
Heat the butter in a frying pan.
f7f01e8d-7954-467b-b20e-a78ae875affe
Saute the onion until softened. Add the garlic and continue sauteeing for another half a minute.
f7f01e8d-7954-467b-b20e-a78ae875affe
Add the spinach to the pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the spinach is wilted and quite dry. Spinach contains a lot of water and you need to let all the water evaporate before proceeding to the next step.
f7f01e8d-7954-467b-b20e-a78ae875affe
Turn down the heat to low. Drop the cream cheese into the spinach by pinches. Cook, stirring, until the cream cheese has melted and no lumps remain.
f7f01e8d-7954-467b-b20e-a78ae875affe
Use a small ice cream scoop to drop mounds of the cheesy spinach mixture on top of the hash browns. Sprinkle with chili powder before serving.
6d254ee5-7f29-4c02-80b5-bd126b45acbf
Heat the butter and olive oil in a pan.
6d254ee5-7f29-4c02-80b5-bd126b45acbf
Saute the garlic for about 30 seconds.
6d254ee5-7f29-4c02-80b5-bd126b45acbf
Add the mushroom halves to the sauteed garlic. Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat, stirring often, for about a minute.
6d254ee5-7f29-4c02-80b5-bd126b45acbf
Throw in the cauliflower florets. Sprinkle with a little more salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, for a minute.
6d254ee5-7f29-4c02-80b5-bd126b45acbf
Pour in a tablespoon or so of water. Not a lot. Just enough to create steam. Cover the pan and let the cauliflower and mushrooms cook in the steam.
6d254ee5-7f29-4c02-80b5-bd126b45acbf
Scoop out the mushrooms and cauliflower and transfer to a shallow bowl or bowls.
6d254ee5-7f29-4c02-80b5-bd126b45acbf
Stir together the balsamic vinegar and extra virgin olive oil. Drizzle over the mushrooms and cauliflower.
6d254ee5-7f29-4c02-80b5-bd126b45acbf
Garnish the garlicky mushrooms and cauliflower with balsamic vinaigrette with toasted nuts and chopped parsley before serving.
6ed2bf06-9883-4b38-8e53-3ff6586bbefc
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Trim and discard the ends of the string beans. Cut the beans into two-inch lengths.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Smash the garlic and shake off the skins. Mince (or chop, if you prefer) the garlic.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Peel and finely slice the shallot.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Slice the button mushrooms. Thin or thick, that is entirely up to you.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Heat the cooking oil in a small frying pan. Saute the garlic and shallot for about half a minute.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Add the string beans and bay leaf to the pan. Sprinkle in the pepper. Continue sauteeing for another half a minute.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Pour in the vinegar and rice wine. Cover the pan. Set the heat to low. Cook the string beans for five to six minutes.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Turn up the heat to medium. Add the mushrooms to the pan. Cook, stirring, for about a minute or until the mushrooms are just starting to brown.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Drizzle in the soy sauce. Cook, stirring often, for another minute.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Taste and adjust the seasonings before serving you vegan string beans and mushrooms adobo.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Cook the quinoa according to package directions. Cool.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Peel and grate the garlic.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Peel and roughly chop the shallot.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Roughly chop the tomato and bell pepper.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Toss the quinoa with the grated garlic, chopped shallot, tomato and bell pepper.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
In a small bowl, make the dressing by stirring together the olive oil and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Drizzle the dressing over the quinoa salad and toss to blend.
d65e4502-9ebb-49ce-95bf-084dae31bff4
Sprinkle sliced scallions over the quinoa salad before serving.
46d9fb91-5d06-49a4-9b37-dc9e4cab71e2
ac3c3475-5c32-4232-a2d8-06b8cc6df499
Heat the vegetable broth in a pot.
ac3c3475-5c32-4232-a2d8-06b8cc6df499
When the broth starts to boil, add the green beans, carrot, sliced shiitake, corn kernels and onion flakes.
ac3c3475-5c32-4232-a2d8-06b8cc6df499
Season with salt and pepper.
ac3c3475-5c32-4232-a2d8-06b8cc6df499
When the broth starts to simmer, cover the pot, turn down the heat to low and simmer the vegetables and mushroom for five minutes.
ac3c3475-5c32-4232-a2d8-06b8cc6df499
Dissolve the starch in a tablespoon of water. Pour into soup. Stir well. Cover the pot once more and continue cooking the soup for another five minutes or until the vegetables are done.
ac3c3475-5c32-4232-a2d8-06b8cc6df499
Turn off the heat. Drizzle the beaten eggs into the soup in a circular motion. Let sit for about ten seconds (see two ways to make egg drop soup). Stir.
ac3c3475-5c32-4232-a2d8-06b8cc6df499
Serve the corn and mushroom egg drop soup while hot.
0f9d85d3-d4bd-4fd1-b9f6-9735409a9670
Rinse and scrub the pearl potatoes well. If more than one inch in diameter, you may want to cut them into halves or quarters. Place in a pan, cover with water, add the vinegar and about a teaspoon of salt. Bring to the boil. Lower the heat, cover and simmer until a skewer inserted at the center goes through with no resistance.
0f9d85d3-d4bd-4fd1-b9f6-9735409a9670
While the potatoes cook, steam the corn. How long this process takes depends on the variety of corn you use. On the average, 20 to 30 minutes should be long enough.
0f9d85d3-d4bd-4fd1-b9f6-9735409a9670
Drain the potatoes and transfer to a plate to cool.
0f9d85d3-d4bd-4fd1-b9f6-9735409a9670
Take the corn off the steamer and cool.
0f9d85d3-d4bd-4fd1-b9f6-9735409a9670
Roughly chop the red onion and bell pepper.
0f9d85d3-d4bd-4fd1-b9f6-9735409a9670
Take the cooled ears of corn and cut off the kernels.
0f9d85d3-d4bd-4fd1-b9f6-9735409a9670
Make the dressing. Place the butter and garlic in a microwaveable bowl. Heat on HIGH for 45 seconds to one minute or until the butter is fully melted. Stir in the lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
0f9d85d3-d4bd-4fd1-b9f6-9735409a9670
Place the potatoes, corn kernels, red onion, bell pepper, scallions and dill in a bowl. Toss to distribute the ingredients evenly. Pour in the dressing and toss some more.
0f9d85d3-d4bd-4fd1-b9f6-9735409a9670
Allow the potato corn salad with lemon butter garlic dressing to sit on the counter for about ten minutes before serving.
e27c6be9-f5f9-4694-b2f7-eb6fd845a763
In a frying pan, heat the olive oil and butter together.
e27c6be9-f5f9-4694-b2f7-eb6fd845a763
Add the mushrooms to the pan. Sprinkle with a little salt and pepper. Stir to coat each piece with oil. Over medium heat, cook the mushrooms with occasional stirring, until they start to caramelize and turn brown. It takes eight to ten minutes to get them to that stage.
e27c6be9-f5f9-4694-b2f7-eb6fd845a763
Add the chick peas and green beans to the mushrooms. Sprinkle with a little more salt and pepper. Add the cayenne and paprika. Cook for two to three minutes or just until the green beans are starting to turn a bright green.
e27c6be9-f5f9-4694-b2f7-eb6fd845a763
Stir in the lemon juice, balsamic vinegar and honey. Turn up the heat to high. Cook until the green beans are done (they should still be a little crisp) and the sauce has reduced and turned sticky. Taste and adjust the seasonings, as needed. Depending on your taste, you may want to add more lemon juice, salt or honey.
e27c6be9-f5f9-4694-b2f7-eb6fd845a763
Serve your honey balsamic mushrooms, green beans and chick peas over rice or toasted bread. Garnish with shredded cheese (omit for a vegan meal) and chopped parsley.

fb522a04-d4fb-4bca-a97d-41e48e2622b2
Ladle the soup into bowls. Garnish with slices of lime, finely sliced mint leaves and fried shallots.
0afe205c-6718-4f8b-bc48-2c35ffc95e9d
ba9ac5af-ba6b-4ab5-8293-d413c51a4b7e

1b12d61b-3c7f-4089-a206-1da0410811dc
e88b7cbf-45db-4f09-b428-a81d622a126a
Heat the cooking oil in a thick-bottomed pot. Sweat the onion and garlic until softened.
e88b7cbf-45db-4f09-b428-a81d622a126a
Add the carrot, beans and corn.
e88b7cbf-45db-4f09-b428-a81d622a126a
Pour in the broth. Add salt and pepper, as needed, depending on how well seasoned the broth is. Just remember that the spinach paste that you will be adding later is also salted so go easy on the seasonings at this point.
e88b7cbf-45db-4f09-b428-a81d622a126a
Bring the mixture to a simmer, set the heat to low, cover the pot and cook for about 10 minutes.
e88b7cbf-45db-4f09-b428-a81d622a126a
Add the zucchini.
e88b7cbf-45db-4f09-b428-a81d622a126a
Stir in the spinach paste.
e88b7cbf-45db-4f09-b428-a81d622a126a
Simmer the soup for another 10 minutes.
e88b7cbf-45db-4f09-b428-a81d622a126a
Taste and adjust the seasonings.
e88b7cbf-45db-4f09-b428-a81d622a126a
Off the heat, stir in some chopped parsley.
e88b7cbf-45db-4f09-b428-a81d622a126a
Top with shaved cheese (optional but recommended) and serve.

f80efdb9-adf4-4ba4-992c-59ac732acc1d

Heat 2 tablespoons of cooking oil and 2 tablespoons of butter.

Pour the sesame seed oil and vegetable oil into a wok or frying pan. Add the garlic, ginger, lemon zest, bay leaf and peppercorns. Heat the oil — over the lowest setting of your stove — for about five minutes or until fragrant. Scoop out all the spices and discard.
2cf78ef0-8a7f-4769-ae85-b29356cba7d8
ab3da97c-d952-443d-8cb9-292781f56922
Blanch the broccoli florets. Dump in an ice bath and drain well (see "What is blanching and how is it different from parboiling?").
08a0dba9-671d-4a49-9626-a0a316df5f0a

Reheat the pan. Cook the scallions for about 30 seconds and push to one side.
5bfdc90b-ea7b-4dfc-8797-ee65506cb3fa
01a64862-e159-4466-b689-6b5624726555
a960db5a-17e0-406a-bd87-728418348937

Sprinkle the soup with toasted garlic bits and fried shallots. Drizzle with a little sesame seed oil. Serve hot.
a40e860c-525a-4ff3-a1b5-31ddd009bfcd
In a wide pan, boil enough water to reach a depth of two inches. Sprinkle in the salt.
a40e860c-525a-4ff3-a1b5-31ddd009bfcd
When the water boils, spread the asparagus in it and cook for 3 to 4 minutes.
a40e860c-525a-4ff3-a1b5-31ddd009bfcd
Drain the asparagus and dump in a bowl of iced water to keep them crisp.
a40e860c-525a-4ff3-a1b5-31ddd009bfcd
In a small frying pan, melt the butter.
a40e860c-525a-4ff3-a1b5-31ddd009bfcd
Over medium heat, fry the garlic in the butter until browned and crisp.
a40e860c-525a-4ff3-a1b5-31ddd009bfcd
Arrange the asparagus on a plate. Pour the butter and garlic over them. Season with a little pepper.
